2288  int Threshold(const Consensus::Params& params) const { return params.nRuleChangeActivationThreshold; }
2289 
2290  bool Condition(const CBlockIndex* pindex, const Consensus::Params& params) const
2291  {
2292  return ((pindex->nVersion & VERSIONBITS_TOP_MASK) == VERSIONBITS_TOP_BITS) &&
2293  ((pindex->nVersion >> bit) & 1) != 0 &&
2294  ((ComputeBlockVersion(pindex->pprev, params) >> bit) & 1) == 0;
2295  }
2296 };
2297 
2298 // Protected by cs_main
2299 static ThresholdConditionCache warningcache[VERSIONBITS_NUM_BITS];
2300 
2301 static int64_t nTimeCheck = 0;
2302 static int64_t nTimeForks = 0;
2303 static int64_t nTimeVerify = 0;
2304 static int64_t nTimeConnect = 0;
2305 static int64_t nTimeIndex = 0;
2306 static int64_t nTimeCallbacks = 0;
2307 static int64_t nTimeTotal = 0;
2308 
2309 bool ConnectBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex,
2310  CCoinsViewCache& view, const CChainParams& chainparams, bool fJustCheck)
2311 {
2312  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2313 
2314  int64_t nTimeStart = GetTimeMicros();
2315 
2316  // Check it again in case a previous version let a bad block in
2317  if (!CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), !fJustCheck, !fJustCheck))
2318  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckBlock: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
2319 
2320  // verify that the view's current state corresponds to the previous block
2321  uint256 hashPrevBlock = pindex->pprev == NULL ? uint256() : pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash();
2322  assert(hashPrevBlock == view.GetBestBlock());
2323 
2324  // Special case for the genesis block, skipping connection of its transactions
2325  // (its coinbase is unspendable)
2326  if (block.GetHash() == chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock) {
2327  if (!fJustCheck)
2328  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->GetBlockHash());
2329  return true;
2330  }
2331 
2332  bool fScriptChecks = true;
2333  if (fCheckpointsEnabled) {
2334  CBlockIndex *pindexLastCheckpoint = Checkpoints::GetLastCheckpoint(chainparams.Checkpoints());
2335  if (pindexLastCheckpoint && pindexLastCheckpoint->GetAncestor(pindex->nHeight) == pindex) {
2336  // This block is an ancestor of a checkpoint: disable script checks
2337  fScriptChecks = false;
2338  }
2339  }
2340 
2341  int64_t nTime1 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeCheck += nTime1 - nTimeStart;
2342  LogPrint("bench", " - Sanity checks: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", 0.001 * (nTime1 - nTimeStart), nTimeCheck * 0.000001);
2343 
2344  // Do not allow blocks that contain transactions which 'overwrite' older transactions,
2345  // unless those are already completely spent.
2346  // If such overwrites are allowed, coinbases and transactions depending upon those
2347  // can be duplicated to remove the ability to spend the first instance -- even after
2348  // being sent to another address.
2349  // See BIP30 and http://r6.ca/blog/20120206T005236Z.html for more information.
2350  // This logic is not necessary for memory pool transactions, as AcceptToMemoryPool
2351  // already refuses previously-known transaction ids entirely.
2352  // This rule was originally applied to all blocks with a timestamp after March 15, 2012, 0:00 UTC.
2353  // Now that the whole chain is irreversibly beyond that time it is applied to all blocks except the
2354  // two in the chain that violate it. This prevents exploiting the issue against nodes during their
2355  // initial block download.
2356  bool fEnforceBIP30 = (!pindex->phashBlock) || // Enforce on CreateNewBlock invocations which don't have a hash.
2357  !((pindex->nHeight==91842 && pindex->GetBlockHash() == uint256S("0x00000000000a4d0a398161ffc163c503763b1f4360639393e0e4c8e300e0caec")) ||
2358  (pindex->nHeight==91880 && pindex->GetBlockHash() == uint256S("0x00000000000743f190a18c5577a3c2d2a1f610ae9601ac046a38084ccb7cd721")));
2359 
2360  // Once BIP34 activated it was not possible to create new duplicate coinbases and thus other than starting
2361  // with the 2 existing duplicate coinbase pairs, not possible to create overwriting txs. But by the
2362  // time BIP34 activated, in each of the existing pairs the duplicate coinbase had overwritten the first
2363  // before the first had been spent. Since those coinbases are sufficiently buried its no longer possible to create further
2364  // duplicate transactions descending from the known pairs either.
2365  // If we're on the known chain at height greater than where BIP34 activated, we can save the db accesses needed for the BIP30 check.
2366  CBlockIndex *pindexBIP34height = pindex->pprev->GetAncestor(chainparams.GetConsensus().BIP34Height);
2367  //Only continue to enforce if we're below BIP34 activation height or the block hash at that height doesn't correspond.
2368  fEnforceBIP30 = fEnforceBIP30 && (!pindexBIP34height || !(pindexBIP34height->GetBlockHash() == chainparams.GetConsensus().BIP34Hash));
2369 
2370  if (fEnforceBIP30) {
2371  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx) {
2372  const CCoins* coins = view.AccessCoins(tx.GetHash());
2373  if (coins && !coins->IsPruned())
2374  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock(): tried to overwrite transaction"),
2375  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-BIP30");
2376  }
2377  }
2378 
2379  // BIP16 didn't become active until Apr 1 2012
2380  int64_t nBIP16SwitchTime = 1333238400;
2381  bool fStrictPayToScriptHash = (pindex->GetBlockTime() >= nBIP16SwitchTime);
2382 
2383  unsigned int flags = fStrictPayToScriptHash ? SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH : SCRIPT_VERIFY_NONE;
2384 
2385  // Start enforcing the DERSIG (BIP66) rule
2386  if (pindex->nHeight >= chainparams.GetConsensus().BIP66Height) {
2387  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_DERSIG;
2388  }
2389 
2390  // Start enforcing CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY (BIP65) rule
2391  if (pindex->nHeight >= chainparams.GetConsensus().BIP65Height) {
2392  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY;
2393  }
2394 
2395  // Start enforcing BIP68 (sequence locks) and BIP112 (CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY) using versionbits logic.
2396  int nLockTimeFlags = 0;
2397  if (VersionBitsState(pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus(), Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_CSV, versionbitscache) == THRESHOLD_ACTIVE) {
2398  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY;
2399  nLockTimeFlags |= LOCKTIME_VERIFY_SEQUENCE;
2400  }
2401 
2402  // Start enforcing WITNESS rules using versionbits logic.
2403  if (IsWitnessEnabled(pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus())) {
2404  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS;
2405  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_NULLDUMMY;
2406  }
2407 
2408  int64_t nTime2 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeForks += nTime2 - nTime1;
2409  LogPrint("bench", " - Fork checks: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", 0.001 * (nTime2 - nTime1), nTimeForks * 0.000001);
2410 
2411  CBlockUndo blockundo;
2412 
2413  CCheckQueueControl<CScriptCheck> control(fScriptChecks && nScriptCheckThreads ? &scriptcheckqueue : NULL);
2414 
2415  std::vector<uint256> vOrphanErase;
2416  std::vector<int> prevheights;
2417  CAmount nFees = 0;
2418  int nInputs = 0;
2419  int64_t nSigOpsCost = 0;
2420  CDiskTxPos pos(pindex->GetBlockPos(), GetSizeOfCompactSize(block.vtx.size()));
2421  std::vector<std::pair<uint256, CDiskTxPos> > vPos;
2422  vPos.reserve(block.vtx.size());
2423  blockundo.vtxundo.reserve(block.vtx.size() - 1);
2424  std::vector<PrecomputedTransactionData> txdata;
2425  txdata.reserve(block.vtx.size()); // Required so that pointers to individual PrecomputedTransactionData don't get invalidated
2426  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < block.vtx.size(); i++)
2427  {
2428  const CTransaction &tx = block.vtx[i];
2429 
2430  nInputs += tx.vin.size();
2431 
2432  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
2433  {
2434  if (!view.HaveInputs(tx))
2435  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock(): inputs missing/spent"),
2436  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-inputs-missingorspent");
2437 
2438  // Check that transaction is BIP68 final
2439  // BIP68 lock checks (as opposed to nLockTime checks) must
2440  // be in ConnectBlock because they require the UTXO set
2441  prevheights.resize(tx.vin.size());
2442  for (size_t j = 0; j < tx.vin.size(); j++) {
2443  prevheights[j] = view.AccessCoins(tx.vin[j].prevout.hash)->nHeight;
2444  }
2445 
2446  // Which orphan pool entries must we evict?
2447  for (size_t j = 0; j < tx.vin.size(); j++) {
2448  auto itByPrev = mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.find(tx.vin[j].prevout);
2449  if (itByPrev == mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.end()) continue;
2450  for (auto mi = itByPrev->second.begin(); mi != itByPrev->second.end(); ++mi) {
2451  const CTransaction& orphanTx = (*mi)->second.tx;
2452  const uint256& orphanHash = orphanTx.GetHash();
2453  vOrphanErase.push_back(orphanHash);
2454  }
2455  }
2456 
2457  if (!SequenceLocks(tx, nLockTimeFlags, &prevheights, *pindex)) {
2458  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: contains a non-BIP68-final transaction", __func__),
2459  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-nonfinal");
2460  }
2461  }
2462 
2463  // GetTransactionSigOpCost counts 3 types of sigops:
2464  // * legacy (always)
2465  // * p2sh (when P2SH enabled in flags and excludes coinbase)
2466  // * witness (when witness enabled in flags and excludes coinbase)
2467  nSigOpsCost += GetTransactionSigOpCost(tx, view, flags);
2468  if (nSigOpsCost > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS_COST)
2469  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock(): too many sigops"),
2470  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-sigops");
2471 
2472  txdata.emplace_back(tx);
2473  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
2474  {
2475  nFees += view.GetValueIn(tx)-tx.GetValueOut();
2476 
2477  std::vector<CScriptCheck> vChecks;
2478  bool fCacheResults = fJustCheck; /* Don't cache results if we're actually connecting blocks (still consult the cache, though) */
2479  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, fScriptChecks, flags, fCacheResults, txdata[i], nScriptCheckThreads ? &vChecks : NULL))
2480  return error("ConnectBlock(): CheckInputs on %s failed with %s",
2481  tx.GetHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
2482  control.Add(vChecks);
2483  }
2484 
2485  CTxUndo undoDummy;
2486  if (i > 0) {
2487  blockundo.vtxundo.push_back(CTxUndo());
2488  }
2489  UpdateCoins(tx, view, i == 0 ? undoDummy : blockundo.vtxundo.back(), pindex->nHeight);
2490 
2491  vPos.push_back(std::make_pair(tx.GetHash(), pos));
2492  pos.nTxOffset += ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2493  }
2494  int64_t nTime3 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeConnect += nTime3 - nTime2;
2495  LogPrint("bench", " - Connect %u transactions: %.2fms (%.3fms/tx, %.3fms/txin) [%.2fs]\n", (unsigned)block.vtx.size(), 0.001 * (nTime3 - nTime2), 0.001 * (nTime3 - nTime2) / block.vtx.size(), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : 0.001 * (nTime3 - nTime2) / (nInputs-1), nTimeConnect * 0.000001);
2496 
2497  CAmount blockReward = nFees + GetBlockSubsidy(pindex->nHeight, chainparams.GetConsensus());
2498  if (block.vtx[0].GetValueOut() > blockReward)
2499  return state.DoS(100,
2500  error("ConnectBlock(): coinbase pays too much (actual=%d vs limit=%d)",
2501  block.vtx[0].GetValueOut(), blockReward),
2502  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-amount");
2503 
2504  if (!control.Wait())
2505  return state.DoS(100, false);
2506  int64_t nTime4 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeVerify += nTime4 - nTime2;
2507  LogPrint("bench", " - Verify %u txins: %.2fms (%.3fms/txin) [%.2fs]\n", nInputs - 1, 0.001 * (nTime4 - nTime2), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : 0.001 * (nTime4 - nTime2) / (nInputs-1), nTimeVerify * 0.000001);
2508 
2509  if (fJustCheck)
2510  return true;
2511 
2512  // Write undo information to disk
2513  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull() || !pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS))
2514  {
2515  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull()) {
2516  CDiskBlockPos _pos;
2517  if (!FindUndoPos(state, pindex->nFile, _pos, ::GetSerializeSize(blockundo, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION) + 40))
2518  return error("ConnectBlock(): FindUndoPos failed");
2519  if (!UndoWriteToDisk(blockundo, _pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash(), chainparams.MessageStart()))
2520  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to write undo data");
2521 
2522  // update nUndoPos in block index
2523  pindex->nUndoPos = _pos.nPos;
2524  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO;
2525  }
2526 
2527  pindex->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS);
2528  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
2529  }
2530 
2531  if (fTxIndex)
2532  if (!pblocktree->WriteTxIndex(vPos))
2533  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to write transaction index");
2534 
2535  // add this block to the view's block chain
2536  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->GetBlockHash());
2537 
2538  int64_t nTime5 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeIndex += nTime5 - nTime4;
2539  LogPrint("bench", " - Index writing: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", 0.001 * (nTime5 - nTime4), nTimeIndex * 0.000001);
2540 
2541  // Watch for changes to the previous coinbase transaction.
2542  static uint256 hashPrevBestCoinBase;
2543  GetMainSignals().UpdatedTransaction(hashPrevBestCoinBase);
2544  hashPrevBestCoinBase = block.vtx[0].GetHash();
2545 
2546  // Erase orphan transactions include or precluded by this block
2547  if (vOrphanErase.size()) {
2548  int nErased = 0;
2549  BOOST_FOREACH(uint256 &orphanHash, vOrphanErase) {
2550  nErased += EraseOrphanTx(orphanHash);
2551  }
2552  LogPrint("mempool", "Erased %d orphan tx included or conflicted by block\n", nErased);
2553  }
2554 
2555  int64_t nTime6 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeCallbacks += nTime6 - nTime5;
2556  LogPrint("bench", " - Callbacks: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", 0.001 * (nTime6 - nTime5), nTimeCallbacks * 0.000001);
2557 
2558  return true;
2559 }
2560 
2561 enum FlushStateMode {
2562  FLUSH_STATE_NONE,
2563  FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED,
2564  FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC,
2565  FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS
2566 };
2567 
2574 bool static FlushStateToDisk(CValidationState &state, FlushStateMode mode) {
2575  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
2576  LOCK2(cs_main, cs_LastBlockFile);
2577  static int64_t nLastWrite = 0;
2578  static int64_t nLastFlush = 0;
2579  static int64_t nLastSetChain = 0;
2580  std::set<int> setFilesToPrune;
2581  bool fFlushForPrune = false;
2582  try {
2583  if (fPruneMode && fCheckForPruning && !fReindex) {
2584  FindFilesToPrune(setFilesToPrune, chainparams.PruneAfterHeight());
2585  fCheckForPruning = false;
2586  if (!setFilesToPrune.empty()) {
2587  fFlushForPrune = true;
2588  if (!fHavePruned) {
2589  pblocktree->WriteFlag("prunedblockfiles", true);
2590  fHavePruned = true;
2591  }
2592  }
2593  }
2594  int64_t nNow = GetTimeMicros();
2595  // Avoid writing/flushing immediately after startup.
2596  if (nLastWrite == 0) {
2597  nLastWrite = nNow;
2598  }
2599  if (nLastFlush == 0) {
2600  nLastFlush = nNow;
2601  }
2602  if (nLastSetChain == 0) {
2603  nLastSetChain = nNow;
2604  }
2605  size_t cacheSize = pcoinsTip->DynamicMemoryUsage();
2606  // The cache is large and close to the limit, but we have time now (not in the middle of a block processing).
2607  bool fCacheLarge = mode == FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC && cacheSize * (10.0/9) > nCoinCacheUsage;
2608  // The cache is over the limit, we have to write now.
2609  bool fCacheCritical = mode == FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED && cacheSize > nCoinCacheUsage;
2610  // It's been a while since we wrote the block index to disk. Do this frequently, so we don't need to redownload after a crash.
2611  bool fPeriodicWrite = mode == FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC && nNow > nLastWrite + (int64_t)DATABASE_WRITE_INTERVAL * 1000000;
2612  // It's been very long since we flushed the cache. Do this infrequently, to optimize cache usage.
2613  bool fPeriodicFlush = mode == FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC && nNow > nLastFlush + (int64_t)DATABASE_FLUSH_INTERVAL * 1000000;
2614  // Combine all conditions that result in a full cache flush.
2615  bool fDoFullFlush = (mode == FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS) || fCacheLarge || fCacheCritical || fPeriodicFlush || fFlushForPrune;
2616  // Write blocks and block index to disk.
2617  if (fDoFullFlush || fPeriodicWrite) {
2618  // Depend on nMinDiskSpace to ensure we can write block index
2619  if (!CheckDiskSpace(0))
2620  return state.Error("out of disk space");
2621  // First make sure all block and undo data is flushed to disk.
2622  FlushBlockFile();
2623  // Then update all block file information (which may refer to block and undo files).
2624  {
2625  std::vector<std::pair<int, const CBlockFileInfo*> > vFiles;
2626  vFiles.reserve(setDirtyFileInfo.size());
2627  for (set<int>::iterator it = setDirtyFileInfo.begin(); it != setDirtyFileInfo.end(); ) {
2628  vFiles.push_back(make_pair(*it, &vinfoBlockFile[*it]));
2629  setDirtyFileInfo.erase(it++);
2630  }
2631  std::vector<const CBlockIndex*> vBlocks;
2632  vBlocks.reserve(setDirtyBlockIndex.size());
2633  for (set<CBlockIndex*>::iterator it = setDirtyBlockIndex.begin(); it != setDirtyBlockIndex.end(); ) {
2634  vBlocks.push_back(*it);
2635  setDirtyBlockIndex.erase(it++);
2636  }
2637  if (!pblocktree->WriteBatchSync(vFiles, nLastBlockFile, vBlocks)) {
2638  return AbortNode(state, "Files to write to block index database");
2639  }
2640  }
2641  // Finally remove any pruned files
2642  if (fFlushForPrune)
2643  UnlinkPrunedFiles(setFilesToPrune);
2644  nLastWrite = nNow;
2645  }
2646  // Flush best chain related state. This can only be done if the blocks / block index write was also done.
2647  if (fDoFullFlush) {
2648  // Typical CCoins structures on disk are around 128 bytes in size.
2649  // Pushing a new one to the database can cause it to be written
2650  // twice (once in the log, and once in the tables). This is already
2651  // an overestimation, as most will delete an existing entry or
2652  // overwrite one. Still, use a conservative safety factor of 2.
2653  if (!CheckDiskSpace(128 * 2 * 2 * pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize()))
2654  return state.Error("out of disk space");
2655  // Flush the chainstate (which may refer to block index entries).
2656  if (!pcoinsTip->Flush())
2657  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to write to coin database");
2658  nLastFlush = nNow;
2659  }
2660  if (fDoFullFlush || ((mode == FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS || mode == FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC) && nNow > nLastSetChain + (int64_t)DATABASE_WRITE_INTERVAL * 1000000)) {
2661  // Update best block in wallet (so we can detect restored wallets).
2662  GetMainSignals().SetBestChain(chainActive.GetLocator());
2663  nLastSetChain = nNow;
2664  }
2665  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
2666  return AbortNode(state, std::string("System error while flushing: ") + e.what());
2667  }
2668  return true;
2669 }
2670 
2671 void FlushStateToDisk() {
2672  CValidationState state;
2673  FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS);
2674 }
2675 
2676 void PruneAndFlush() {
2677  CValidationState state;
2678  fCheckForPruning = true;
2679  FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_NONE);
2680 }
2681 
2683 void static UpdateTip(CBlockIndex *pindexNew, const CChainParams& chainParams) {
2684  chainActive.SetTip(pindexNew);
2685 
2686  // New best block
2687  nTimeBestReceived = GetTime();
2688  mempool.AddTransactionsUpdated(1);
2689 
2690  cvBlockChange.notify_all();
2691 
2692  static bool fWarned = false;
2693  std::vector<std::string> warningMessages;
2694  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload())
2695  {
2696  int nUpgraded = 0;
2697  const CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive.Tip();
2698  for (int bit = 0; bit < VERSIONBITS_NUM_BITS; bit++) {
2699  WarningBitsConditionChecker checker(bit);
2700  ThresholdState state = checker.GetStateFor(pindex, chainParams.GetConsensus(), warningcache[bit]);
2701  if (state == THRESHOLD_ACTIVE || state == THRESHOLD_LOCKED_IN) {
2702  if (state == THRESHOLD_ACTIVE) {
2703  strMiscWarning = strprintf(_("Warning: unknown new rules activated (versionbit %i)"), bit);
2704  if (!fWarned) {
2705  AlertNotify(strMiscWarning);
2706  fWarned = true;
2707  }
2708  } else {
2709  warningMessages.push_back(strprintf("unknown new rules are about to activate (versionbit %i)", bit));
2710  }
2711  }
2712  }
2713  // Check the version of the last 100 blocks to see if we need to upgrade:
2714  for (int i = 0; i < 100 && pindex != NULL; i++)
2715  {
2716  int32_t nExpectedVersion = ComputeBlockVersion(pindex->pprev, chainParams.GetConsensus());
2717  if (pindex->nVersion > VERSIONBITS_LAST_OLD_BLOCK_VERSION && (pindex->nVersion & ~nExpectedVersion) != 0)
2718  ++nUpgraded;
2719  pindex = pindex->pprev;
2720  }
2721  if (nUpgraded > 0)
2722  warningMessages.push_back(strprintf("%d of last 100 blocks have unexpected version", nUpgraded));
2723  if (nUpgraded > 100/2)
2724  {
2725  // strMiscWarning is read by GetWarnings(), called by Qt and the JSON-RPC code to warn the user:
2726  strMiscWarning = _("Warning: Unknown block versions being mined! It's possible unknown rules are in effect");
2727  if (!fWarned) {
2728  AlertNotify(strMiscWarning);
2729  fWarned = true;
2730  }
2731  }
2732  }
2733  LogPrintf("%s: new best=%s height=%d version=0x%08x log2_work=%.8g tx=%lu date='%s' progress=%f cache=%.1fMiB(%utx)", __func__,
2734  chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash().ToString(), chainActive.Height(), chainActive.Tip()->nVersion,
2735  log(chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0), (unsigned long)chainActive.Tip()->nChainTx,
2736  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime()),
2737  Checkpoints::GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.Checkpoints(), chainActive.Tip()), pcoinsTip->DynamicMemoryUsage() * (1.0 / (1<<20)), pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize());
2738  if (!warningMessages.empty())
2739  LogPrintf(" warning='%s'", boost::algorithm::join(warningMessages, ", "));
2740  LogPrintf("\n");
2741 
2742 }
2743 
2745 bool static DisconnectTip(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, bool fBare = false)
2746 {
2747  CBlockIndex *pindexDelete = chainActive.Tip();
2748  assert(pindexDelete);
2749  // Read block from disk.
2750  CBlock block;
2751  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexDelete, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
2752  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to read block");
2753  // Apply the block atomically to the chain state.
2754  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMicros();
2755  {
2756  CCoinsViewCache view(pcoinsTip);
2757  if (!DisconnectBlock(block, state, pindexDelete, view))
2758  return error("DisconnectTip(): DisconnectBlock %s failed", pindexDelete->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2759  assert(view.Flush());
2760  }
2761  LogPrint("bench", "- Disconnect block: %.2fms\n", (GetTimeMicros() - nStart) * 0.001);
2762  // Write the chain state to disk, if necessary.
2763  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED))
2764  return false;
2765 
2766  if (!fBare) {
2767  // Resurrect mempool transactions from the disconnected block.
2768  std::vector<uint256> vHashUpdate;
2769  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction &tx, block.vtx) {
2770  // ignore validation errors in resurrected transactions
2771  list<CTransaction> removed;
2772  CValidationState stateDummy;
2773  if (tx.IsCoinBase() || !AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, stateDummy, tx, false, NULL, true)) {
2774  mempool.removeRecursive(tx, removed);
2775  } else if (mempool.exists(tx.GetHash())) {
2776  vHashUpdate.push_back(tx.GetHash());
2777  }
2778  }
2779  // AcceptToMemoryPool/addUnchecked all assume that new mempool entries have
2780  // no in-mempool children, which is generally not true when adding
2781  // previously-confirmed transactions back to the mempool.
2782  // UpdateTransactionsFromBlock finds descendants of any transactions in this
2783  // block that were added back and cleans up the mempool state.
2784  mempool.UpdateTransactionsFromBlock(vHashUpdate);
2785  }
2786 
2787  // Update chainActive and related variables.
2788  UpdateTip(pindexDelete->pprev, chainparams);
2789  // Let wallets know transactions went from 1-confirmed to
2790  // 0-confirmed or conflicted:
2791  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction &tx, block.vtx) {
2792  GetMainSignals().SyncTransaction(tx, pindexDelete->pprev, CMainSignals::SYNC_TRANSACTION_NOT_IN_BLOCK);
2793  }
2794  return true;
2795 }
2796 
2797 static int64_t nTimeReadFromDisk = 0;
2798 static int64_t nTimeConnectTotal = 0;
2799 static int64_t nTimeFlush = 0;
2800 static int64_t nTimeChainState = 0;
2801 static int64_t nTimePostConnect = 0;
2802 
2807 bool static ConnectTip(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexNew, const CBlock* pblock, std::list<CTransaction> &txConflicted, std::vector<std::tuple<CTransaction,CBlockIndex*,int>> &txChanged)
2808 {
2809  assert(pindexNew->pprev == chainActive.Tip());
2810  // Read block from disk.
2811  int64_t nTime1 = GetTimeMicros();
2812  CBlock block;
2813  if (!pblock) {
2814  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexNew, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
2815  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to read block");
2816  pblock = &block;
2817  }
2818  // Apply the block atomically to the chain state.
2819  int64_t nTime2 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeReadFromDisk += nTime2 - nTime1;
2820  int64_t nTime3;
2821  LogPrint("bench", " - Load block from disk: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime2 - nTime1) * 0.001, nTimeReadFromDisk * 0.000001);
2822  {
2823  CCoinsViewCache view(pcoinsTip);
2824  bool rv = ConnectBlock(*pblock, state, pindexNew, view, chainparams);
2825  GetMainSignals().BlockChecked(*pblock, state);
2826  if (!rv) {
2827  if (state.IsInvalid())
2828  InvalidBlockFound(pindexNew, state);
2829  return error("ConnectTip(): ConnectBlock %s failed", pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2830  }
2831  nTime3 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeConnectTotal += nTime3 - nTime2;
2832  LogPrint("bench", " - Connect total: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime3 - nTime2) * 0.001, nTimeConnectTotal * 0.000001);
2833  assert(view.Flush());
2834  }
2835  int64_t nTime4 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeFlush += nTime4 - nTime3;
2836  LogPrint("bench", " - Flush: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime4 - nTime3) * 0.001, nTimeFlush * 0.000001);
2837  // Write the chain state to disk, if necessary.
2838  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED))
2839  return false;
2840  int64_t nTime5 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeChainState += nTime5 - nTime4;
2841  LogPrint("bench", " - Writing chainstate: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime5 - nTime4) * 0.001, nTimeChainState * 0.000001);
2842  // Remove conflicting transactions from the mempool.;
2843  mempool.removeForBlock(pblock->vtx, pindexNew->nHeight, txConflicted, !IsInitialBlockDownload());
2844  // Update chainActive & related variables.
2845  UpdateTip(pindexNew, chainparams);
2846 
2847  for(unsigned int i=0; i < pblock->vtx.size(); i++)
2848  txChanged.emplace_back(pblock->vtx[i], pindexNew, i);
2849 
2850  int64_t nTime6 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimePostConnect += nTime6 - nTime5; nTimeTotal += nTime6 - nTime1;
2851  LogPrint("bench", " - Connect postprocess: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime6 - nTime5) * 0.001, nTimePostConnect * 0.000001);
2852  LogPrint("bench", "- Connect block: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime6 - nTime1) * 0.001, nTimeTotal * 0.000001);
2853  return true;
2854 }
2855 
2860 static CBlockIndex* FindMostWorkChain() {
2861  do {
2862  CBlockIndex *pindexNew = NULL;
2863 
2864  // Find the best candidate header.
2865  {
2866  std::set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::reverse_iterator it = setBlockIndexCandidates.rbegin();
2867  if (it == setBlockIndexCandidates.rend())
2868  return NULL;
2869  pindexNew = *it;
2870  }
2871 
2872  // Check whether all blocks on the path between the currently active chain and the candidate are valid.
2873  // Just going until the active chain is an optimization, as we know all blocks in it are valid already.
2874  CBlockIndex *pindexTest = pindexNew;
2875  bool fInvalidAncestor = false;
2876  while (pindexTest && !chainActive.Contains(pindexTest)) {
2877  assert(pindexTest->nChainTx || pindexTest->nHeight == 0);
2878 
2879  // Pruned nodes may have entries in setBlockIndexCandidates for
2880  // which block files have been deleted. Remove those as candidates
2881  // for the most work chain if we come across them; we can't switch
2882  // to a chain unless we have all the non-active-chain parent blocks.
2883  bool fFailedChain = pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
2884  bool fMissingData = !(pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA);
2885  if (fFailedChain || fMissingData) {
2886  // Candidate chain is not usable (either invalid or missing data)
2887  if (fFailedChain && (pindexBestInvalid == NULL || pindexNew->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork))
2888  pindexBestInvalid = pindexNew;
2889  CBlockIndex *pindexFailed = pindexNew;
2890  // Remove the entire chain from the set.
2891  while (pindexTest != pindexFailed) {
2892  if (fFailedChain) {
2893  pindexFailed->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
2894  } else if (fMissingData) {
2895  // If we're missing data, then add back to mapBlocksUnlinked,
2896  // so that if the block arrives in the future we can try adding
2897  // to setBlockIndexCandidates again.
2898  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindexFailed->pprev, pindexFailed));
2899  }
2900  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexFailed);
2901  pindexFailed = pindexFailed->pprev;
2902  }
2903  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexTest);
2904  fInvalidAncestor = true;
2905  break;
2906  }
2907  pindexTest = pindexTest->pprev;
2908  }
2909  if (!fInvalidAncestor)
2910  return pindexNew;
2911  } while(true);
2912 }
2913 
2915 static void PruneBlockIndexCandidates() {
2916  // Note that we can't delete the current block itself, as we may need to return to it later in case a
2917  // reorganization to a better block fails.
2918  std::set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::iterator it = setBlockIndexCandidates.begin();
2919  while (it != setBlockIndexCandidates.end() && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(*it, chainActive.Tip())) {
2920  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(it++);
2921  }
2922  // Either the current tip or a successor of it we're working towards is left in setBlockIndexCandidates.
2923  assert(!setBlockIndexCandidates.empty());
2924 }
2925 
2930 static bool ActivateBestChainStep(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, const CBlock* pblock, bool& fInvalidFound, std::list<CTransaction>& txConflicted, std::vector<std::tuple<CTransaction,CBlockIndex*,int>>& txChanged)
2931 {
2932  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2933  const CBlockIndex *pindexOldTip = chainActive.Tip();
2934  const CBlockIndex *pindexFork = chainActive.FindFork(pindexMostWork);
2935 
2936  // Disconnect active blocks which are no longer in the best chain.
2937  bool fBlocksDisconnected = false;
2938  while (chainActive.Tip() && chainActive.Tip() != pindexFork) {
2939  if (!DisconnectTip(state, chainparams))
2940  return false;
2941  fBlocksDisconnected = true;
2942  }
2943 
2944  // Build list of new blocks to connect.
2945  std::vector<CBlockIndex*> vpindexToConnect;
2946  bool fContinue = true;
2947  int nHeight = pindexFork ? pindexFork->nHeight : -1;
2948  while (fContinue && nHeight != pindexMostWork->nHeight) {
2949  // Don't iterate the entire list of potential improvements toward the best tip, as we likely only need
2950  // a few blocks along the way.
2951  int nTargetHeight = std::min(nHeight + 32, pindexMostWork->nHeight);
2952  vpindexToConnect.clear();
2953  vpindexToConnect.reserve(nTargetHeight - nHeight);
2954  CBlockIndex *pindexIter = pindexMostWork->GetAncestor(nTargetHeight);
2955  while (pindexIter && pindexIter->nHeight != nHeight) {
2956  vpindexToConnect.push_back(pindexIter);
2957  pindexIter = pindexIter->pprev;
2958  }
2959  nHeight = nTargetHeight;
2960 
2961  // Connect new blocks.
2962  BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH(CBlockIndex *pindexConnect, vpindexToConnect) {
2963  if (!ConnectTip(state, chainparams, pindexConnect, pindexConnect == pindexMostWork ? pblock : NULL, txConflicted, txChanged)) {
2964  if (state.IsInvalid()) {
2965  // The block violates a consensus rule.
2966  if (!state.CorruptionPossible())
2967  InvalidChainFound(vpindexToConnect.back());
2968  state = CValidationState();
2969  fInvalidFound = true;
2970  fContinue = false;
2971  break;
2972  } else {
2973  // A system error occurred (disk space, database error, ...).
2974  return false;
2975  }
2976  } else {
2977  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
2978  if (!pindexOldTip || chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork > pindexOldTip->nChainWork) {
2979  // We're in a better position than we were. Return temporarily to release the lock.
2980  fContinue = false;
2981  break;
2982  }
2983  }
2984  }
2985  }
2986 
2987  if (fBlocksDisconnected) {
2988  mempool.removeForReorg(pcoinsTip, chainActive.Tip()->nHeight + 1, STANDARD_LOCKTIME_VERIFY_FLAGS);
2989  LimitMempoolSize(mempool, GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000, GetArg("-mempoolexpiry", DEFAULT_MEMPOOL_EXPIRY) * 60 * 60);
2990  }
2991  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
2992 
2993  // Callbacks/notifications for a new best chain.
2994  if (fInvalidFound)
2995  CheckForkWarningConditionsOnNewFork(vpindexToConnect.back());
2996  else
2997  CheckForkWarningConditions();
2998 
2999  return true;
3000 }
3001 
3002 static void NotifyHeaderTip() {
3003  bool fNotify = false;
3004  bool fInitialBlockDownload = false;
3005  static CBlockIndex* pindexHeaderOld = NULL;
3006  CBlockIndex* pindexHeader = NULL;
3007  {
3008  LOCK(cs_main);
3009  if (!setBlockIndexCandidates.empty()) {
3010  pindexHeader = *setBlockIndexCandidates.rbegin();
3011  }
3012  if (pindexHeader != pindexHeaderOld) {
3013  fNotify = true;
3014  fInitialBlockDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
3015  pindexHeaderOld = pindexHeader;
3016  }
3017  }
3018  // Send block tip changed notifications without cs_main
3019  if (fNotify) {
3020  uiInterface.NotifyHeaderTip(fInitialBlockDownload, pindexHeader);
3021  }
3022 }
3023 
3029 bool ActivateBestChain(CValidationState &state, const CChainParams& chainparams, const CBlock *pblock) {
3030  CBlockIndex *pindexMostWork = NULL;
3031  CBlockIndex *pindexNewTip = NULL;
3032  std::vector<std::tuple<CTransaction,CBlockIndex*,int>> txChanged;
3033  if (pblock)
3034  txChanged.reserve(pblock->vtx.size());
3035  do {
3036  txChanged.clear();
3037  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3038  if (ShutdownRequested())
3039  break;
3040 
3041  const CBlockIndex *pindexFork;
3042  std::list<CTransaction> txConflicted;
3043  bool fInitialDownload;
3044  {
3045  LOCK(cs_main);
3046  CBlockIndex *pindexOldTip = chainActive.Tip();
3047  if (pindexMostWork == NULL) {
3048  pindexMostWork = FindMostWorkChain();
3049  }
3050 
3051  // Whether we have anything to do at all.
3052  if (pindexMostWork == NULL || pindexMostWork == chainActive.Tip())
3053  return true;
3054 
3055  bool fInvalidFound = false;
3056  if (!ActivateBestChainStep(state, chainparams, pindexMostWork, pblock && pblock->GetHash() == pindexMostWork->GetBlockHash() ? pblock : NULL, fInvalidFound, txConflicted, txChanged))
3057  return false;
3058 
3059  if (fInvalidFound) {
3060  // Wipe cache, we may need another branch now.
3061  pindexMostWork = NULL;
3062  }
3063  pindexNewTip = chainActive.Tip();
3064  pindexFork = chainActive.FindFork(pindexOldTip);
3065  fInitialDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
3066  }
3067  // When we reach this point, we switched to a new tip (stored in pindexNewTip).
3068 
3069  // Notifications/callbacks that can run without cs_main
3070 
3071  // throw all transactions though the signal-interface
3072  // while _not_ holding the cs_main lock
3073  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction &tx, txConflicted)
3074  {
3075  GetMainSignals().SyncTransaction(tx, pindexNewTip, CMainSignals::SYNC_TRANSACTION_NOT_IN_BLOCK);
3076  }
3077  // ... and about transactions that got confirmed:
3078  for(unsigned int i = 0; i < txChanged.size(); i++)
3079  GetMainSignals().SyncTransaction(std::get<0>(txChanged[i]), std::get<1>(txChanged[i]), std::get<2>(txChanged[i]));
3080 
3081  // Notify external listeners about the new tip.
3082  GetMainSignals().UpdatedBlockTip(pindexNewTip, pindexFork, fInitialDownload);
3083 
3084  // Always notify the UI if a new block tip was connected
3085  if (pindexFork != pindexNewTip) {
3086  uiInterface.NotifyBlockTip(fInitialDownload, pindexNewTip);
3087  }
3088  } while (pindexNewTip != pindexMostWork);
3089  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
3090 
3091  // Write changes periodically to disk, after relay.
3092  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC)) {
3093  return false;
3094  }
3095 
3096  return true;
3097 }
3098 
3099 
3100 bool PreciousBlock(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& params, CBlockIndex *pindex)
3101 {
3102  {
3103  LOCK(cs_main);
3104  if (pindex->nChainWork < chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork) {
3105  // Nothing to do, this block is not at the tip.
3106  return true;
3107  }
3108  if (chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork > nLastPreciousChainwork) {
3109  // The chain has been extended since the last call, reset the counter.
3110  nBlockReverseSequenceId = -1;
3111  }
3112  nLastPreciousChainwork = chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork;
3113  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindex);
3114  pindex->nSequenceId = nBlockReverseSequenceId;
3115  if (nBlockReverseSequenceId > std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min()) {
3116  // We can't keep reducing the counter if somebody really wants to
3117  // call preciousblock 2**31-1 times on the same set of tips...
3118  nBlockReverseSequenceId--;
3119  }
3120  if (pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && pindex->nChainTx) {
3121  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindex);
3122  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
3123  }
3124  }
3125 
3126  return ActivateBestChain(state, params);
3127 }
3128 
3129 bool InvalidateBlock(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex *pindex)
3130 {
3131  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3132 
3133  // Mark the block itself as invalid.
3134  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
3135  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3136  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindex);
3137 
3138  while (chainActive.Contains(pindex)) {
3139  CBlockIndex *pindexWalk = chainActive.Tip();
3140  pindexWalk->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
3141  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexWalk);
3142  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexWalk);
3143  // ActivateBestChain considers blocks already in chainActive
3144  // unconditionally valid already, so force disconnect away from it.
3145  if (!DisconnectTip(state, chainparams)) {
3146  mempool.removeForReorg(pcoinsTip, chainActive.Tip()->nHeight + 1, STANDARD_LOCKTIME_VERIFY_FLAGS);
3147  return false;
3148  }
3149  }
3150 
3151  LimitMempoolSize(mempool, GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000, GetArg("-mempoolexpiry", DEFAULT_MEMPOOL_EXPIRY) * 60 * 60);
3152 
3153  // The resulting new best tip may not be in setBlockIndexCandidates anymore, so
3154  // add it again.
3155  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin();
3156  while (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
3157  if (it->second->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && it->second->nChainTx && !setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(it->second, chainActive.Tip())) {
3158  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(it->second);
3159  }
3160  it++;
3161  }
3162 
3163  InvalidChainFound(pindex);
3164  mempool.removeForReorg(pcoinsTip, chainActive.Tip()->nHeight + 1, STANDARD_LOCKTIME_VERIFY_FLAGS);
3165  return true;
3166 }
3167 
3168 bool ResetBlockFailureFlags(CBlockIndex *pindex) {
3169  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3170 
3171  int nHeight = pindex->nHeight;
3172 
3173  // Remove the invalidity flag from this block and all its descendants.
3174  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin();
3175  while (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
3176  if (!it->second->IsValid() && it->second->GetAncestor(nHeight) == pindex) {
3177  it->second->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
3178  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(it->second);
3179  if (it->second->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && it->second->nChainTx && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(chainActive.Tip(), it->second)) {
3180  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(it->second);
3181  }
3182  if (it->second == pindexBestInvalid) {
3183  // Reset invalid block marker if it was pointing to one of those.
3184  pindexBestInvalid = NULL;
3185  }
3186  }
3187  it++;
3188  }
3189 
3190  // Remove the invalidity flag from all ancestors too.
3191  while (pindex != NULL) {
3192  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK) {
3193  pindex->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
3194  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3195  }
3196  pindex = pindex->pprev;
3197  }
3198  return true;
3199 }
3200 
3201 CBlockIndex* AddToBlockIndex(const CBlockHeader& block)
3202 {
3203  // Check for duplicate
3204  uint256 hash = block.GetHash();
3205  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
3206  if (it != mapBlockIndex.end())
3207  return it->second;
3208 
3209  // Construct new block index object
3210  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex(block);
3211  assert(pindexNew);
3212  // We assign the sequence id to blocks only when the full data is available,
3213  // to avoid miners withholding blocks but broadcasting headers, to get a
3214  // competitive advantage.
3215  pindexNew->nSequenceId = 0;
3216  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
3217  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
3218  BlockMap::iterator miPrev = mapBlockIndex.find(block.hashPrevBlock);
3219  if (miPrev != mapBlockIndex.end())
3220  {
3221  pindexNew->pprev = (*miPrev).second;
3222  pindexNew->nHeight = pindexNew->pprev->nHeight + 1;
3223  pindexNew->BuildSkip();
3224  }
3225  pindexNew->nChainWork = (pindexNew->pprev ? pindexNew->pprev->nChainWork : 0) + GetBlockProof(*pindexNew);
3226  pindexNew->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_TREE);
3227  if (pindexBestHeader == NULL || pindexBestHeader->nChainWork < pindexNew->nChainWork)
3228  pindexBestHeader = pindexNew;
3229 
3230  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexNew);
3231 
3232  return pindexNew;
3233 }
3234 
3236 bool ReceivedBlockTransactions(const CBlock &block, CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex *pindexNew, const CDiskBlockPos& pos)
3237 {
3238  pindexNew->nTx = block.vtx.size();
3239  pindexNew->nChainTx = 0;
3240  pindexNew->nFile = pos.nFile;
3241  pindexNew->nDataPos = pos.nPos;
3242  pindexNew->nUndoPos = 0;
3243  pindexNew->nStatus |= BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
3244  if (IsWitnessEnabled(pindexNew->pprev, Params().GetConsensus())) {
3245  pindexNew->nStatus |= BLOCK_OPT_WITNESS;
3246  }
3247  pindexNew->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS);
3248  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexNew);
3249 
3250  if (pindexNew->pprev == NULL || pindexNew->pprev->nChainTx) {
3251  // If pindexNew is the genesis block or all parents are BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS.
3252  deque<CBlockIndex*> queue;
3253  queue.push_back(pindexNew);
3254 
3255  // Recursively process any descendant blocks that now may be eligible to be connected.
3256  while (!queue.empty()) {
3257  CBlockIndex *pindex = queue.front();
3258  queue.pop_front();
3259  pindex->nChainTx = (pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nChainTx : 0) + pindex->nTx;
3260  {
3261  LOCK(cs_nBlockSequenceId);
3262  pindex->nSequenceId = nBlockSequenceId++;
3263  }
3264  if (chainActive.Tip() == NULL || !setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(pindex, chainActive.Tip())) {
3265  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindex);
3266  }
3267  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator, std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator> range = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindex);
3268  while (range.first != range.second) {
3269  std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator it = range.first;
3270  queue.push_back(it->second);
3271  range.first++;
3272  mapBlocksUnlinked.erase(it);
3273  }
3274  }
3275  } else {
3276  if (pindexNew->pprev && pindexNew->pprev->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE)) {
3277  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindexNew->pprev, pindexNew));
3278  }
3279  }
3280 
3281  return true;
3282 }
3283 
3284 bool FindBlockPos(CValidationState &state, CDiskBlockPos &pos, unsigned int nAddSize, unsigned int nHeight, uint64_t nTime, bool fKnown = false)
3285 {
3286  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
3287 
3288  unsigned int nFile = fKnown ? pos.nFile : nLastBlockFile;
3289  if (vinfoBlockFile.size() <= nFile) {
3290  vinfoBlockFile.resize(nFile + 1);
3291  }
3292 
3293  if (!fKnown) {
3294  while (vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize + nAddSize >= MAX_BLOCKFILE_SIZE) {
3295  nFile++;
3296  if (vinfoBlockFile.size() <= nFile) {
3297  vinfoBlockFile.resize(nFile + 1);
3298  }
3299  }
3300  pos.nFile = nFile;
3301  pos.nPos = vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize;
3302  }
3303 
3304  if ((int)nFile != nLastBlockFile) {
3305  if (!fKnown) {
3306  LogPrintf("Leaving block file %i: %s\n", nLastBlockFile, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].ToString());
3307  }
3308  FlushBlockFile(!fKnown);
3309  nLastBlockFile = nFile;
3310  }
3311 
3312  vinfoBlockFile[nFile].AddBlock(nHeight, nTime);
3313  if (fKnown)
3314  vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize = std::max(pos.nPos + nAddSize, vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize);
3315  else
3316  vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize += nAddSize;
3317 
3318  if (!fKnown) {
3319  unsigned int nOldChunks = (pos.nPos + BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3320  unsigned int nNewChunks = (vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize + BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3321  if (nNewChunks > nOldChunks) {
3322  if (fPruneMode)
3323  fCheckForPruning = true;
3324  if (CheckDiskSpace(nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos)) {
3325  FILE *file = OpenBlockFile(pos);
3326  if (file) {
3327  LogPrintf("Pre-allocating up to position 0x%x in blk%05u.dat\n", nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE, pos.nFile);
3328  AllocateFileRange(file, pos.nPos, nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos);
3329  fclose(file);
3330  }
3331  }
3332  else
3333  return state.Error("out of disk space");
3334  }
3335  }
3336 
3337  setDirtyFileInfo.insert(nFile);
3338  return true;
3339 }
3340 
3341 bool FindUndoPos(CValidationState &state, int nFile, CDiskBlockPos &pos, unsigned int nAddSize)
3342 {
3343  pos.nFile = nFile;
3344 
3345  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
3346 
3347  unsigned int nNewSize;
3348  pos.nPos = vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nUndoSize;
3349  nNewSize = vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nUndoSize += nAddSize;
3350  setDirtyFileInfo.insert(nFile);
3351 
3352  unsigned int nOldChunks = (pos.nPos + UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3353  unsigned int nNewChunks = (nNewSize + UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3354  if (nNewChunks > nOldChunks) {
3355  if (fPruneMode)
3356  fCheckForPruning = true;
3357  if (CheckDiskSpace(nNewChunks * UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos)) {
3358  FILE *file = OpenUndoFile(pos);
3359  if (file) {
3360  LogPrintf("Pre-allocating up to position 0x%x in rev%05u.dat\n", nNewChunks * UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE, pos.nFile);
3361  AllocateFileRange(file, pos.nPos, nNewChunks * UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos);
3362  fclose(file);
3363  }
3364  }
3365  else
3366  return state.Error("out of disk space");
3367  }
3368 
3369  return true;
3370 }
3371 
3372 bool CheckBlockHeader(const CBlockHeader& block, CValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, bool fCheckPOW)
3373 {
3374  // Check proof of work matches claimed amount
3375  if (fCheckPOW && !CheckProofOfWork(block.GetHash(), block.nBits, consensusParams))
3376  return state.DoS(50, false, REJECT_INVALID, "high-hash", false, "proof of work failed");
3377 
3378  return true;
3379 }
3380 
3381 bool CheckBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, bool fCheckPOW, bool fCheckMerkleRoot)
3382 {
3383  // These are checks that are independent of context.
3384 
3385  if (block.fChecked)
3386  return true;
3387 
3388  // Check that the header is valid (particularly PoW). This is mostly
3389  // redundant with the call in AcceptBlockHeader.
3390  if (!CheckBlockHeader(block, state, consensusParams, fCheckPOW))
3391  return false;
3392 
3393  // Check the merkle root.
3394  if (fCheckMerkleRoot) {
3395  bool mutated;
3396  uint256 hashMerkleRoot2 = BlockMerkleRoot(block, &mutated);
3397  if (block.hashMerkleRoot != hashMerkleRoot2)
3398  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txnmrklroot", true, "hashMerkleRoot mismatch");
3399 
3400  // Check for merkle tree malleability (CVE-2012-2459): repeating sequences
3401  // of transactions in a block without affecting the merkle root of a block,
3402  // while still invalidating it.
3403  if (mutated)
3404  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-duplicate", true, "duplicate transaction");
3405  }
3406 
3407  // All potential-corruption validation must be done before we do any
3408  // transaction validation, as otherwise we may mark the header as invalid
3409  // because we receive the wrong transactions for it.
3410  // Note that witness malleability is checked in ContextualCheckBlock, so no
3411  // checks that use witness data may be performed here.
3412 
3413  // Size limits
3414  if (block.vtx.empty() || block.vtx.size() > MAX_BLOCK_BASE_SIZE || ::GetSerializeSize(block, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION | SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS) > MAX_BLOCK_BASE_SIZE)
3415  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-length", false, "size limits failed");
3416 
3417  // First transaction must be coinbase, the rest must not be
3418  if (block.vtx.empty() || !block.vtx[0].IsCoinBase())
3419  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-missing", false, "first tx is not coinbase");
3420  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < block.vtx.size(); i++)
3421  if (block.vtx[i].IsCoinBase())
3422  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-multiple", false, "more than one coinbase");
3423 
3424  // Check transactions
3425  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx)
3426  if (!CheckTransaction(tx, state))
3427  return state.Invalid(false, state.GetRejectCode(), state.GetRejectReason(),
3428  strprintf("Transaction check failed (tx hash %s) %s", tx.GetHash().ToString(), state.GetDebugMessage()));
3429 
3430  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
3431  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx)
3432  {
3433  nSigOps += GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
3434  }
3435  if (nSigOps * WITNESS_SCALE_FACTOR > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS_COST)
3436  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-sigops", false, "out-of-bounds SigOpCount");
3437 
3438  if (fCheckPOW && fCheckMerkleRoot)
3439  block.fChecked = true;
3440 
3441  return true;
3442 }
3443 
3444 static bool CheckIndexAgainstCheckpoint(const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, const uint256& hash)
3445 {
3446  if (*pindexPrev->phashBlock == chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock)
3447  return true;
3448 
3449  int nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight+1;
3450  // Don't accept any forks from the main chain prior to last checkpoint
3451  CBlockIndex* pcheckpoint = Checkpoints::GetLastCheckpoint(chainparams.Checkpoints());
3452  if (pcheckpoint && nHeight < pcheckpoint->nHeight)
3453  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: forked chain older than last checkpoint (height %d)", __func__, nHeight));
3454 
3455  return true;
3456 }
3457 
3458 bool IsWitnessEnabled(const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, const Consensus::Params& params)
3459 {
3460  LOCK(cs_main);
3461  return (VersionBitsState(pindexPrev, params, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_SEGWIT, versionbitscache) == THRESHOLD_ACTIVE);
3462 }
3463 
3464 // Compute at which vout of the block's coinbase transaction the witness
3465 // commitment occurs, or -1 if not found.
3466 static int GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(const CBlock& block)
3467 {
3468  int commitpos = -1;
3469  for (size_t o = 0; o < block.vtx[0].vout.size(); o++) {
3470  if (block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey.size() >= 38 && block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey[0] == OP_RETURN && block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey[1] == 0x24 && block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey[2] == 0xaa && block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey[3] == 0x21 && block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey[4] == 0xa9 && block.vtx[0].vout[o].scriptPubKey[5] == 0xed) {
3471  commitpos = o;
3472  }
3473  }
3474  return commitpos;
3475 }
3476 
3477 void UpdateUncommittedBlockStructures(CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
3478 {
3479  int commitpos = GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(block);
3480  static const std::vector<unsigned char> nonce(32, 0x00);
3481  if (commitpos != -1 && IsWitnessEnabled(pindexPrev, consensusParams) && block.vtx[0].wit.IsEmpty()) {
3482  block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit.resize(1);
3483  block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit[0].scriptWitness.stack.resize(1);
3484  block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit[0].scriptWitness.stack[0] = nonce;
3485  }
3486 }
3487 
3488 std::vector<unsigned char> GenerateCoinbaseCommitment(CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
3489 {
3490  std::vector<unsigned char> commitment;
3491  int commitpos = GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(block);
3492  bool fHaveWitness = false;
3493  for (size_t t = 1; t < block.vtx.size(); t++) {
3494  if (!block.vtx[t].wit.IsNull()) {
3495  fHaveWitness = true;
3496  break;
3497  }
3498  }
3499  std::vector<unsigned char> ret(32, 0x00);
3500  if (fHaveWitness && IsWitnessEnabled(pindexPrev, consensusParams)) {
3501  if (commitpos == -1) {
3502  uint256 witnessroot = BlockWitnessMerkleRoot(block, NULL);
3503  CHash256().Write(witnessroot.begin(), 32).Write(&ret[0], 32).Finalize(witnessroot.begin());
3504  CTxOut out;
3505  out.nValue = 0;
3506  out.scriptPubKey.resize(38);
3507  out.scriptPubKey[0] = OP_RETURN;
3508  out.scriptPubKey[1] = 0x24;
3509  out.scriptPubKey[2] = 0xaa;
3510  out.scriptPubKey[3] = 0x21;
3511  out.scriptPubKey[4] = 0xa9;
3512  out.scriptPubKey[5] = 0xed;
3513  memcpy(&out.scriptPubKey[6], witnessroot.begin(), 32);
3514  commitment = std::vector<unsigned char>(out.scriptPubKey.begin(), out.scriptPubKey.end());
3515  const_cast<std::vector<CTxOut>*>(&block.vtx[0].vout)->push_back(out);
3516  block.vtx[0].UpdateHash();
3517  }
3518  }
3519  UpdateUncommittedBlockStructures(block, pindexPrev, consensusParams);
3520  return commitment;
3521 }
3522 
3523 bool ContextualCheckBlockHeader(const CBlockHeader& block, CValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, int64_t nAdjustedTime)
3524 {
3525  const int nHeight = pindexPrev == NULL ? 0 : pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
3526  // Check proof of work
3527  if (block.nBits != GetNextWorkRequired(pindexPrev, &block, consensusParams))
3528  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-diffbits", false, "incorrect proof of work");
3529 
3530  // Check timestamp against prev
3531  if (block.GetBlockTime() <= pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast())
3532  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_INVALID, "time-too-old", "block's timestamp is too early");
3533 
3534  // Check timestamp
3535  if (block.GetBlockTime() > nAdjustedTime + 2 * 60 * 60)
3536  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_INVALID, "time-too-new", "block timestamp too far in the future");
3537 
3538  // Reject outdated version blocks when 95% (75% on testnet) of the network has upgraded:
3539  // check for version 2, 3 and 4 upgrades
3540  if((block.nVersion < 2 && nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP34Height) ||
3541  (block.nVersion < 3 && nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP66Height) ||
3542  (block.nVersion < 4 && nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP65Height))
3543  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_OBSOLETE, strprintf("bad-version(0x%08x)", block.nVersion),
3544  strprintf("rejected nVersion=0x%08x block", block.nVersion));
3545 
3546  return true;
3547 }
3548 
3549 bool ContextualCheckBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev)
3550 {
3551  const int nHeight = pindexPrev == NULL ? 0 : pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
3552 
3553  // Start enforcing BIP113 (Median Time Past) using versionbits logic.
3554  int nLockTimeFlags = 0;
3555  if (VersionBitsState(pindexPrev, consensusParams, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_CSV, versionbitscache) == THRESHOLD_ACTIVE) {
3556  nLockTimeFlags |= LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST;
3557  }
3558 
3559  int64_t nLockTimeCutoff = (nLockTimeFlags & LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST)
3560  ? pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast()
3561  : block.GetBlockTime();
3562 
3563  // Check that all transactions are finalized
3564  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx) {
3565  if (!IsFinalTx(tx, nHeight, nLockTimeCutoff)) {
3566  return state.DoS(10, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-nonfinal", false, "non-final transaction");
3567  }
3568  }
3569 
3570  // Enforce rule that the coinbase starts with serialized block height
3571  if (nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP34Height)
3572  {
3573  CScript expect = CScript() << nHeight;
3574  if (block.vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.size() < expect.size() ||
3575  !std::equal(expect.begin(), expect.end(), block.vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.begin())) {
3576  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-height", false, "block height mismatch in coinbase");
3577  }
3578  }
3579 
3580  // Validation for witness commitments.
3581  // * We compute the witness hash (which is the hash including witnesses) of all the block's transactions, except the
3582  // coinbase (where 0x0000....0000 is used instead).
3583  // * The coinbase scriptWitness is a stack of a single 32-byte vector, containing a witness nonce (unconstrained).
3584  // * We build a merkle tree with all those witness hashes as leaves (similar to the hashMerkleRoot in the block header).
3585  // * There must be at least one output whose scriptPubKey is a single 36-byte push, the first 4 bytes of which are
3586  // {0xaa, 0x21, 0xa9, 0xed}, and the following 32 bytes are SHA256^2(witness root, witness nonce). In case there are
3587  // multiple, the last one is used.
3588  bool fHaveWitness = false;
3589  if (VersionBitsState(pindexPrev, consensusParams, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_SEGWIT, versionbitscache) == THRESHOLD_ACTIVE) {
3590  int commitpos = GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(block);
3591  if (commitpos != -1) {
3592  bool malleated = false;
3593  uint256 hashWitness = BlockWitnessMerkleRoot(block, &malleated);
3594  // The malleation check is ignored; as the transaction tree itself
3595  // already does not permit it, it is impossible to trigger in the
3596  // witness tree.
3597  if (block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit.size() != 1 || block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit[0].scriptWitness.stack.size() != 1 || block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit[0].scriptWitness.stack[0].size() != 32) {
3598  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-witness-nonce-size", true, strprintf("%s : invalid witness nonce size", __func__));
3599  }
3600  CHash256().Write(hashWitness.begin(), 32).Write(&block.vtx[0].wit.vtxinwit[0].scriptWitness.stack[0][0], 32).Finalize(hashWitness.begin());
3601  if (memcmp(hashWitness.begin(), &block.vtx[0].vout[commitpos].scriptPubKey[6], 32)) {
3602  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-witness-merkle-match", true, strprintf("%s : witness merkle commitment mismatch", __func__));
3603  }
3604  fHaveWitness = true;
3605  }
3606  }
3607 
3608  // No witness data is allowed in blocks that don't commit to witness data, as this would otherwise leave room for spam
3609  if (!fHaveWitness) {
3610  for (size_t i = 0; i < block.vtx.size(); i++) {
3611  if (!block.vtx[i].wit.IsNull()) {
3612  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "unexpected-witness", true, strprintf("%s : unexpected witness data found", __func__));
3613  }
3614  }
3615  }
3616 
3617  // After the coinbase witness nonce and commitment are verified,
3618  // we can check if the block weight passes (before we've checked the
3619  // coinbase witness, it would be possible for the weight to be too
3620  // large by filling up the coinbase witness, which doesn't change
3621  // the block hash, so we couldn't mark the block as permanently
3622  // failed).
3623  if (GetBlockWeight(block) > MAX_BLOCK_WEIGHT) {
3624  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-weight", false, strprintf("%s : weight limit failed", __func__));
3625  }
3626 
3627  return true;
3628 }
3629 
3630 static bool AcceptBlockHeader(const CBlockHeader& block, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex** ppindex=NULL)
3631 {
3632  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3633  // Check for duplicate
3634  uint256 hash = block.GetHash();
3635  BlockMap::iterator miSelf = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
3636  CBlockIndex *pindex = NULL;
3637  if (hash != chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock) {
3638 
3639  if (miSelf != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
3640  // Block header is already known.
3641  pindex = miSelf->second;
3642  if (ppindex)
3643  *ppindex = pindex;
3644  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK)
3645  return state.Invalid(error("%s: block %s is marked invalid", __func__, hash.ToString()), 0, "duplicate");
3646  return true;
3647  }
3648 
3649  if (!CheckBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
3650  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckBlockHeader: %s, %s", __func__, hash.ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
3651 
3652  // Get prev block index
3653  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = NULL;
3654  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(block.hashPrevBlock);
3655  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
3656  return state.DoS(10, error("%s: prev block not found", __func__), 0, "bad-prevblk");
3657  pindexPrev = (*mi).second;
3658  if (pindexPrev->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK)
3659  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: prev block invalid", __func__), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-prevblk");
3660 
3661  assert(pindexPrev);
3662  if (fCheckpointsEnabled && !CheckIndexAgainstCheckpoint(pindexPrev, state, chainparams, hash))
3663  return error("%s: CheckIndexAgainstCheckpoint(): %s", __func__, state.GetRejectReason().c_str());
3664 
3665  if (!ContextualCheckBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindexPrev, GetAdjustedTime()))
3666  return error("%s: Consensus::ContextualCheckBlockHeader: %s, %s", __func__, hash.ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
3667  }
3668  if (pindex == NULL)
3669  pindex = AddToBlockIndex(block);
3670 
3671  if (ppindex)
3672  *ppindex = pindex;
3673 
3674  return true;
3675 }
3676 
3678 static bool AcceptBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex** ppindex, bool fRequested, const CDiskBlockPos* dbp, bool* fNewBlock)
3679 {
3680  if (fNewBlock) *fNewBlock = false;
3681  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3682 
3683  CBlockIndex *pindexDummy = NULL;
3684  CBlockIndex *&pindex = ppindex ? *ppindex : pindexDummy;
3685 
3686  if (!AcceptBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams, &pindex))
3687  return false;
3688 
3689  // Try to process all requested blocks that we don't have, but only
3690  // process an unrequested block if it's new and has enough work to
3691  // advance our tip, and isn't too many blocks ahead.
3692  bool fAlreadyHave = pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
3693  bool fHasMoreWork = (chainActive.Tip() ? pindex->nChainWork > chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork : true);
3694  // Blocks that are too out-of-order needlessly limit the effectiveness of
3695  // pruning, because pruning will not delete block files that contain any
3696  // blocks which are too close in height to the tip. Apply this test
3697  // regardless of whether pruning is enabled; it should generally be safe to
3698  // not process unrequested blocks.
3699  bool fTooFarAhead = (pindex->nHeight > int(chainActive.Height() + MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP));
3700 
3701  // TODO: deal better with return value and error conditions for duplicate
3702  // and unrequested blocks.
3703  if (fAlreadyHave) return true;
3704  if (!fRequested) { // If we didn't ask for it:
3705  if (pindex->nTx != 0) return true; // This is a previously-processed block that was pruned
3706  if (!fHasMoreWork) return true; // Don't process less-work chains
3707  if (fTooFarAhead) return true; // Block height is too high
3708  }
3709  if (fNewBlock) *fNewBlock = true;
3710 
3711  if (!CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), GetAdjustedTime()) ||
3712  !ContextualCheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindex->pprev)) {
3713  if (state.IsInvalid() && !state.CorruptionPossible()) {
3714  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
3715  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3716  }
3717  return error("%s: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3718  }
3719 
3720  int nHeight = pindex->nHeight;
3721 
3722  // Write block to history file
3723  try {
3724  unsigned int nBlockSize = ::GetSerializeSize(block, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
3725  CDiskBlockPos blockPos;
3726  if (dbp != NULL)
3727  blockPos = *dbp;
3728  if (!FindBlockPos(state, blockPos, nBlockSize+8, nHeight, block.GetBlockTime(), dbp != NULL))
3729  return error("AcceptBlock(): FindBlockPos failed");
3730  if (dbp == NULL)
3731  if (!WriteBlockToDisk(block, blockPos, chainparams.MessageStart()))
3732  AbortNode(state, "Failed to write block");
3733  if (!ReceivedBlockTransactions(block, state, pindex, blockPos))
3734  return error("AcceptBlock(): ReceivedBlockTransactions failed");
3735  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
3736  return AbortNode(state, std::string("System error: ") + e.what());
3737  }
3738 
3739  if (fCheckForPruning)
3740  FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_NONE); // we just allocated more disk space for block files
3741 
3742  return true;
3743 }
3744 
3745 bool ProcessNewBlock(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CNode* pfrom, const CBlock* pblock, bool fForceProcessing, const CDiskBlockPos* dbp)
3746 {
3747  {
3748  LOCK(cs_main);
3749  bool fRequested = MarkBlockAsReceived(pblock->GetHash());
3750  fRequested |= fForceProcessing;
3751 
3752  // Store to disk
3753  CBlockIndex *pindex = NULL;
3754  bool fNewBlock = false;
3755  bool ret = AcceptBlock(*pblock, state, chainparams, &pindex, fRequested, dbp, &fNewBlock);
3756  if (pindex && pfrom) {
3757  mapBlockSource[pindex->GetBlockHash()] = pfrom->GetId();
3758  if (fNewBlock) pfrom->nLastBlockTime = GetTime();
3759  }
3760  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
3761  if (!ret)
3762  return error("%s: AcceptBlock FAILED", __func__);
3763  }
3764 
3765  NotifyHeaderTip();
3766 
3767  if (!ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams, pblock))
3768  return error("%s: ActivateBestChain failed", __func__);
3769 
3770  return true;
3771 }
3772 
3773 bool TestBlockValidity(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, const CBlock& block, CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, bool fCheckPOW, bool fCheckMerkleRoot)
3774 {
3775  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3776  assert(pindexPrev && pindexPrev == chainActive.Tip());
3777  if (fCheckpointsEnabled && !CheckIndexAgainstCheckpoint(pindexPrev, state, chainparams, block.GetHash()))
3778  return error("%s: CheckIndexAgainstCheckpoint(): %s", __func__, state.GetRejectReason().c_str());
3779 
3780  CCoinsViewCache viewNew(pcoinsTip);
3781  CBlockIndex indexDummy(block);
3782  indexDummy.pprev = pindexPrev;
3783  indexDummy.nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
3784 
3785  // NOTE: CheckBlockHeader is called by CheckBlock
3786  if (!ContextualCheckBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindexPrev, GetAdjustedTime()))
3787  return error("%s: Consensus::ContextualCheckBlockHeader: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3788  if (!CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), fCheckPOW, fCheckMerkleRoot))
3789  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckBlock: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3790  if (!ContextualCheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindexPrev))
3791  return error("%s: Consensus::ContextualCheckBlock: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3792  if (!ConnectBlock(block, state, &indexDummy, viewNew, chainparams, true))
3793  return false;
3794  assert(state.IsValid());
3795 
3796  return true;
3797 }
3798 
3803 /* Calculate the amount of disk space the block & undo files currently use */
3804 uint64_t CalculateCurrentUsage()
3805 {
3806  uint64_t retval = 0;
3807  BOOST_FOREACH(const CBlockFileInfo &file, vinfoBlockFile) {
3808  retval += file.nSize + file.nUndoSize;
3809  }
3810  return retval;
3811 }
3812 
3813 /* Prune a block file (modify associated database entries)*/
3814 void PruneOneBlockFile(const int fileNumber)
3815 {
3816  for (BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin(); it != mapBlockIndex.end(); ++it) {
3817  CBlockIndex* pindex = it->second;
3818  if (pindex->nFile == fileNumber) {
3819  pindex->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
3820  pindex->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO;
3821  pindex->nFile = 0;
3822  pindex->nDataPos = 0;
3823  pindex->nUndoPos = 0;
3824  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3825 
3826  // Prune from mapBlocksUnlinked -- any block we prune would have
3827  // to be downloaded again in order to consider its chain, at which
3828  // point it would be considered as a candidate for
3829  // mapBlocksUnlinked or setBlockIndexCandidates.
3830  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator, std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator> range = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindex->pprev);
3831  while (range.first != range.second) {
3832  std::multimap<CBlockIndex *, CBlockIndex *>::iterator _it = range.first;
3833  range.first++;
3834  if (_it->second == pindex) {
3835  mapBlocksUnlinked.erase(_it);
3836  }
3837  }
3838  }
3839  }
3840 
3841  vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].SetNull();
3842  setDirtyFileInfo.insert(fileNumber);
3843 }
3844 
3845 
3846 void UnlinkPrunedFiles(std::set<int>& setFilesToPrune)
3847 {
3848  for (set<int>::iterator it = setFilesToPrune.begin(); it != setFilesToPrune.end(); ++it) {
3849  CDiskBlockPos pos(*it, 0);
3850  boost::filesystem::remove(GetBlockPosFilename(pos, "blk"));
3851  boost::filesystem::remove(GetBlockPosFilename(pos, "rev"));
3852  LogPrintf("Prune: %s deleted blk/rev (%05u)\n", __func__, *it);
3853  }
3854 }
3855 
3856 /* Calculate the block/rev files that should be deleted to remain under target*/
3857 void FindFilesToPrune(std::set<int>& setFilesToPrune, uint64_t nPruneAfterHeight)
3858 {
3859  LOCK2(cs_main, cs_LastBlockFile);
3860  if (chainActive.Tip() == NULL || nPruneTarget == 0) {
3861  return;
3862  }
3863  if ((uint64_t)chainActive.Tip()->nHeight <= nPruneAfterHeight) {
3864  return;
3865  }
3866 
3867  unsigned int nLastBlockWeCanPrune = chainActive.Tip()->nHeight - MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP;
3868  uint64_t nCurrentUsage = CalculateCurrentUsage();
3869  // We don't check to prune until after we've allocated new space for files
3870  // So we should leave a buffer under our target to account for another allocation
3871  // before the next pruning.
3872  uint64_t nBuffer = BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE + UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3873  uint64_t nBytesToPrune;
3874  int count=0;
3875 
3876  if (nCurrentUsage + nBuffer >= nPruneTarget) {
3877  for (int fileNumber = 0; fileNumber < nLastBlockFile; fileNumber++) {
3878  nBytesToPrune = vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nSize + vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nUndoSize;
3879 
3880  if (vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nSize == 0)
3881  continue;
3882 
3883  if (nCurrentUsage + nBuffer < nPruneTarget) // are we below our target?
3884  break;
3885 
3886  // don't prune files that could have a block within MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP of the main chain's tip but keep scanning
3887  if (vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nHeightLast > nLastBlockWeCanPrune)
3888  continue;
3889 
3890  PruneOneBlockFile(fileNumber);
3891  // Queue up the files for removal
3892  setFilesToPrune.insert(fileNumber);
3893  nCurrentUsage -= nBytesToPrune;
3894  count++;
3895  }
3896  }
3897 
3898  LogPrint("prune", "Prune: target=%dMiB actual=%dMiB diff=%dMiB max_prune_height=%d removed %d blk/rev pairs\n",
3899  nPruneTarget/1024/1024, nCurrentUsage/1024/1024,
3900  ((int64_t)nPruneTarget - (int64_t)nCurrentUsage)/1024/1024,
3901  nLastBlockWeCanPrune, count);
3902 }
3903 
3904 bool CheckDiskSpace(uint64_t nAdditionalBytes)
3905 {
3906  uint64_t nFreeBytesAvailable = boost::filesystem::space(GetDataDir()).available;
3907 
3908  // Check for nMinDiskSpace bytes (currently 50MB)
3909  if (nFreeBytesAvailable < nMinDiskSpace + nAdditionalBytes)
3910  return AbortNode("Disk space is low!", _("Error: Disk space is low!"));
3911 
3912  return true;
3913 }
3914 
3915 FILE* OpenDiskFile(const CDiskBlockPos &pos, const char *prefix, bool fReadOnly)
3916 {
3917  if (pos.IsNull())
3918  return NULL;
3919  boost::filesystem::path path = GetBlockPosFilename(pos, prefix);
3920  boost::filesystem::create_directories(path.parent_path());
3921  FILE* file = fopen(path.string().c_str(), "rb+");
3922  if (!file && !fReadOnly)
3923  file = fopen(path.string().c_str(), "wb+");
3924  if (!file) {
3925  LogPrintf("Unable to open file %s\n", path.string());
3926  return NULL;
3927  }
3928  if (pos.nPos) {
3929  if (fseek(file, pos.nPos, SEEK_SET)) {
3930  LogPrintf("Unable to seek to position %u of %s\n", pos.nPos, path.string());
3931  fclose(file);
3932  return NULL;
3933  }
3934  }
3935  return file;
3936 }
3937 
3938 FILE* OpenBlockFile(const CDiskBlockPos &pos, bool fReadOnly) {
3939  return OpenDiskFile(pos, "blk", fReadOnly);
3940 }
3941 
3942 FILE* OpenUndoFile(const CDiskBlockPos &pos, bool fReadOnly) {
3943  return OpenDiskFile(pos, "rev", fReadOnly);
3944 }
3945 
3946 boost::filesystem::path GetBlockPosFilename(const CDiskBlockPos &pos, const char *prefix)
3947 {
3948  return GetDataDir() / "blocks" / strprintf("%s%05u.dat", prefix, pos.nFile);
3949 }
3950 
3951 CBlockIndex * InsertBlockIndex(uint256 hash)
3952 {
3953  if (hash.IsNull())
3954  return NULL;
3955 
3956  // Return existing
3957  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
3958  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end())
3959  return (*mi).second;
3960 
3961  // Create new
3962  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex();
3963  if (!pindexNew)
3964  throw runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": new CBlockIndex failed");
3965  mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
3966  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
3967 
3968  return pindexNew;
3969 }
3970 
3971 bool static LoadBlockIndexDB()
3972 {
3973  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
3974  if (!pblocktree->LoadBlockIndexGuts(InsertBlockIndex))
3975  return false;
3976 
3977  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3978 
3979  // Calculate nChainWork
3980  vector<pair<int, CBlockIndex*> > vSortedByHeight;
3981  vSortedByHeight.reserve(mapBlockIndex.size());
3982  BOOST_FOREACH(const PAIRTYPE(uint256, CBlockIndex*)& item, mapBlockIndex)
3983  {
3984  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
3985  vSortedByHeight.push_back(make_pair(pindex->nHeight, pindex));
3986  }
3987  sort(vSortedByHeight.begin(), vSortedByHeight.end());
3988  BOOST_FOREACH(const PAIRTYPE(int, CBlockIndex*)& item, vSortedByHeight)
3989  {
3990  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
3991  pindex->nChainWork = (pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nChainWork : 0) + GetBlockProof(*pindex);
3992  // We can link the chain of blocks for which we've received transactions at some point.
3993  // Pruned nodes may have deleted the block.
3994  if (pindex->nTx > 0) {
3995  if (pindex->pprev) {
3996  if (pindex->pprev->nChainTx) {
3997  pindex->nChainTx = pindex->pprev->nChainTx + pindex->nTx;
3998  } else {
3999  pindex->nChainTx = 0;
4000  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindex->pprev, pindex));
4001  }
4002  } else {
4003  pindex->nChainTx = pindex->nTx;
4004  }
4005  }
4006  if (pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && (pindex->nChainTx || pindex->pprev == NULL))
4007  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindex);
4008  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK && (!pindexBestInvalid || pindex->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork))
4009  pindexBestInvalid = pindex;
4010  if (pindex->pprev)
4011  pindex->BuildSkip();
4012  if (pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE) && (pindexBestHeader == NULL || CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(pindexBestHeader, pindex)))
4013  pindexBestHeader = pindex;
4014  }
4015 
4016  // Load block file info
4017  pblocktree->ReadLastBlockFile(nLastBlockFile);
4018  vinfoBlockFile.resize(nLastBlockFile + 1);
4019  LogPrintf("%s: last block file = %i\n", __func__, nLastBlockFile);
4020  for (int nFile = 0; nFile <= nLastBlockFile; nFile++) {
4021  pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nFile, vinfoBlockFile[nFile]);
4022  }
4023  LogPrintf("%s: last block file info: %s\n", __func__, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].ToString());
4024  for (int nFile = nLastBlockFile + 1; true; nFile++) {
4025  CBlockFileInfo info;
4026  if (pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nFile, info)) {
4027  vinfoBlockFile.push_back(info);
4028  } else {
4029  break;
4030  }
4031  }
4032 
4033  // Check presence of blk files
4034  LogPrintf("Checking all blk files are present...\n");
4035  set<int> setBlkDataFiles;
4036  BOOST_FOREACH(const PAIRTYPE(uint256, CBlockIndex*)& item, mapBlockIndex)
4037  {
4038  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
4039  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) {
4040  setBlkDataFiles.insert(pindex->nFile);
4041  }
4042  }
4043  for (std::set<int>::iterator it = setBlkDataFiles.begin(); it != setBlkDataFiles.end(); it++)
4044  {
4045  CDiskBlockPos pos(*it, 0);
4046  if (CAutoFile(OpenBlockFile(pos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION).IsNull()) {
4047  return false;
4048  }
4049  }
4050 
4051  // Check whether we have ever pruned block & undo files
4052  pblocktree->ReadFlag("prunedblockfiles", fHavePruned);
4053  if (fHavePruned)
4054  LogPrintf("LoadBlockIndexDB(): Block files have previously been pruned\n");
4055 
4056  // Check whether we need to continue reindexing
4057  bool fReindexing = false;
4058  pblocktree->ReadReindexing(fReindexing);
4059  fReindex |= fReindexing;
4060 
4061  // Check whether we have a transaction index
4062  pblocktree->ReadFlag("txindex", fTxIndex);
4063  LogPrintf("%s: transaction index %s\n", __func__, fTxIndex ? "enabled" : "disabled");
4064 
4065  // Load pointer to end of best chain
4066  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(pcoinsTip->GetBestBlock());
4067  if (it == mapBlockIndex.end())
4068  return true;
4069  chainActive.SetTip(it->second);
4070 
4071  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
4072 
4073  LogPrintf("%s: hashBestChain=%s height=%d date=%s progress=%f\n", __func__,
4074  chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash().ToString(), chainActive.Height(),
4075  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime()),
4076  Checkpoints::GuessVerificationProgress(chainparams.Checkpoints(), chainActive.Tip()));
4077 
4078  return true;
4079 }
4080 
4081 CVerifyDB::CVerifyDB()
4082 {
4083  uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Verifying blocks..."), 0);
4084 }
4085 
4086 CVerifyDB::~CVerifyDB()
4087 {
4088  uiInterface.ShowProgress("", 100);
4089 }
4090 
4091 bool CVerifyDB::VerifyDB(const CChainParams& chainparams, CCoinsView *coinsview, int nCheckLevel, int nCheckDepth)
4092 {
4093  LOCK(cs_main);
4094  if (chainActive.Tip() == NULL || chainActive.Tip()->pprev == NULL)
4095  return true;
4096 
4097  // Verify blocks in the best chain
4098  if (nCheckDepth <= 0)
4099  nCheckDepth = 1000000000; // suffices until the year 19000
4100  if (nCheckDepth > chainActive.Height())
4101  nCheckDepth = chainActive.Height();
4102  nCheckLevel = std::max(0, std::min(4, nCheckLevel));
4103  LogPrintf("Verifying last %i blocks at level %i\n", nCheckDepth, nCheckLevel);
4104  CCoinsViewCache coins(coinsview);
4105  CBlockIndex* pindexState = chainActive.Tip();
4106  CBlockIndex* pindexFailure = NULL;
4107  int nGoodTransactions = 0;
4108  CValidationState state;
4109  int reportDone = 0;
4110  LogPrintf("[0%%]...");
4111  for (CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive.Tip(); pindex && pindex->pprev; pindex = pindex->pprev)
4112  {
4113  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4114  int percentageDone = std::max(1, std::min(99, (int)(((double)(chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight)) / (double)nCheckDepth * (nCheckLevel >= 4 ? 50 : 100))));
4115  if (reportDone < percentageDone/10) {
4116  // report every 10% step
4117  LogPrintf("[%d%%]...", percentageDone);
4118  reportDone = percentageDone/10;
4119  }
4120  uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Verifying blocks..."), percentageDone);
4121  if (pindex->nHeight < chainActive.Height()-nCheckDepth)
4122  break;
4123  if (fPruneMode && !(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) {
4124  // If pruning, only go back as far as we have data.
4125  LogPrintf("VerifyDB(): block verification stopping at height %d (pruning, no data)\n", pindex->nHeight);
4126  break;
4127  }
4128  CBlock block;
4129  // check level 0: read from disk
4130  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
