4131  return error("VerifyDB(): *** ReadBlockFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4132  // check level 1: verify block validity
4133  if (nCheckLevel >= 1 && !CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4134  return error("%s: *** found bad block at %d, hash=%s (%s)\n", __func__,
4135  pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
4136  // check level 2: verify undo validity
4137  if (nCheckLevel >= 2 && pindex) {
4138  CBlockUndo undo;
4139  CDiskBlockPos pos = pindex->GetUndoPos();
4140  if (!pos.IsNull()) {
4141  if (!UndoReadFromDisk(undo, pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash()))
4142  return error("VerifyDB(): *** found bad undo data at %d, hash=%s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4143  }
4144  }
4145  // check level 3: check for inconsistencies during memory-only disconnect of tip blocks
4146  if (nCheckLevel >= 3 && pindex == pindexState && (coins.DynamicMemoryUsage() + pcoinsTip->DynamicMemoryUsage()) <= nCoinCacheUsage) {
4147  bool fClean = true;
4148  if (!DisconnectBlock(block, state, pindex, coins, &fClean))
4149  return error("VerifyDB(): *** irrecoverable inconsistency in block data at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4150  pindexState = pindex->pprev;
4151  if (!fClean) {
4152  nGoodTransactions = 0;
4153  pindexFailure = pindex;
4154  } else
4155  nGoodTransactions += block.vtx.size();
4156  }
4157  if (ShutdownRequested())
4158  return true;
4159  }
4160  if (pindexFailure)
4161  return error("VerifyDB(): *** coin database inconsistencies found (last %i blocks, %i good transactions before that)\n", chainActive.Height() - pindexFailure->nHeight + 1, nGoodTransactions);
4162 
4163  // check level 4: try reconnecting blocks
4164  if (nCheckLevel >= 4) {
4165  CBlockIndex *pindex = pindexState;
4166  while (pindex != chainActive.Tip()) {
4167  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4168  uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Verifying blocks..."), std::max(1, std::min(99, 100 - (int)(((double)(chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight)) / (double)nCheckDepth * 50))));
4169  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
4170  CBlock block;
4171  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4172  return error("VerifyDB(): *** ReadBlockFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4173  if (!ConnectBlock(block, state, pindex, coins, chainparams))
4174  return error("VerifyDB(): *** found unconnectable block at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4175  }
4176  }
4177 
4178  LogPrintf("[DONE].\n");
4179  LogPrintf("No coin database inconsistencies in last %i blocks (%i transactions)\n", chainActive.Height() - pindexState->nHeight, nGoodTransactions);
4180 
4181  return true;
4182 }
4183 
4184 bool RewindBlockIndex(const CChainParams& params)
4185 {
4186  LOCK(cs_main);
4187 
4188  int nHeight = 1;
4189  while (nHeight <= chainActive.Height()) {
4190  if (IsWitnessEnabled(chainActive[nHeight - 1], params.GetConsensus()) && !(chainActive[nHeight]->nStatus & BLOCK_OPT_WITNESS)) {
4191  break;
4192  }
4193  nHeight++;
4194  }
4195 
4196  // nHeight is now the height of the first insufficiently-validated block, or tipheight + 1
4197  CValidationState state;
4198  CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive.Tip();
4199  while (chainActive.Height() >= nHeight) {
4200  if (fPruneMode && !(chainActive.Tip()->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) {
4201  // If pruning, don't try rewinding past the HAVE_DATA point;
4202  // since older blocks can't be served anyway, there's
4203  // no need to walk further, and trying to DisconnectTip()
4204  // will fail (and require a needless reindex/redownload
4205  // of the blockchain).
4206  break;
4207  }
4208  if (!DisconnectTip(state, params, true)) {
4209  return error("RewindBlockIndex: unable to disconnect block at height %i", pindex->nHeight);
4210  }
4211  // Occasionally flush state to disk.
4212  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC))
4213  return false;
4214  }
4215 
4216  // Reduce validity flag and have-data flags.
4217  // We do this after actual disconnecting, otherwise we'll end up writing the lack of data
4218  // to disk before writing the chainstate, resulting in a failure to continue if interrupted.
4219  for (BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin(); it != mapBlockIndex.end(); it++) {
4220  CBlockIndex* pindexIter = it->second;
4221 
4222  // Note: If we encounter an insufficiently validated block that
4223  // is on chainActive, it must be because we are a pruning node, and
4224  // this block or some successor doesn't HAVE_DATA, so we were unable to
4225  // rewind all the way. Blocks remaining on chainActive at this point
4226  // must not have their validity reduced.
4227  if (IsWitnessEnabled(pindexIter->pprev, params.GetConsensus()) && !(pindexIter->nStatus & BLOCK_OPT_WITNESS) && !chainActive.Contains(pindexIter)) {
4228  // Reduce validity
4229  pindexIter->nStatus = std::min<unsigned int>(pindexIter->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK, BLOCK_VALID_TREE) | (pindexIter->nStatus & ~BLOCK_VALID_MASK);
4230  // Remove have-data flags.
4231  pindexIter->nStatus &= ~(BLOCK_HAVE_DATA | BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO);
4232  // Remove storage location.
4233  pindexIter->nFile = 0;
4234  pindexIter->nDataPos = 0;
4235  pindexIter->nUndoPos = 0;
4236  // Remove various other things
4237  pindexIter->nTx = 0;
4238  pindexIter->nChainTx = 0;
4239  pindexIter->nSequenceId = 0;
4240  // Make sure it gets written.
4241  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexIter);
4242  // Update indexes
4243  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexIter);
4244  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator, std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator> ret = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindexIter->pprev);
4245  while (ret.first != ret.second) {
4246  if (ret.first->second == pindexIter) {
4247  mapBlocksUnlinked.erase(ret.first++);
4248  } else {
4249  ++ret.first;
4250  }
4251  }
4252  } else if (pindexIter->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && pindexIter->nChainTx) {
4253  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindexIter);
4254  }
4255  }
4256 
4257  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
4258 
4259  CheckBlockIndex(params.GetConsensus());
4260 
4261  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS)) {
4262  return false;
4263  }
4264 
4265  return true;
4266 }
4267 
4268 void UnloadBlockIndex()
4269 {
4270  LOCK(cs_main);
4271  setBlockIndexCandidates.clear();
4272  chainActive.SetTip(NULL);
4273  pindexBestInvalid = NULL;
4274  pindexBestHeader = NULL;
4275  mempool.clear();
4276  mapOrphanTransactions.clear();
4277  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.clear();
4278  nSyncStarted = 0;
4279  mapBlocksUnlinked.clear();
4280  vinfoBlockFile.clear();
4281  nLastBlockFile = 0;
4282  nBlockSequenceId = 1;
4283  mapBlockSource.clear();
4284  mapBlocksInFlight.clear();
4285  nPreferredDownload = 0;
4286  setDirtyBlockIndex.clear();
4287  setDirtyFileInfo.clear();
4288  mapNodeState.clear();
4289  recentRejects.reset(NULL);
4290  versionbitscache.Clear();
4291  for (int b = 0; b < VERSIONBITS_NUM_BITS; b++) {
4292  warningcache[b].clear();
4293  }
4294 
4295  BOOST_FOREACH(BlockMap::value_type& entry, mapBlockIndex) {
4296  delete entry.second;
4297  }
4298  mapBlockIndex.clear();
4299  fHavePruned = false;
4300 }
4301 
4302 bool LoadBlockIndex()
4303 {
4304  // Load block index from databases
4305  if (!fReindex && !LoadBlockIndexDB())
4306  return false;
4307  return true;
4308 }
4309 
4310 bool InitBlockIndex(const CChainParams& chainparams)
4311 {
4312  LOCK(cs_main);
4313 
4314  // Initialize global variables that cannot be constructed at startup.
4315  recentRejects.reset(new CRollingBloomFilter(120000, 0.000001));
4316 
4317  // Check whether we're already initialized
4318  if (chainActive.Genesis() != NULL)
4319  return true;
4320 
4321  // Use the provided setting for -txindex in the new database
4322  fTxIndex = GetBoolArg("-txindex", DEFAULT_TXINDEX);
4323  pblocktree->WriteFlag("txindex", fTxIndex);
4324  LogPrintf("Initializing databases...\n");
4325 
4326  // Only add the genesis block if not reindexing (in which case we reuse the one already on disk)
4327  if (!fReindex) {
4328  try {
4329  CBlock &block = const_cast<CBlock&>(chainparams.GenesisBlock());
4330  // Start new block file
4331  unsigned int nBlockSize = ::GetSerializeSize(block, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
4332  CDiskBlockPos blockPos;
4333  CValidationState state;
4334  if (!FindBlockPos(state, blockPos, nBlockSize+8, 0, block.GetBlockTime()))
4335  return error("LoadBlockIndex(): FindBlockPos failed");
4336  if (!WriteBlockToDisk(block, blockPos, chainparams.MessageStart()))
4337  return error("LoadBlockIndex(): writing genesis block to disk failed");
4338  CBlockIndex *pindex = AddToBlockIndex(block);
4339  if (!ReceivedBlockTransactions(block, state, pindex, blockPos))
4340  return error("LoadBlockIndex(): genesis block not accepted");
4341  // Force a chainstate write so that when we VerifyDB in a moment, it doesn't check stale data
4342  return FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS);
4343  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
4344  return error("LoadBlockIndex(): failed to initialize block database: %s", e.what());
4345  }
4346  }
4347 
4348  return true;
4349 }
4350 
4351 bool LoadExternalBlockFile(const CChainParams& chainparams, FILE* fileIn, CDiskBlockPos *dbp)
4352 {
4353  // Map of disk positions for blocks with unknown parent (only used for reindex)
4354  static std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos> mapBlocksUnknownParent;
4355  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMillis();
4356 
4357  int nLoaded = 0;
4358  try {
4359  // This takes over fileIn and calls fclose() on it in the CBufferedFile destructor
4360  CBufferedFile blkdat(fileIn, 2*MAX_BLOCK_SERIALIZED_SIZE, MAX_BLOCK_SERIALIZED_SIZE+8, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
4361  uint64_t nRewind = blkdat.GetPos();
4362  while (!blkdat.eof()) {
4363  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4364 
4365  blkdat.SetPos(nRewind);
4366  nRewind++; // start one byte further next time, in case of failure
4367  blkdat.SetLimit(); // remove former limit
4368  unsigned int nSize = 0;
4369  try {
4370  // locate a header
4371  unsigned char buf[CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE];
4372  blkdat.FindByte(chainparams.MessageStart()[0]);
4373  nRewind = blkdat.GetPos()+1;
4374  blkdat >> FLATDATA(buf);
4375  if (memcmp(buf, chainparams.MessageStart(), CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE))
4376  continue;
4377  // read size
4378  blkdat >> nSize;
4379  if (nSize < 80 || nSize > MAX_BLOCK_SERIALIZED_SIZE)
4380  continue;
4381  } catch (const std::exception&) {
4382  // no valid block header found; don't complain
4383  break;
4384  }
4385  try {
4386  // read block
4387  uint64_t nBlockPos = blkdat.GetPos();
4388  if (dbp)
4389  dbp->nPos = nBlockPos;
4390  blkdat.SetLimit(nBlockPos + nSize);
4391  blkdat.SetPos(nBlockPos);
4392  CBlock block;
4393  blkdat >> block;
4394  nRewind = blkdat.GetPos();
4395 
4396  // detect out of order blocks, and store them for later
4397  uint256 hash = block.GetHash();
4398  if (hash != chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock && mapBlockIndex.find(block.hashPrevBlock) == mapBlockIndex.end()) {
4399  LogPrint("reindex", "%s: Out of order block %s, parent %s not known\n", __func__, hash.ToString(),
4400  block.hashPrevBlock.ToString());
4401  if (dbp)
4402  mapBlocksUnknownParent.insert(std::make_pair(block.hashPrevBlock, *dbp));
4403  continue;
4404  }
4405 
4406  // process in case the block isn't known yet
4407  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash) == 0 || (mapBlockIndex[hash]->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) == 0) {
4408  LOCK(cs_main);
4409  CValidationState state;
4410  if (AcceptBlock(block, state, chainparams, NULL, true, dbp, NULL))
4411  nLoaded++;
4412  if (state.IsError())
4413  break;
4414  } else if (hash != chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock && mapBlockIndex[hash]->nHeight % 1000 == 0) {
4415  LogPrint("reindex", "Block Import: already had block %s at height %d\n", hash.ToString(), mapBlockIndex[hash]->nHeight);
4416  }
4417 
4418  // Activate the genesis block so normal node progress can continue
4419  if (hash == chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock) {
4420  CValidationState state;
4421  if (!ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams)) {
4422  break;
4423  }
4424  }
4425 
4426  NotifyHeaderTip();
4427 
4428  // Recursively process earlier encountered successors of this block
4429  deque<uint256> queue;
4430  queue.push_back(hash);
4431  while (!queue.empty()) {
4432  uint256 head = queue.front();
4433  queue.pop_front();
4434  std::pair<std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos>::iterator, std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos>::iterator> range = mapBlocksUnknownParent.equal_range(head);
4435  while (range.first != range.second) {
4436  std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos>::iterator it = range.first;
4437  if (ReadBlockFromDisk(block, it->second, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4438  {
4439  LogPrint("reindex", "%s: Processing out of order child %s of %s\n", __func__, block.GetHash().ToString(),
4440  head.ToString());
4441  LOCK(cs_main);
4442  CValidationState dummy;
4443  if (AcceptBlock(block, dummy, chainparams, NULL, true, &it->second, NULL))
4444  {
4445  nLoaded++;
4446  queue.push_back(block.GetHash());
4447  }
4448  }
4449  range.first++;
4450  mapBlocksUnknownParent.erase(it);
4451  NotifyHeaderTip();
4452  }
4453  }
4454  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
4455  LogPrintf("%s: Deserialize or I/O error - %s\n", __func__, e.what());
4456  }
4457  }
4458  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
4459  AbortNode(std::string("System error: ") + e.what());
4460  }
4461  if (nLoaded > 0)
4462  LogPrintf("Loaded %i blocks from external file in %dms\n", nLoaded, GetTimeMillis() - nStart);
4463  return nLoaded > 0;
4464 }
4465 
4466 void static CheckBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
4467 {
4468  if (!fCheckBlockIndex) {
4469  return;
4470  }
4471 
4472  LOCK(cs_main);
4473 
4474  // During a reindex, we read the genesis block and call CheckBlockIndex before ActivateBestChain,
4475  // so we have the genesis block in mapBlockIndex but no active chain. (A few of the tests when
4476  // iterating the block tree require that chainActive has been initialized.)
4477  if (chainActive.Height() < 0) {
4478  assert(mapBlockIndex.size() <= 1);
4479  return;
4480  }
4481 
4482  // Build forward-pointing map of the entire block tree.
4483  std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*> forward;
4484  for (BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin(); it != mapBlockIndex.end(); it++) {
4485  forward.insert(std::make_pair(it->second->pprev, it->second));
4486  }
4487 
4488  assert(forward.size() == mapBlockIndex.size());
4489 
4490  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> rangeGenesis = forward.equal_range(NULL);
4491  CBlockIndex *pindex = rangeGenesis.first->second;
4492  rangeGenesis.first++;
4493  assert(rangeGenesis.first == rangeGenesis.second); // There is only one index entry with parent NULL.
4494 
4495  // Iterate over the entire block tree, using depth-first search.
4496  // Along the way, remember whether there are blocks on the path from genesis
4497  // block being explored which are the first to have certain properties.
4498  size_t nNodes = 0;
4499  int nHeight = 0;
4500  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstInvalid = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which is invalid.
4501  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstMissing = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_HAVE_DATA.
4502  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNeverProcessed = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex for which nTx == 0.
4503  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotTreeValid = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_TREE (regardless of being valid or not).
4504  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS (regardless of being valid or not).
4505  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotChainValid = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN (regardless of being valid or not).
4506  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotScriptsValid = NULL; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS (regardless of being valid or not).
4507  while (pindex != NULL) {
4508  nNodes++;
4509  if (pindexFirstInvalid == NULL && pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_VALID) pindexFirstInvalid = pindex;
4510  if (pindexFirstMissing == NULL && !(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) pindexFirstMissing = pindex;
4511  if (pindexFirstNeverProcessed == NULL && pindex->nTx == 0) pindexFirstNeverProcessed = pindex;
4512  if (pindex->pprev != NULL && pindexFirstNotTreeValid == NULL && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_TREE) pindexFirstNotTreeValid = pindex;
4513  if (pindex->pprev != NULL && pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid == NULL && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid = pindex;
4514  if (pindex->pprev != NULL && pindexFirstNotChainValid == NULL && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN) pindexFirstNotChainValid = pindex;
4515  if (pindex->pprev != NULL && pindexFirstNotScriptsValid == NULL && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS) pindexFirstNotScriptsValid = pindex;
4516 
4517  // Begin: actual consistency checks.
4518  if (pindex->pprev == NULL) {
4519  // Genesis block checks.
4520  assert(pindex->GetBlockHash() == consensusParams.hashGenesisBlock); // Genesis block's hash must match.
4521  assert(pindex == chainActive.Genesis()); // The current active chain's genesis block must be this block.
4522  }
4523  if (pindex->nChainTx == 0) assert(pindex->nSequenceId <= 0); // nSequenceId can't be set positive for blocks that aren't linked (negative is used for preciousblock)
4524  // VALID_TRANSACTIONS is equivalent to nTx > 0 for all nodes (whether or not pruning has occurred).
4525  // HAVE_DATA is only equivalent to nTx > 0 (or VALID_TRANSACTIONS) if no pruning has occurred.
4526  if (!fHavePruned) {
4527  // If we've never pruned, then HAVE_DATA should be equivalent to nTx > 0
4528  assert(!(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) == (pindex->nTx == 0));
4529  assert(pindexFirstMissing == pindexFirstNeverProcessed);
4530  } else {
4531  // If we have pruned, then we can only say that HAVE_DATA implies nTx > 0
4532  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) assert(pindex->nTx > 0);
4533  }
4534  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO) assert(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA);
4535  assert(((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) == (pindex->nTx > 0)); // This is pruning-independent.
4536  // All parents having had data (at some point) is equivalent to all parents being VALID_TRANSACTIONS, which is equivalent to nChainTx being set.
4537  assert((pindexFirstNeverProcessed != NULL) == (pindex->nChainTx == 0)); // nChainTx != 0 is used to signal that all parent blocks have been processed (but may have been pruned).
4538  assert((pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid != NULL) == (pindex->nChainTx == 0));
4539  assert(pindex->nHeight == nHeight); // nHeight must be consistent.
4540  assert(pindex->pprev == NULL || pindex->nChainWork >= pindex->pprev->nChainWork); // For every block except the genesis block, the chainwork must be larger than the parent's.
4541  assert(nHeight < 2 || (pindex->pskip && (pindex->pskip->nHeight < nHeight))); // The pskip pointer must point back for all but the first 2 blocks.
4542  assert(pindexFirstNotTreeValid == NULL); // All mapBlockIndex entries must at least be TREE valid
4543  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_TREE) assert(pindexFirstNotTreeValid == NULL); // TREE valid implies all parents are TREE valid
4544  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN) assert(pindexFirstNotChainValid == NULL); // CHAIN valid implies all parents are CHAIN valid
4545  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS) assert(pindexFirstNotScriptsValid == NULL); // SCRIPTS valid implies all parents are SCRIPTS valid
4546  if (pindexFirstInvalid == NULL) {
4547  // Checks for not-invalid blocks.
4548  assert((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK) == 0); // The failed mask cannot be set for blocks without invalid parents.
4549  }
4550  if (!CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(pindex, chainActive.Tip()) && pindexFirstNeverProcessed == NULL) {
4551  if (pindexFirstInvalid == NULL) {
4552  // If this block sorts at least as good as the current tip and
4553  // is valid and we have all data for its parents, it must be in
4554  // setBlockIndexCandidates. chainActive.Tip() must also be there
4555  // even if some data has been pruned.
4556  if (pindexFirstMissing == NULL || pindex == chainActive.Tip()) {
4557  assert(setBlockIndexCandidates.count(pindex));
4558  }
4559  // If some parent is missing, then it could be that this block was in
4560  // setBlockIndexCandidates but had to be removed because of the missing data.
4561  // In this case it must be in mapBlocksUnlinked -- see test below.
4562  }
4563  } else { // If this block sorts worse than the current tip or some ancestor's block has never been seen, it cannot be in setBlockIndexCandidates.
4564  assert(setBlockIndexCandidates.count(pindex) == 0);
4565  }
4566  // Check whether this block is in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4567  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> rangeUnlinked = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindex->pprev);
4568  bool foundInUnlinked = false;
4569  while (rangeUnlinked.first != rangeUnlinked.second) {
4570  assert(rangeUnlinked.first->first == pindex->pprev);
4571  if (rangeUnlinked.first->second == pindex) {
4572  foundInUnlinked = true;
4573  break;
4574  }
4575  rangeUnlinked.first++;
4576  }
4577  if (pindex->pprev && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) && pindexFirstNeverProcessed != NULL && pindexFirstInvalid == NULL) {
4578  // If this block has block data available, some parent was never received, and has no invalid parents, it must be in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4579  assert(foundInUnlinked);
4580  }
4581  if (!(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) assert(!foundInUnlinked); // Can't be in mapBlocksUnlinked if we don't HAVE_DATA
4582  if (pindexFirstMissing == NULL) assert(!foundInUnlinked); // We aren't missing data for any parent -- cannot be in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4583  if (pindex->pprev && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) && pindexFirstNeverProcessed == NULL && pindexFirstMissing != NULL) {
4584  // We HAVE_DATA for this block, have received data for all parents at some point, but we're currently missing data for some parent.
4585  assert(fHavePruned); // We must have pruned.
4586  // This block may have entered mapBlocksUnlinked if:
4587  // - it has a descendant that at some point had more work than the
4588  // tip, and
4589  // - we tried switching to that descendant but were missing
4590  // data for some intermediate block between chainActive and the
4591  // tip.
4592  // So if this block is itself better than chainActive.Tip() and it wasn't in
4593  // setBlockIndexCandidates, then it must be in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4594  if (!CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(pindex, chainActive.Tip()) && setBlockIndexCandidates.count(pindex) == 0) {
4595  if (pindexFirstInvalid == NULL) {
4596  assert(foundInUnlinked);
4597  }
4598  }
4599  }
4600  // assert(pindex->GetBlockHash() == pindex->GetBlockHeader().GetHash()); // Perhaps too slow
4601  // End: actual consistency checks.
4602 
4603  // Try descending into the first subnode.
4604  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> range = forward.equal_range(pindex);
4605  if (range.first != range.second) {
4606  // A subnode was found.
4607  pindex = range.first->second;
4608  nHeight++;
4609  continue;
4610  }
4611  // This is a leaf node.
4612  // Move upwards until we reach a node of which we have not yet visited the last child.
4613  while (pindex) {
4614  // We are going to either move to a parent or a sibling of pindex.
4615  // If pindex was the first with a certain property, unset the corresponding variable.
4616  if (pindex == pindexFirstInvalid) pindexFirstInvalid = NULL;
4617  if (pindex == pindexFirstMissing) pindexFirstMissing = NULL;
4618  if (pindex == pindexFirstNeverProcessed) pindexFirstNeverProcessed = NULL;
4619  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotTreeValid) pindexFirstNotTreeValid = NULL;
4620  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid) pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid = NULL;
4621  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotChainValid) pindexFirstNotChainValid = NULL;
4622  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotScriptsValid) pindexFirstNotScriptsValid = NULL;
4623  // Find our parent.
4624  CBlockIndex* pindexPar = pindex->pprev;
4625  // Find which child we just visited.
4626  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> rangePar = forward.equal_range(pindexPar);
4627  while (rangePar.first->second != pindex) {
4628  assert(rangePar.first != rangePar.second); // Our parent must have at least the node we're coming from as child.
4629  rangePar.first++;
4630  }
4631  // Proceed to the next one.
4632  rangePar.first++;
4633  if (rangePar.first != rangePar.second) {
4634  // Move to the sibling.
4635  pindex = rangePar.first->second;
4636  break;
4637  } else {
4638  // Move up further.
4639  pindex = pindexPar;
4640  nHeight--;
4641  continue;
4642  }
4643  }
4644  }
4645 
4646  // Check that we actually traversed the entire map.
4647  assert(nNodes == forward.size());
4648 }
4649 
4650 std::string GetWarnings(const std::string& strFor)
4651 {
4652  string strStatusBar;
4653  string strRPC;
4654  string strGUI;
4655  const string uiAlertSeperator = "<hr />";
4656 
4657  if (!CLIENT_VERSION_IS_RELEASE) {
4658  strStatusBar = "This is a pre-release test build - use at your own risk - do not use for mining or merchant applications";
4659  strGUI = _("This is a pre-release test build - use at your own risk - do not use for mining or merchant applications");
4660  }
4661 
4662  if (GetBoolArg("-testsafemode", DEFAULT_TESTSAFEMODE))
4663  strStatusBar = strRPC = strGUI = "testsafemode enabled";
4664 
4665  // Misc warnings like out of disk space and clock is wrong
4666  if (strMiscWarning != "")
4667  {
4668  strStatusBar = strMiscWarning;
4669  strGUI += (strGUI.empty() ? "" : uiAlertSeperator) + strMiscWarning;
4670  }
4671 
4672  if (fLargeWorkForkFound)
4673  {
4674  strStatusBar = strRPC = "Warning: The network does not appear to fully agree! Some miners appear to be experiencing issues.";
4675  strGUI += (strGUI.empty() ? "" : uiAlertSeperator) + _("Warning: The network does not appear to fully agree! Some miners appear to be experiencing issues.");
4676  }
4677  else if (fLargeWorkInvalidChainFound)
4678  {
4679  strStatusBar = strRPC = "Warning: We do not appear to fully agree with our peers! You may need to upgrade, or other nodes may need to upgrade.";
4680  strGUI += (strGUI.empty() ? "" : uiAlertSeperator) + _("Warning: We do not appear to fully agree with our peers! You may need to upgrade, or other nodes may need to upgrade.");
4681  }
4682 
4683  if (strFor == "gui")
4684  return strGUI;
4685  else if (strFor == "statusbar")
4686  return strStatusBar;
4687  else if (strFor == "rpc")
4688  return strRPC;
4689  assert(!"GetWarnings(): invalid parameter");
4690  return "error";
4691 }
4692 
4693 
4694 
4695 
4696 
4697 
4698 
4699 
4701 //
4702 // blockchain -> download logic notification
4703 //
4704 
4705 void PeerLogicValidation::UpdatedBlockTip(const CBlockIndex *pindexNew, const CBlockIndex *pindexFork, bool fInitialDownload) {
4706  const int nNewHeight = pindexNew->nHeight;
4707  connman->SetBestHeight(nNewHeight);
4708 
4709  if (!fInitialDownload) {
4710  // Find the hashes of all blocks that weren't previously in the best chain.
4711  std::vector<uint256> vHashes;
4712  const CBlockIndex *pindexToAnnounce = pindexNew;
4713  while (pindexToAnnounce != pindexFork) {
4714  vHashes.push_back(pindexToAnnounce->GetBlockHash());
4715  pindexToAnnounce = pindexToAnnounce->pprev;
4716  if (vHashes.size() == MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE) {
4717  // Limit announcements in case of a huge reorganization.
4718  // Rely on the peer's synchronization mechanism in that case.
4719  break;
4720  }
4721  }
4722  // Relay inventory, but don't relay old inventory during initial block download.
4723  connman->ForEachNode([nNewHeight, &vHashes](CNode* pnode) {
4724  if (nNewHeight > (pnode->nStartingHeight != -1 ? pnode->nStartingHeight - 2000 : 0)) {
4725  BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH(const uint256& hash, vHashes) {
4726  pnode->PushBlockHash(hash);
4727  }
4728  }
4729  });
4730  }
4731 }
4732 
4733 void PeerLogicValidation::BlockChecked(const CBlock& block, const CValidationState& state) {
4734  LOCK(cs_main);
4735 
4736  const uint256 hash(block.GetHash());
4737  std::map<uint256, NodeId>::iterator it = mapBlockSource.find(hash);
4738 
4739  int nDoS = 0;
4740  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
4741  if (it != mapBlockSource.end() && State(it->second)) {
4742  assert (state.GetRejectCode() < REJECT_INTERNAL); // Blocks are never rejected with internal reject codes
4743  CBlockReject reject = {(unsigned char)state.GetRejectCode(), state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), hash};
4744  State(it->second)->rejects.push_back(reject);
4745  if (nDoS > 0)
4746  Misbehaving(it->second, nDoS);
4747  }
4748  }
4749  if (it != mapBlockSource.end())
4750  mapBlockSource.erase(it);
4751 }
4752 
4754 //
4755 // Messages
4756 //
4757 
4758 
4759 bool static AlreadyHave(const CInv& inv) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
4760 {
4761  switch (inv.type)
4762  {
4763  case MSG_TX:
4764  case MSG_WITNESS_TX:
4765  {
4766  assert(recentRejects);
4767  if (chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash() != hashRecentRejectsChainTip)
4768  {
4769  // If the chain tip has changed previously rejected transactions
4770  // might be now valid, e.g. due to a nLockTime'd tx becoming valid,
4771  // or a double-spend. Reset the rejects filter and give those
4772  // txs a second chance.
4773  hashRecentRejectsChainTip = chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash();
4774  recentRejects->reset();
4775  }
4776 
4777  // Use pcoinsTip->HaveCoinsInCache as a quick approximation to exclude
4778  // requesting or processing some txs which have already been included in a block
4779  return recentRejects->contains(inv.hash) ||
4780  mempool.exists(inv.hash) ||
4781  mapOrphanTransactions.count(inv.hash) ||
4782  pcoinsTip->HaveCoinsInCache(inv.hash);
4783  }
4784  case MSG_BLOCK:
4785  case MSG_WITNESS_BLOCK:
4786  return mapBlockIndex.count(inv.hash);
4787  }
4788  // Don't know what it is, just say we already got one
4789  return true;
4790 }
4791 
4792 static void RelayTransaction(const CTransaction& tx, CConnman& connman)
4793 {
4794  CInv inv(MSG_TX, tx.GetHash());
4795  connman.ForEachNode([&inv](CNode* pnode)
4796  {
4797  pnode->PushInventory(inv);
4798  });
4799 }
4800 
4801 static void RelayAddress(const CAddress& addr, bool fReachable, CConnman& connman)
4802 {
4803  int nRelayNodes = fReachable ? 2 : 1; // limited relaying of addresses outside our network(s)
4804 
4805  // Relay to a limited number of other nodes
4806  // Use deterministic randomness to send to the same nodes for 24 hours
4807  // at a time so the addrKnowns of the chosen nodes prevent repeats
4808  uint64_t hashAddr = addr.GetHash();
4809  std::multimap<uint64_t, CNode*> mapMix;
4810  const CSipHasher hasher = connman.GetDeterministicRandomizer(RANDOMIZER_ID_ADDRESS_RELAY).Write(hashAddr << 32).Write((GetTime() + hashAddr) / (24*60*60));
4811  FastRandomContext insecure_rand;
4812 
4813  auto sortfunc = [&mapMix, &hasher](CNode* pnode) {
4814  if (pnode->nVersion >= CADDR_TIME_VERSION) {
4815  uint64_t hashKey = CSipHasher(hasher).Write(pnode->id).Finalize();
4816  mapMix.emplace(hashKey, pnode);
4817  }
4818  };
4819 
4820  auto pushfunc = [&addr, &mapMix, &nRelayNodes, &insecure_rand] {
4821  for (auto mi = mapMix.begin(); mi != mapMix.end() && nRelayNodes-- > 0; ++mi)
4822  mi->second->PushAddress(addr, insecure_rand);
4823  };
4824 
4825  connman.ForEachNodeThen(std::move(sortfunc), std::move(pushfunc));
4826 }
4827 
4828 void static ProcessGetData(CNode* pfrom, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, CConnman& connman)
4829 {
4830  std::deque<CInv>::iterator it = pfrom->vRecvGetData.begin();
4831  unsigned int nMaxSendBufferSize = connman.GetSendBufferSize();
4832 
4833  vector<CInv> vNotFound;
4834 
4835  LOCK(cs_main);
4836 
4837  while (it != pfrom->vRecvGetData.end()) {
4838  // Don't bother if send buffer is too full to respond anyway
4839  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= nMaxSendBufferSize)
4840  break;
4841 
4842  const CInv &inv = *it;
4843  {
4844  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4845  it++;
4846 
4847  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_CMPCT_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_WITNESS_BLOCK)
4848  {
4849  bool send = false;
4850  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(inv.hash);
4851  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end())
4852  {
4853  if (chainActive.Contains(mi->second)) {
4854  send = true;
4855  } else {
4856  static const int nOneMonth = 30 * 24 * 60 * 60;
4857  // To prevent fingerprinting attacks, only send blocks outside of the active
4858  // chain if they are valid, and no more than a month older (both in time, and in
4859  // best equivalent proof of work) than the best header chain we know about.
4860  send = mi->second->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS) && (pindexBestHeader != NULL) &&
4861  (pindexBestHeader->GetBlockTime() - mi->second->GetBlockTime() < nOneMonth) &&
4862  (GetBlockProofEquivalentTime(*pindexBestHeader, *mi->second, *pindexBestHeader, consensusParams) < nOneMonth);
4863  if (!send) {
4864  LogPrintf("%s: ignoring request from peer=%i for old block that isn't in the main chain\n", __func__, pfrom->GetId());
4865  }
4866  }
4867  }
4868  // disconnect node in case we have reached the outbound limit for serving historical blocks
4869  // never disconnect whitelisted nodes
4870  static const int nOneWeek = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60; // assume > 1 week = historical
4871  if (send && connman.OutboundTargetReached(true) && ( ((pindexBestHeader != NULL) && (pindexBestHeader->GetBlockTime() - mi->second->GetBlockTime() > nOneWeek)) || inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK) && !pfrom->fWhitelisted)
4872  {
4873  LogPrint("net", "historical block serving limit reached, disconnect peer=%d\n", pfrom->GetId());
4874 
4875  //disconnect node
4876  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
4877  send = false;
4878  }
4879  // Pruned nodes may have deleted the block, so check whether
4880  // it's available before trying to send.
4881  if (send && (mi->second->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA))
4882  {
4883  // Send block from disk
4884  CBlock block;
4885  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, (*mi).second, consensusParams))
4886  assert(!"cannot load block from disk");
4887  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK)
4888  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::BLOCK, block);
4889  else if (inv.type == MSG_WITNESS_BLOCK)
4890  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::BLOCK, block);
4891  else if (inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK)
4892  {
4893  bool sendMerkleBlock = false;
4894  CMerkleBlock merkleBlock;
4895  {
4896  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
4897  if (pfrom->pfilter) {
4898  sendMerkleBlock = true;
4899  merkleBlock = CMerkleBlock(block, *pfrom->pfilter);
4900  }
4901  }
4902  if (sendMerkleBlock) {
4903  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::MERKLEBLOCK, merkleBlock);
4904  // CMerkleBlock just contains hashes, so also push any transactions in the block the client did not see
4905  // This avoids hurting performance by pointlessly requiring a round-trip
4906  // Note that there is currently no way for a node to request any single transactions we didn't send here -
4907  // they must either disconnect and retry or request the full block.
4908  // Thus, the protocol spec specified allows for us to provide duplicate txn here,
4909  // however we MUST always provide at least what the remote peer needs
4910  typedef std::pair<unsigned int, uint256> PairType;
4911  BOOST_FOREACH(PairType& pair, merkleBlock.vMatchedTxn)
4912  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::TX, block.vtx[pair.first]);
4913  }
4914  // else
4915  // no response
4916  }
4917  else if (inv.type == MSG_CMPCT_BLOCK)
4918  {
4919  // If a peer is asking for old blocks, we're almost guaranteed
4920  // they wont have a useful mempool to match against a compact block,
4921  // and we don't feel like constructing the object for them, so
4922  // instead we respond with the full, non-compact block.
4923  bool fPeerWantsWitness = State(pfrom->GetId())->fWantsCmpctWitness;
4924  if (CanDirectFetch(consensusParams) && mi->second->nHeight >= chainActive.Height() - MAX_CMPCTBLOCK_DEPTH) {
4925  CBlockHeaderAndShortTxIDs cmpctblock(block, fPeerWantsWitness);
4926  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(fPeerWantsWitness ? 0 : SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::CMPCTBLOCK, cmpctblock);
4927  } else
4928  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(fPeerWantsWitness ? 0 : SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::BLOCK, block);
4929  }
4930 
4931  // Trigger the peer node to send a getblocks request for the next batch of inventory
4932  if (inv.hash == pfrom->hashContinue)
4933  {
4934  // Bypass PushInventory, this must send even if redundant,
4935  // and we want it right after the last block so they don't
4936  // wait for other stuff first.
4937  vector<CInv> vInv;
4938  vInv.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash()));
4939  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::INV, vInv);
4940  pfrom->hashContinue.SetNull();
4941  }
4942  }
4943  }
4944  else if (inv.type == MSG_TX || inv.type == MSG_WITNESS_TX)
4945  {
4946  // Send stream from relay memory
4947  bool push = false;
4948  auto mi = mapRelay.find(inv.hash);
4949  if (mi != mapRelay.end()) {
4950  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(inv.type == MSG_TX ? SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS : 0, NetMsgType::TX, *mi->second);
4951  push = true;
4952  } else if (pfrom->timeLastMempoolReq) {
4953  auto txinfo = mempool.info(inv.hash);
4954  // To protect privacy, do not answer getdata using the mempool when
4955  // that TX couldn't have been INVed in reply to a MEMPOOL request.
4956  if (txinfo.tx && txinfo.nTime <= pfrom->timeLastMempoolReq) {
4957  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(inv.type == MSG_TX ? SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS : 0, NetMsgType::TX, *txinfo.tx);
4958  push = true;
4959  }
4960  }
4961  if (!push) {
4962  vNotFound.push_back(inv);
4963  }
4964  }
4965 
4966  // Track requests for our stuff.
4967  GetMainSignals().Inventory(inv.hash);
4968 
4969  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_CMPCT_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_WITNESS_BLOCK)
4970  break;
4971  }
4972  }
4973 
4974  pfrom->vRecvGetData.erase(pfrom->vRecvGetData.begin(), it);
4975 
4976  if (!vNotFound.empty()) {
4977  // Let the peer know that we didn't find what it asked for, so it doesn't
4978  // have to wait around forever. Currently only SPV clients actually care
4979  // about this message: it's needed when they are recursively walking the
4980  // dependencies of relevant unconfirmed transactions. SPV clients want to
4981  // do that because they want to know about (and store and rebroadcast and
4982  // risk analyze) the dependencies of transactions relevant to them, without
4983  // having to download the entire memory pool.
4984  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::NOTFOUND, vNotFound);
4985  }
4986 }
4987 
4988 uint32_t GetFetchFlags(CNode* pfrom, CBlockIndex* pprev, const Consensus::Params& chainparams) {
4989  uint32_t nFetchFlags = 0;
4990  if ((pfrom->GetLocalServices() & NODE_WITNESS) && State(pfrom->GetId())->fHaveWitness) {
4991  nFetchFlags |= MSG_WITNESS_FLAG;
4992  }
4993  return nFetchFlags;
4994 }
4995 
4996 bool static ProcessMessage(CNode* pfrom, string strCommand, CDataStream& vRecv, int64_t nTimeReceived, const CChainParams& chainparams, CConnman& connman)
4997 {
4998  unsigned int nMaxSendBufferSize = connman.GetSendBufferSize();
4999 
5000  LogPrint("net", "received: %s (%u bytes) peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(strCommand), vRecv.size(), pfrom->id);
5001  if (mapArgs.count("-dropmessagestest") && GetRand(atoi(mapArgs["-dropmessagestest"])) == 0)
5002  {
5003  LogPrintf("dropmessagestest DROPPING RECV MESSAGE\n");
5004  return true;
5005  }
5006 
5007 
5008  if (!(pfrom->GetLocalServices() & NODE_BLOOM) &&
5009  (strCommand == NetMsgType::FILTERLOAD ||
5010  strCommand == NetMsgType::FILTERADD ||
5011  strCommand == NetMsgType::FILTERCLEAR))
5012  {
5013  if (pfrom->nVersion >= NO_BLOOM_VERSION) {
5014  LOCK(cs_main);
5015  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
5016  return false;
5017  } else {
5018  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
5019  return false;
5020  }
5021  }
5022 
5023 
5024  if (strCommand == NetMsgType::VERSION)
5025  {
5026  // Feeler connections exist only to verify if address is online.
5027  if (pfrom->fFeeler) {
5028  assert(pfrom->fInbound == false);
5029  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
5030  }
5031 
5032  // Each connection can only send one version message
5033  if (pfrom->nVersion != 0)
5034  {
5035  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, REJECT_DUPLICATE, string("Duplicate version message"));
5036  LOCK(cs_main);
5037  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 1);
5038  return false;
5039  }
5040 
5041  int64_t nTime;
5042  CAddress addrMe;
5043  CAddress addrFrom;
5044  uint64_t nNonce = 1;
5045  uint64_t nServiceInt;
5046  vRecv >> pfrom->nVersion >> nServiceInt >> nTime >> addrMe;
5047  pfrom->nServices = ServiceFlags(nServiceInt);
5048  if (!pfrom->fInbound)
5049  {
5050  connman.SetServices(pfrom->addr, pfrom->nServices);
5051  }
5052  if (pfrom->nServicesExpected & ~pfrom->nServices)
5053  {
5054  LogPrint("net", "peer=%d does not offer the expected services (%08x offered, %08x expected); disconnecting\n", pfrom->id, pfrom->nServices, pfrom->nServicesExpected);
5055  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, REJECT_NONSTANDARD,
5056  strprintf("Expected to offer services %08x", pfrom->nServicesExpected));
5057  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
5058  return false;
5059  }
5060 
5061  if (pfrom->nVersion < MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION)
5062  {
5063  // disconnect from peers older than this proto version
5064  LogPrintf("peer=%d using obsolete version %i; disconnecting\n", pfrom->id, pfrom->nVersion);
5065  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, REJECT_OBSOLETE,
5066  strprintf("Version must be %d or greater", MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION));
5067  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
5068  return false;
5069  }
5070 
5071  if (pfrom->nVersion == 10300)
5072  pfrom->nVersion = 300;
5073  if (!vRecv.empty())
5074  vRecv >> addrFrom >> nNonce;
5075  if (!vRecv.empty()) {
5076  vRecv >> LIMITED_STRING(pfrom->strSubVer, MAX_SUBVERSION_LENGTH);
5077  pfrom->cleanSubVer = SanitizeString(pfrom->strSubVer);
5078  }
5079  if (!vRecv.empty()) {
5080  vRecv >> pfrom->nStartingHeight;
5081  }
5082  {
5083  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
5084  if (!vRecv.empty())
5085  vRecv >> pfrom->fRelayTxes; // set to true after we get the first filter* message
5086  else
5087  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
5088  }
5089 
5090  // Disconnect if we connected to ourself
5091  if (pfrom->fInbound && !connman.CheckIncomingNonce(nNonce))
5092  {
5093  LogPrintf("connected to self at %s, disconnecting\n", pfrom->addr.ToString());
5094  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
5095  return true;
5096  }
5097 
5098  pfrom->addrLocal = addrMe;
5099  if (pfrom->fInbound && addrMe.IsRoutable())
5100  {
5101  SeenLocal(addrMe);
5102  }
5103 
5104  // Be shy and don't send version until we hear
5105  if (pfrom->fInbound)
5106  pfrom->PushVersion();
5107 
5108  pfrom->fClient = !(pfrom->nServices & NODE_NETWORK);
5109 
5110  if((pfrom->nServices & NODE_WITNESS))
5111  {
5112  LOCK(cs_main);
5113  State(pfrom->GetId())->fHaveWitness = true;
5114  }
5115 
5116  // Potentially mark this peer as a preferred download peer.
5117  {
5118  LOCK(cs_main);
5119  UpdatePreferredDownload(pfrom, State(pfrom->GetId()));
5120  }
5121 
5122  // Change version
5123  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::VERACK);
5124  pfrom->ssSend.SetVersion(min(pfrom->nVersion, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
5125 
5126  if (!pfrom->fInbound)
5127  {
5128  // Advertise our address
5129  if (fListen && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
5130  {
5131  CAddress addr = GetLocalAddress(&pfrom->addr, pfrom->GetLocalServices());
5132  FastRandomContext insecure_rand;
5133  if (addr.IsRoutable())
5134  {
5135  LogPrint("net", "ProcessMessages: advertising address %s\n", addr.ToString());
5136  pfrom->PushAddress(addr, insecure_rand);
5137  } else if (IsPeerAddrLocalGood(pfrom)) {
5138  addr.SetIP(pfrom->addrLocal);
5139  LogPrint("net", "ProcessMessages: advertising address %s\n", addr.ToString());
5140  pfrom->PushAddress(addr, insecure_rand);
5141  }
5142  }
5143 
5144  // Get recent addresses
5145  if (pfrom->fOneShot || pfrom->nVersion >= CADDR_TIME_VERSION || connman.GetAddressCount() < 1000)
5146  {
5147  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETADDR);
5148  pfrom->fGetAddr = true;
5149  }
5150  connman.MarkAddressGood(pfrom->addr);
5151  }
5152 
5153  pfrom->fSuccessfullyConnected = true;
5154 
5155  string remoteAddr;
5156  if (fLogIPs)
5157  remoteAddr = ", peeraddr=" + pfrom->addr.ToString();
5158 
5159  LogPrintf("receive version message: %s: version %d, blocks=%d, us=%s, peer=%d%s\n",
5160  pfrom->cleanSubVer, pfrom->nVersion,
5161  pfrom->nStartingHeight, addrMe.ToString(), pfrom->id,
5162  remoteAddr);
5163 
5164  int64_t nTimeOffset = nTime - GetTime();
5165  pfrom->nTimeOffset = nTimeOffset;
5166  AddTimeData(pfrom->addr, nTimeOffset);
5167  }
5168 
5169 
5170  else if (pfrom->nVersion == 0)
5171  {
5172  // Must have a version message before anything else
5173  LOCK(cs_main);
5174  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 1);
5175  return false;
5176  }
5177 
5178 
5179  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::VERACK)
5180  {
5181  pfrom->SetRecvVersion(min(pfrom->nVersion, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
5182 
5183  // Mark this node as currently connected, so we update its timestamp later.
5184  if (pfrom->fNetworkNode) {
5185  LOCK(cs_main);
5186  State(pfrom->GetId())->fCurrentlyConnected = true;
5187  }
5188 
5189  if (pfrom->nVersion >= SENDHEADERS_VERSION) {
5190  // Tell our peer we prefer to receive headers rather than inv's
5191  // We send this to non-NODE NETWORK peers as well, because even
5192  // non-NODE NETWORK peers can announce blocks (such as pruning
5193  // nodes)
5194  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::SENDHEADERS);
5195  }
5196  if (pfrom->nVersion >= SHORT_IDS_BLOCKS_VERSION) {
5197  // Tell our peer we are willing to provide version 1 or 2 cmpctblocks
5198  // However, we do not request new block announcements using
5199  // cmpctblock messages.
5200  // We send this to non-NODE NETWORK peers as well, because
5201  // they may wish to request compact blocks from us
5202  bool fAnnounceUsingCMPCTBLOCK = false;
5203  uint64_t nCMPCTBLOCKVersion = 2;
5204  if (pfrom->GetLocalServices() & NODE_WITNESS)
5205  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::SENDCMPCT, fAnnounceUsingCMPCTBLOCK, nCMPCTBLOCKVersion);
5206  nCMPCTBLOCKVersion = 1;
5207  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::SENDCMPCT, fAnnounceUsingCMPCTBLOCK, nCMPCTBLOCKVersion);
5208  }
5209  }
5210 
5211 
5212  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::ADDR)
5213  {
5214  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
5215  vRecv >> vAddr;
5216 
5217  // Don't want addr from older versions unless seeding
5218  if (pfrom->nVersion < CADDR_TIME_VERSION && connman.GetAddressCount() > 1000)
5219  return true;
5220  if (vAddr.size() > 1000)
5221  {
5222  LOCK(cs_main);
5223  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
5224  return error("message addr size() = %u", vAddr.size());
5225  }
5226 
5227  // Store the new addresses
5228  vector<CAddress> vAddrOk;
5229  int64_t nNow = GetAdjustedTime();
5230  int64_t nSince = nNow - 10 * 60;
5231  BOOST_FOREACH(CAddress& addr, vAddr)
5232  {
5233  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
5234 
5235  if ((addr.nServices & REQUIRED_SERVICES) != REQUIRED_SERVICES)
5236  continue;
5237 
5238  if (addr.nTime <= 100000000 || addr.nTime > nNow + 10 * 60)
5239  addr.nTime = nNow - 5 * 24 * 60 * 60;
5240  pfrom->AddAddressKnown(addr);
5241  bool fReachable = IsReachable(addr);
5242  if (addr.nTime > nSince && !pfrom->fGetAddr && vAddr.size() <= 10 && addr.IsRoutable())
5243  {
5244  // Relay to a limited number of other nodes
5245  RelayAddress(addr, fReachable, connman);
5246  }
5247  // Do not store addresses outside our network
5248  if (fReachable)
5249  vAddrOk.push_back(addr);
5250  }
5251  connman.AddNewAddresses(vAddrOk, pfrom->addr, 2 * 60 * 60);
5252  if (vAddr.size() < 1000)
5253  pfrom->fGetAddr = false;
5254  if (pfrom->fOneShot)
5255  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
5256  }
5257 
5258  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::SENDHEADERS)
5259  {
5260  LOCK(cs_main);
5261  State(pfrom->GetId())->fPreferHeaders = true;
5262  }
5263 
5264  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::SENDCMPCT)
5265  {
5266  bool fAnnounceUsingCMPCTBLOCK = false;
5267  uint64_t nCMPCTBLOCKVersion = 0;
5268  vRecv >> fAnnounceUsingCMPCTBLOCK >> nCMPCTBLOCKVersion;
5269  if (nCMPCTBLOCKVersion == 1 || ((pfrom->GetLocalServices() & NODE_WITNESS) && nCMPCTBLOCKVersion == 2)) {
5270  LOCK(cs_main);
5271  // fProvidesHeaderAndIDs is used to "lock in" version of compact blocks we send (fWantsCmpctWitness)
5272  if (!State(pfrom->GetId())->fProvidesHeaderAndIDs) {
5273  State(pfrom->GetId())->fProvidesHeaderAndIDs = true;
5274  State(pfrom->GetId())->fWantsCmpctWitness = nCMPCTBLOCKVersion == 2;
5275  }
5276  if (State(pfrom->GetId())->fWantsCmpctWitness == (nCMPCTBLOCKVersion == 2)) // ignore later version announces
5277  State(pfrom->GetId())->fPreferHeaderAndIDs = fAnnounceUsingCMPCTBLOCK;
5278  if (!State(pfrom->GetId())->fSupportsDesiredCmpctVersion) {
5279  if (pfrom->GetLocalServices() & NODE_WITNESS)
5280  State(pfrom->GetId())->fSupportsDesiredCmpctVersion = (nCMPCTBLOCKVersion == 2);
5281  else
5282  State(pfrom->GetId())->fSupportsDesiredCmpctVersion = (nCMPCTBLOCKVersion == 1);
5283  }
5284  }
5285  }
5286 
5287 
5288  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::INV)
5289  {
5290  vector<CInv> vInv;
5291  vRecv >> vInv;
5292  if (vInv.size() > MAX_INV_SZ)
5293  {
5294  LOCK(cs_main);
5295  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
5296  return error("message inv size() = %u", vInv.size());
5297  }
5298 
5299  bool fBlocksOnly = !fRelayTxes;
5300 
5301  // Allow whitelisted peers to send data other than blocks in blocks only mode if whitelistrelay is true
5302  if (pfrom->fWhitelisted && GetBoolArg("-whitelistrelay", DEFAULT_WHITELISTRELAY))
5303  fBlocksOnly = false;
5304 
5305  LOCK(cs_main);
5306 
5307  uint32_t nFetchFlags = GetFetchFlags(pfrom, chainActive.Tip(), chainparams.GetConsensus());
5308 
5309  std::vector<CInv> vToFetch;
5310 
5311  for (unsigned int nInv = 0; nInv < vInv.size(); nInv++)
5312  {
5313  CInv &inv = vInv[nInv];
5314 
5315  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
5316 
5317  bool fAlreadyHave = AlreadyHave(inv);
5318  LogPrint("net", "got inv: %s %s peer=%d\n", inv.ToString(), fAlreadyHave ? "have" : "new", pfrom->id);
5319 
5320  if (inv.type == MSG_TX) {
5321  inv.type |= nFetchFlags;
5322  }
5323 
5324  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK) {
5325  UpdateBlockAvailability(pfrom->GetId(), inv.hash);
5326  if (!fAlreadyHave && !fImporting && !fReindex && !mapBlocksInFlight.count(inv.hash)) {
5327  // First request the headers preceding the announced block. In the normal fully-synced
5328  // case where a new block is announced that succeeds the current tip (no reorganization),
5329  // there are no such headers.
5330  // Secondly, and only when we are close to being synced, we request the announced block directly,
5331  // to avoid an extra round-trip. Note that we must *first* ask for the headers, so by the
5332  // time the block arrives, the header chain leading up to it is already validated. Not
5333  // doing this will result in the received block being rejected as an orphan in case it is
5334  // not a direct successor.
5335  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETHEADERS, chainActive.GetLocator(pindexBestHeader), inv.hash);
5336  CNodeState *nodestate = State(pfrom->GetId());
5337  if (CanDirectFetch(chainparams.GetConsensus()) &&
5338  nodestate->nBlocksInFlight < MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER &&
5339  (!IsWitnessEnabled(chainActive.Tip(), chainparams.GetConsensus()) || State(pfrom->GetId())->fHaveWitness)) {
5340  inv.type |= nFetchFlags;
5341  if (nodestate->fSupportsDesiredCmpctVersion)
5342  vToFetch.push_back(CInv(MSG_CMPCT_BLOCK, inv.hash));
5343  else
5344  vToFetch.push_back(inv);
5345  // Mark block as in flight already, even though the actual "getdata" message only goes out
5346  // later (within the same cs_main lock, though).
5347  MarkBlockAsInFlight(pfrom->GetId(), inv.hash, chainparams.GetConsensus());
5348  }
5349  LogPrint("net", "getheaders (%d) %s to peer=%d\n", pindexBestHeader->nHeight, inv.hash.ToString(), pfrom->id);
5350  }
5351  }
5352  else
5353  {
5354  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
5355  if (fBlocksOnly)
5356  LogPrint("net", "transaction (%s) inv sent in violation of protocol peer=%d\n", inv.hash.ToString(), pfrom->id);
5357  else if (!fAlreadyHave && !fImporting && !fReindex && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
5358  pfrom->AskFor(inv);
5359  }
5360 
5361  // Track requests for our stuff
5362  GetMainSignals().Inventory(inv.hash);
5363 
5364  if (pfrom->nSendSize > (nMaxSendBufferSize * 2)) {
5365  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 50);
5366  return error("send buffer size() = %u", pfrom->nSendSize);
5367  }
5368  }
5369 
5370  if (!vToFetch.empty())
5371  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vToFetch);
5372  }
5373 
5374 
5375  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::GETDATA)
5376  {
5377  vector<CInv> vInv;
5378  vRecv >> vInv;
5379  if (vInv.size() > MAX_INV_SZ)
5380  {
5381  LOCK(cs_main);
5382  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
5383  return error("message getdata size() = %u", vInv.size());
5384  }
5385 
5386  if (fDebug || (vInv.size() != 1))
5387  LogPrint("net", "received getdata (%u invsz) peer=%d\n", vInv.size(), pfrom->id);
5388 
5389  if ((fDebug && vInv.size() > 0) || (vInv.size() == 1))
5390  LogPrint("net", "received getdata for: %s peer=%d\n", vInv[0].ToString(), pfrom->id);
5391 
5392  pfrom->vRecvGetData.insert(pfrom->vRecvGetData.end(), vInv.begin(), vInv.end());
5393  ProcessGetData(pfrom, chainparams.GetConsensus(), connman);
5394  }
5395 
5396 
5397  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::GETBLOCKS)
5398  {
5399  CBlockLocator locator;
5400  uint256 hashStop;
5401  vRecv >> locator >> hashStop;
5402 
5403  LOCK(cs_main);
5404 
5405  // Find the last block the caller has in the main chain
5406  CBlockIndex* pindex = FindForkInGlobalIndex(chainActive, locator);
5407 
5408  // Send the rest of the chain
5409  if (pindex)
5410  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
5411  int nLimit = 500;
5412  LogPrint("net", "getblocks %d to %s limit %d from peer=%d\n", (pindex ? pindex->nHeight : -1), hashStop.IsNull() ? "end" : hashStop.ToString(), nLimit, pfrom->id);
5413  for (; pindex; pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex))
5414  {
5415  if (pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashStop)
5416  {
5417  LogPrint("net", " getblocks stopping at %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
5418  break;
5419  }
5420  // If pruning, don't inv blocks unless we have on disk and are likely to still have
5421  // for some reasonable time window (1 hour) that block relay might require.
5422  const int nPrunedBlocksLikelyToHave = MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP - 3600 / chainparams.GetConsensus().nPowTargetSpacing;
5423  if (fPruneMode && (!(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) || pindex->nHeight <= chainActive.Tip()->nHeight - nPrunedBlocksLikelyToHave))
5424  {
5425  LogPrint("net", " getblocks stopping, pruned or too old block at %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
5426  break;
5427  }
5428  pfrom->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, pindex->GetBlockHash()));
5429  if (--nLimit <= 0)
5430  {
5431  // When this block is requested, we'll send an inv that'll
5432  // trigger the peer to getblocks the next batch of inventory.
5433  LogPrint("net", " getblocks stopping at limit %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
5434  pfrom->hashContinue = pindex->GetBlockHash();
5435  break;
5436  }
5437  }
5438  }
5439 
5440 
5441  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::GETBLOCKTXN)
5442  {
5443  BlockTransactionsRequest req;
5444  vRecv >> req;
5445 
5446  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(req.blockhash);
5447  if (it == mapBlockIndex.end() || !(it->second->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) {
5448  LogPrintf("Peer %d sent us a getblocktxn for a block we don't have", pfrom->id);
5449  return true;
5450  }
5451 
5452  if (it->second->nHeight < chainActive.Height() - MAX_BLOCKTXN_DEPTH) {
5453  LogPrint("net", "Peer %d sent us a getblocktxn for a block > %i deep", pfrom->id, MAX_BLOCKTXN_DEPTH);
5454  return true;
5455  }
5456 
5457  CBlock block;
5458  assert(ReadBlockFromDisk(block, it->second, chainparams.GetConsensus()));
5459 
5460  BlockTransactions resp(req);
5461  for (size_t i = 0; i < req.indexes.size(); i++) {
5462  if (req.indexes[i] >= block.vtx.size()) {
5463  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
5464  LogPrintf("Peer %d sent us a getblocktxn with out-of-bounds tx indices", pfrom->id);
5465  return true;
5466  }
5467  resp.txn[i] = block.vtx[req.indexes[i]];
5468  }
5469  pfrom->PushMessageWithFlag(State(pfrom->GetId())->fWantsCmpctWitness ? 0 : SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::BLOCKTXN, resp);
5470  }
5471 
5472 
5473  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::GETHEADERS)
5474  {
5475  CBlockLocator locator;
5476  uint256 hashStop;
5477  vRecv >> locator >> hashStop;
5478 
5479  LOCK(cs_main);
5480  if (IsInitialBlockDownload() && !pfrom->fWhitelisted) {
5481  LogPrint("net", "Ignoring getheaders from peer=%d because node is in initial block download\n", pfrom->id);
5482  return true;
5483  }
5484 
5485  CNodeState *nodestate = State(pfrom->GetId());
5486  CBlockIndex* pindex = NULL;
5487  if (locator.IsNull())
5488  {
5489  // If locator is null, return the hashStop block
5490  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashStop);
5491  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
5492  return true;
5493  pindex = (*mi).second;
5494  }
5495  else
5496  {
5497  // Find the last block the caller has in the main chain
5498  pindex = FindForkInGlobalIndex(chainActive, locator);
5499  if (pindex)
5500  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
5501  }
5502 
5503  // we must use CBlocks, as CBlockHeaders won't include the 0x00 nTx count at the end
5504  vector<CBlock> vHeaders;
5505  int nLimit = MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS;
5506  LogPrint("net", "getheaders %d to %s from peer=%d\n", (pindex ? pindex->nHeight : -1), hashStop.IsNull() ? "end" : hashStop.ToString(), pfrom->id);
5507  for (; pindex; pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex))
5508  {
5509  vHeaders.push_back(pindex->GetBlockHeader());
5510  if (--nLimit <= 0 || pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashStop)
5511  break;
5512  }
5513  // pindex can be NULL either if we sent chainActive.Tip() OR
5514  // if our peer has chainActive.Tip() (and thus we are sending an empty
5515  // headers message). In both cases it's safe to update
5516  // pindexBestHeaderSent to be our tip.
5517  nodestate->pindexBestHeaderSent = pindex ? pindex : chainActive.Tip();
5518  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::HEADERS, vHeaders);
5519  }
5520 
5521 
5522  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::TX)
5523  {
5524  // Stop processing the transaction early if
5525  // We are in blocks only mode and peer is either not whitelisted or whitelistrelay is off
5526  if (!fRelayTxes && (!pfrom->fWhitelisted || !GetBoolArg("-whitelistrelay", DEFAULT_WHITELISTRELAY)))
5527  {
5528  LogPrint("net", "transaction sent in violation of protocol peer=%d\n", pfrom->id);
5529  return true;
5530  }
5531 
5532  deque<COutPoint> vWorkQueue;
5533  vector<uint256> vEraseQueue;
5534  CTransaction tx;
5535  vRecv >> tx;
5536 
5537  CInv inv(MSG_TX, tx.GetHash());
5538  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
5539 
5540  LOCK(cs_main);
5541 
5542  bool fMissingInputs = false;
5543  CValidationState state;
5544 
5545  pfrom->setAskFor.erase(inv.hash);
5546  mapAlreadyAskedFor.erase(inv.hash);
5547 
5548  if (!AlreadyHave(inv) && AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, state, tx, true, &fMissingInputs)) {
5549  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
5550  RelayTransaction(tx, connman);
5551  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vout.size(); i++) {
5552  vWorkQueue.emplace_back(inv.hash, i);
5553  }
5554 
5555  pfrom->nLastTXTime = GetTime();
5556 
5557  LogPrint("mempool", "AcceptToMemoryPool: peer=%d: accepted %s (poolsz %u txn, %u kB)\n",
5558  pfrom->id,
5559  tx.GetHash().ToString(),
5560  mempool.size(), mempool.DynamicMemoryUsage() / 1000);
5561 
5562  // Recursively process any orphan transactions that depended on this one
5563  set<NodeId> setMisbehaving;
5564  while (!vWorkQueue.empty()) {
5565  auto itByPrev = mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.find(vWorkQueue.front());
5566  vWorkQueue.pop_front();
5567  if (itByPrev == mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.end())
5568  continue;
5569  for (auto mi = itByPrev->second.begin();
5570  mi != itByPrev->second.end();
5571  ++mi)
5572  {
5573  const CTransaction& orphanTx = (*mi)->second.tx;
5574  const uint256& orphanHash = orphanTx.GetHash();
5575  NodeId fromPeer = (*mi)->second.fromPeer;
5576  bool fMissingInputs2 = false;
5577  // Use a dummy CValidationState so someone can't setup nodes to counter-DoS based on orphan
5578  // resolution (that is, feeding people an invalid transaction based on LegitTxX in order to get
5579  // anyone relaying LegitTxX banned)
5580  CValidationState stateDummy;
5581 
5582 
5583  if (setMisbehaving.count(fromPeer))
5584  continue;
5585  if (AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, stateDummy, orphanTx, true, &fMissingInputs2)) {
5586  LogPrint("mempool", " accepted orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
5587  RelayTransaction(orphanTx, connman);
5588  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < orphanTx.vout.size(); i++) {
5589  vWorkQueue.emplace_back(orphanHash, i);
5590  }
5591  vEraseQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
5592  }
5593  else if (!fMissingInputs2)
5594  {
5595  int nDos = 0;
5596  if (stateDummy.IsInvalid(nDos) && nDos > 0)
5597  {
5598  // Punish peer that gave us an invalid orphan tx
5599  Misbehaving(fromPeer, nDos);
5600  setMisbehaving.insert(fromPeer);
5601  LogPrint("mempool", " invalid orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
5602  }
5603  // Has inputs but not accepted to mempool
5604  // Probably non-standard or insufficient fee/priority
5605  LogPrint("mempool", " removed orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
5606  vEraseQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
5607  if (orphanTx.wit.IsNull() && !stateDummy.CorruptionPossible()) {
5608  // Do not use rejection cache for witness transactions or
5609  // witness-stripped transactions, as they can have been malleated.
5610  // See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/8279 for details.
5611  assert(recentRejects);
5612  recentRejects->insert(orphanHash);
5613  }
5614  }
5615  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
5616  }
5617  }
5618 
5619  BOOST_FOREACH(uint256 hash, vEraseQueue)
5620  EraseOrphanTx(hash);
5621  }
5622  else if (fMissingInputs)
5623  {
5624  bool fRejectedParents = false; // It may be the case that the orphans parents have all been rejected
5625  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin) {
5626  if (recentRejects->contains(txin.prevout.hash)) {
5627  fRejectedParents = true;
5628  break;
5629  }
5630  }
5631  if (!fRejectedParents) {
5632  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin) {
5633  CInv _inv(MSG_TX, txin.prevout.hash);
5634  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(_inv);
5635  if (!AlreadyHave(_inv)) pfrom->AskFor(_inv);
5636  }
5637  AddOrphanTx(tx, pfrom->GetId());
5638 
5639  // DoS prevention: do not allow mapOrphanTransactions to grow unbounded
5640  unsigned int nMaxOrphanTx = (unsigned int)std::max((int64_t)0, GetArg("-maxorphantx", DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_TRANSACTIONS));
5641  unsigned int nEvicted = LimitOrphanTxSize(nMaxOrphanTx);
5642  if (nEvicted > 0)
5643  LogPrint("mempool", "mapOrphan overflow, removed %u tx\n", nEvicted);
5644  } else {
5645  LogPrint("mempool", "not keeping orphan with rejected parents %s\n",tx.GetHash().ToString());
5646  }
5647  } else {
5648  if (tx.wit.IsNull() && !state.CorruptionPossible()) {
5649  // Do not use rejection cache for witness transactions or
5650  // witness-stripped transactions, as they can have been malleated.
5651  // See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/8279 for details.
5652  assert(recentRejects);
5653  recentRejects->insert(tx.GetHash());
5654  }
5655 
5656  if (pfrom->fWhitelisted && GetBoolArg("-whitelistforcerelay", DEFAULT_WHITELISTFORCERELAY)) {
5657  // Always relay transactions received from whitelisted peers, even
5658  // if they were already in the mempool or rejected from it due
5659  // to policy, allowing the node to function as a gateway for
5660  // nodes hidden behind it.
5661  //
5662  // Never relay transactions that we would assign a non-zero DoS
5663  // score for, as we expect peers to do the same with us in that
5664  // case.
5665  int nDoS = 0;
5666  if (!state.IsInvalid(nDoS) || nDoS == 0) {
5667  LogPrintf("Force relaying tx %s from whitelisted peer=%d\n", tx.GetHash().ToString(), pfrom->id);
5668  RelayTransaction(tx, connman);
5669  } else {
5670  LogPrintf("Not relaying invalid transaction %s from whitelisted peer=%d (%s)\n", tx.GetHash().ToString(), pfrom->id, FormatStateMessage(state));
5671  }
5672  }
5673  }
5674  int nDoS = 0;
5675  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS))
5676  {
5677  LogPrint("mempoolrej", "%s from peer=%d was not accepted: %s\n", tx.GetHash().ToString(),
5678  pfrom->id,
5679  FormatStateMessage(state));
5680  if (state.GetRejectCode() < REJECT_INTERNAL) // Never send AcceptToMemoryPool's internal codes over P2P
5681  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, (unsigned char)state.GetRejectCode(),
5682  state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), inv.hash);
5683  if (nDoS > 0) {
5684  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
5685  }
5686  }
5687  FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC);
5688  }
5689 
5690 
5691  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::CMPCTBLOCK && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore blocks received while importing
5692  {
5693  CBlockHeaderAndShortTxIDs cmpctblock;
5694  vRecv >> cmpctblock;
5695 
5696  LOCK(cs_main);
5697 
5698  if (mapBlockIndex.find(cmpctblock.header.hashPrevBlock) == mapBlockIndex.end()) {
5699  // Doesn't connect (or is genesis), instead of DoSing in AcceptBlockHeader, request deeper headers
5700  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload())
5701  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETHEADERS, chainActive.GetLocator(pindexBestHeader), uint256());
5702  return true;
5703  }
5704 
5705  CBlockIndex *pindex = NULL;
5706  CValidationState state;
5707  if (!AcceptBlockHeader(cmpctblock.header, state, chainparams, &pindex)) {
5708  int nDoS;
5709  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
5710  if (nDoS > 0)
5711  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
5712  LogPrintf("Peer %d sent us invalid header via cmpctblock\n", pfrom->id);
5713  return true;
5714  }
5715  }
5716 
5717  // If AcceptBlockHeader returned true, it set pindex
5718  assert(pindex);
5719  UpdateBlockAvailability(pfrom->GetId(), pindex->GetBlockHash());
5720 
5721  std::map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<QueuedBlock>::iterator> >::iterator blockInFlightIt = mapBlocksInFlight.find(pindex->GetBlockHash());
5722  bool fAlreadyInFlight = blockInFlightIt != mapBlocksInFlight.end();
5723 
5724  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) // Nothing to do here
5725  return true;
5726 
5727  if (pindex->nChainWork <= chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork || // We know something better
5728  pindex->nTx != 0) { // We had this block at some point, but pruned it
5729  if (fAlreadyInFlight) {
5730  // We requested this block for some reason, but our mempool will probably be useless
5731  // so we just grab the block via normal getdata
5732  std::vector<CInv> vInv(1);
5733  vInv[0] = CInv(MSG_BLOCK | GetFetchFlags(pfrom, pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus()), cmpctblock.header.GetHash());
5734  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vInv);
5735  }
5736  return true;
5737  }
5738 
5739  // If we're not close to tip yet, give up and let parallel block fetch work its magic
5740  if (!fAlreadyInFlight && !CanDirectFetch(chainparams.GetConsensus()))
5741  return true;
5742 
5743  CNodeState *nodestate = State(pfrom->GetId());
5744 
5745  if (IsWitnessEnabled(pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus()) && !nodestate->fSupportsDesiredCmpctVersion) {
5746  // Don't bother trying to process compact blocks from v1 peers
5747  // after segwit activates.
5748  return true;
5749  }
5750 
5751  // We want to be a bit conservative just to be extra careful about DoS
5752  // possibilities in compact block processing...
5753  if (pindex->nHeight <= chainActive.Height() + 2) {
5754  if ((!fAlreadyInFlight && nodestate->nBlocksInFlight < MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER) ||
5755  (fAlreadyInFlight && blockInFlightIt->second.first == pfrom->GetId())) {
5756  list<QueuedBlock>::iterator *queuedBlockIt = NULL;
5757  if (!MarkBlockAsInFlight(pfrom->GetId(), pindex->GetBlockHash(), chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindex, &queuedBlockIt)) {
5758  if (!(*queuedBlockIt)->partialBlock)
5759  (*queuedBlockIt)->partialBlock.reset(new PartiallyDownloadedBlock(&mempool));
5760  else {
5761  // The block was already in flight using compact blocks from the same peer
5762  LogPrint("net", "Peer sent us compact block we were already syncing!\n");
5763  return true;
5764  }
5765  }
5766 
5767  PartiallyDownloadedBlock& partialBlock = *(*queuedBlockIt)->partialBlock;
5768  ReadStatus status = partialBlock.InitData(cmpctblock);
5769  if (status == READ_STATUS_INVALID) {
5770  MarkBlockAsReceived(pindex->GetBlockHash()); // Reset in-flight state in case of whitelist
5771  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
5772  LogPrintf("Peer %d sent us invalid compact block\n", pfrom->id);
5773  return true;
5774  } else if (status == READ_STATUS_FAILED) {
5775  // Duplicate txindexes, the block is now in-flight, so just request it
5776  std::vector<CInv> vInv(1);
5777  vInv[0] = CInv(MSG_BLOCK | GetFetchFlags(pfrom, pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus()), cmpctblock.header.GetHash());
5778  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vInv);
5779  return true;
5780  }
5781 
5782  if (!fAlreadyInFlight && mapBlocksInFlight.size() == 1 && pindex->pprev->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN)) {
5783  // We seem to be rather well-synced, so it appears pfrom was the first to provide us
5784  // with this block! Let's get them to announce using compact blocks in the future.
5785  MaybeSetPeerAsAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs(nodestate, pfrom, connman);
5786  }
5787 
5788  BlockTransactionsRequest req;
5789  for (size_t i = 0; i < cmpctblock.BlockTxCount(); i++) {
5790  if (!partialBlock.IsTxAvailable(i))
5791  req.indexes.push_back(i);
5792  }
5793  if (req.indexes.empty()) {
5794  // Dirty hack to jump to BLOCKTXN code (TODO: move message handling into their own functions)
5795  BlockTransactions txn;
5796  txn.blockhash = cmpctblock.header.GetHash();
5797  CDataStream blockTxnMsg(SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
5798  blockTxnMsg << txn;
5799  return ProcessMessage(pfrom, NetMsgType::BLOCKTXN, blockTxnMsg, nTimeReceived, chainparams, connman);
5800  } else {
5801  req.blockhash = pindex->GetBlockHash();
5802  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETBLOCKTXN, req);
5803  }
5804  }
5805  } else {
5806  if (fAlreadyInFlight) {
5807  // We requested this block, but its far into the future, so our
5808  // mempool will probably be useless - request the block normally
5809  std::vector<CInv> vInv(1);
5810  vInv[0] = CInv(MSG_BLOCK | GetFetchFlags(pfrom, pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus()), cmpctblock.header.GetHash());
5811  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vInv);
5812  return true;
5813  } else {
5814  // If this was an announce-cmpctblock, we want the same treatment as a header message
5815  // Dirty hack to process as if it were just a headers message (TODO: move message handling into their own functions)
5816  std::vector<CBlock> headers;
5817  headers.push_back(cmpctblock.header);
5818  CDataStream vHeadersMsg(SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
5819  vHeadersMsg << headers;
5820  return ProcessMessage(pfrom, NetMsgType::HEADERS, vHeadersMsg, nTimeReceived, chainparams, connman);
5821  }
5822  }
5823 
5824  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
5825  }
5826 
5827  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::BLOCKTXN && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore blocks received while importing
5828  {
5829  BlockTransactions resp;
5830  vRecv >> resp;
5831 
5832  LOCK(cs_main);
5833 
5834  map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<QueuedBlock>::iterator> >::iterator it = mapBlocksInFlight.find(resp.blockhash);
5835  if (it == mapBlocksInFlight.end() || !it->second.second->partialBlock ||
5836  it->second.first != pfrom->GetId()) {
5837  LogPrint("net", "Peer %d sent us block transactions for block we weren't expecting\n", pfrom->id);
5838  return true;
5839  }
5840 
5841  PartiallyDownloadedBlock& partialBlock = *it->second.second->partialBlock;
5842  CBlock block;
5843  ReadStatus status = partialBlock.FillBlock(block, resp.txn);
5844  if (status == READ_STATUS_INVALID) {
5845  MarkBlockAsReceived(resp.blockhash); // Reset in-flight state in case of whitelist
5846  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
5847  LogPrintf("Peer %d sent us invalid compact block/non-matching block transactions\n", pfrom->id);
5848  return true;
5849  } else if (status == READ_STATUS_FAILED) {
5850  // Might have collided, fall back to getdata now :(
5851  std::vector<CInv> invs;
5852  invs.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK | GetFetchFlags(pfrom, chainActive.Tip(), chainparams.GetConsensus()), resp.blockhash));
5853  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, invs);
5854  } else {
5855  CValidationState state;
5856  ProcessNewBlock(state, chainparams, pfrom, &block, false, NULL);
5857  int nDoS;
5858  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
5859  assert (state.GetRejectCode() < REJECT_INTERNAL); // Blocks are never rejected with internal reject codes
5860  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, (unsigned char)state.GetRejectCode(),
5861  state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), block.GetHash());
5862  if (nDoS > 0) {
5863  LOCK(cs_main);
5864  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
5865  }
5866  }
5867  }
5868  }
5869 
5870 
5871  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::HEADERS && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore headers received while importing
5872  {
5873  std::vector<CBlockHeader> headers;
5874 
5875  // Bypass the normal CBlock deserialization, as we don't want to risk deserializing 2000 full blocks.
5876  unsigned int nCount = ReadCompactSize(vRecv);
5877  if (nCount > MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS) {
5878  LOCK(cs_main);
5879  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
5880  return error("headers message size = %u", nCount);
5881  }
5882  headers.resize(nCount);
5883  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < nCount; n++) {
5884  vRecv >> headers[n];
5885  ReadCompactSize(vRecv); // ignore tx count; assume it is 0.
5886  }
5887 
5888  {
5889  LOCK(cs_main);
5890 
5891  if (nCount == 0) {
5892  // Nothing interesting. Stop asking this peers for more headers.
5893  return true;
5894  }
5895 
5896  CNodeState *nodestate = State(pfrom->GetId());
5897 
5898  // If this looks like it could be a block announcement (nCount <
5899  // MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE), use special logic for handling headers that
5900  // don't connect:
5901  // - Send a getheaders message in response to try to connect the chain.
5902  // - The peer can send up to MAX_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS in a row that
5903  // don't connect before giving DoS points
5904  // - Once a headers message is received that is valid and does connect,
5905  // nUnconnectingHeaders gets reset back to 0.
5906  if (mapBlockIndex.find(headers[0].hashPrevBlock) == mapBlockIndex.end() && nCount < MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE) {
5907  nodestate->nUnconnectingHeaders++;
5908  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETHEADERS, chainActive.GetLocator(pindexBestHeader), uint256());
5909  LogPrint("net", "received header %s: missing prev block %s, sending getheaders (%d) to end (peer=%d, nUnconnectingHeaders=%d)\n",
5910  headers[0].GetHash().ToString(),
5911  headers[0].hashPrevBlock.ToString(),
5912  pindexBestHeader->nHeight,
5913  pfrom->id, nodestate->nUnconnectingHeaders);
5914  // Set hashLastUnknownBlock for this peer, so that if we
5915  // eventually get the headers - even from a different peer -
5916  // we can use this peer to download.
5917  UpdateBlockAvailability(pfrom->GetId(), headers.back().GetHash());
5918 
5919  if (nodestate->nUnconnectingHeaders % MAX_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS == 0) {
5920  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
5921  }
5922  return true;
5923  }
5924 
5925  CBlockIndex *pindexLast = NULL;
5926  BOOST_FOREACH(const CBlockHeader& header, headers) {
5927  CValidationState state;
5928  if (pindexLast != NULL && header.hashPrevBlock != pindexLast->GetBlockHash()) {
5929  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
5930  return error("non-continuous headers sequence");
5931  }
5932  if (!AcceptBlockHeader(header, state, chainparams, &pindexLast)) {
5933  int nDoS;
5934  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
5935  if (nDoS > 0)
5936  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
5937  return error("invalid header received");
5938  }
5939  }
5940  }
5941 
5942  if (nodestate->nUnconnectingHeaders > 0) {
5943  LogPrint("net", "peer=%d: resetting nUnconnectingHeaders (%d -> 0)\n", pfrom->id, nodestate->nUnconnectingHeaders);
5944  }
5945  nodestate->nUnconnectingHeaders = 0;
5946 
5947  assert(pindexLast);
5948  UpdateBlockAvailability(pfrom->GetId(), pindexLast->GetBlockHash());
5949 
5950  if (nCount == MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS) {
5951  // Headers message had its maximum size; the peer may have more headers.
5952  // TODO: optimize: if pindexLast is an ancestor of chainActive.Tip or pindexBestHeader, continue
5953  // from there instead.
5954  LogPrint("net", "more getheaders (%d) to end to peer=%d (startheight:%d)\n", pindexLast->nHeight, pfrom->id, pfrom->nStartingHeight);
5955  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETHEADERS, chainActive.GetLocator(pindexLast), uint256());
5956  }
5957 
5958  bool fCanDirectFetch = CanDirectFetch(chainparams.GetConsensus());
5959  // If this set of headers is valid and ends in a block with at least as
5960  // much work as our tip, download as much as possible.
5961  if (fCanDirectFetch && pindexLast->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE) && chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork <= pindexLast->nChainWork) {
5962  vector<CBlockIndex *> vToFetch;
5963  CBlockIndex *pindexWalk = pindexLast;
5964  // Calculate all the blocks we'd need to switch to pindexLast, up to a limit.
5965  while (pindexWalk && !chainActive.Contains(pindexWalk) && vToFetch.size() <= MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER) {
5966  if (!(pindexWalk->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) &&
5967  !mapBlocksInFlight.count(pindexWalk->GetBlockHash()) &&
5968  (!IsWitnessEnabled(pindexWalk->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus()) || State(pfrom->GetId())->fHaveWitness)) {
5969  // We don't have this block, and it's not yet in flight.
5970  vToFetch.push_back(pindexWalk);
5971  }
5972  pindexWalk = pindexWalk->pprev;
5973  }
5974  // If pindexWalk still isn't on our main chain, we're looking at a
5975  // very large reorg at a time we think we're close to caught up to
5976  // the main chain -- this shouldn't really happen. Bail out on the
5977  // direct fetch and rely on parallel download instead.
5978  if (!chainActive.Contains(pindexWalk)) {
