5979  LogPrint("net", "Large reorg, won't direct fetch to %s (%d)\n",
5980  pindexLast->GetBlockHash().ToString(),
5981  pindexLast->nHeight);
5982  } else {
5983  vector<CInv> vGetData;
5984  // Download as much as possible, from earliest to latest.
5985  BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH(CBlockIndex *pindex, vToFetch) {
5986  if (nodestate->nBlocksInFlight >= MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER) {
5987  // Can't download any more from this peer
5988  break;
5989  }
5990  uint32_t nFetchFlags = GetFetchFlags(pfrom, pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus());
5991  vGetData.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK | nFetchFlags, pindex->GetBlockHash()));
5992  MarkBlockAsInFlight(pfrom->GetId(), pindex->GetBlockHash(), chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindex);
5993  LogPrint("net", "Requesting block %s from peer=%d\n",
5994  pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pfrom->id);
5995  }
5996  if (vGetData.size() > 1) {
5997  LogPrint("net", "Downloading blocks toward %s (%d) via headers direct fetch\n",
5998  pindexLast->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexLast->nHeight);
5999  }
6000  if (vGetData.size() > 0) {
6001  if (nodestate->fSupportsDesiredCmpctVersion && vGetData.size() == 1 && mapBlocksInFlight.size() == 1 && pindexLast->pprev->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN)) {
6002  // We seem to be rather well-synced, so it appears pfrom was the first to provide us
6003  // with this block! Let's get them to announce using compact blocks in the future.
6004  MaybeSetPeerAsAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs(nodestate, pfrom, connman);
6005  // In any case, we want to download using a compact block, not a regular one
6006  vGetData[0] = CInv(MSG_CMPCT_BLOCK, vGetData[0].hash);
6007  }
6008  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vGetData);
6009  }
6010  }
6011  }
6012 
6013  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
6014  }
6015 
6016  NotifyHeaderTip();
6017  }
6018 
6019  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::BLOCK && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore blocks received while importing
6020  {
6021  CBlock block;
6022  vRecv >> block;
6023 
6024  LogPrint("net", "received block %s peer=%d\n", block.GetHash().ToString(), pfrom->id);
6025 
6026  CValidationState state;
6027  // Process all blocks from whitelisted peers, even if not requested,
6028  // unless we're still syncing with the network.
6029  // Such an unrequested block may still be processed, subject to the
6030  // conditions in AcceptBlock().
6031  bool forceProcessing = pfrom->fWhitelisted && !IsInitialBlockDownload();
6032  ProcessNewBlock(state, chainparams, pfrom, &block, forceProcessing, NULL);
6033  int nDoS;
6034  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
6035  assert (state.GetRejectCode() < REJECT_INTERNAL); // Blocks are never rejected with internal reject codes
6036  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, (unsigned char)state.GetRejectCode(),
6037  state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), block.GetHash());
6038  if (nDoS > 0) {
6039  LOCK(cs_main);
6040  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
6041  }
6042  }
6043 
6044  }
6045 
6046 
6047  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::GETADDR)
6048  {
6049  // This asymmetric behavior for inbound and outbound connections was introduced
6050  // to prevent a fingerprinting attack: an attacker can send specific fake addresses
6051  // to users' AddrMan and later request them by sending getaddr messages.
6052  // Making nodes which are behind NAT and can only make outgoing connections ignore
6053  // the getaddr message mitigates the attack.
6054  if (!pfrom->fInbound) {
6055  LogPrint("net", "Ignoring \"getaddr\" from outbound connection. peer=%d\n", pfrom->id);
6056  return true;
6057  }
6058 
6059  // Only send one GetAddr response per connection to reduce resource waste
6060  // and discourage addr stamping of INV announcements.
6061  if (pfrom->fSentAddr) {
6062  LogPrint("net", "Ignoring repeated \"getaddr\". peer=%d\n", pfrom->id);
6063  return true;
6064  }
6065  pfrom->fSentAddr = true;
6066 
6067  pfrom->vAddrToSend.clear();
6068  vector<CAddress> vAddr = connman.GetAddresses();
6069  FastRandomContext insecure_rand;
6070  BOOST_FOREACH(const CAddress &addr, vAddr)
6071  pfrom->PushAddress(addr, insecure_rand);
6072  }
6073 
6074 
6075  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::MEMPOOL)
6076  {
6077  if (!(pfrom->GetLocalServices() & NODE_BLOOM) && !pfrom->fWhitelisted)
6078  {
6079  LogPrint("net", "mempool request with bloom filters disabled, disconnect peer=%d\n", pfrom->GetId());
6080  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
6081  return true;
6082  }
6083 
6084  if (connman.OutboundTargetReached(false) && !pfrom->fWhitelisted)
6085  {
6086  LogPrint("net", "mempool request with bandwidth limit reached, disconnect peer=%d\n", pfrom->GetId());
6087  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
6088  return true;
6089  }
6090 
6091  LOCK(pfrom->cs_inventory);
6092  pfrom->fSendMempool = true;
6093  }
6094 
6095 
6096  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::PING)
6097  {
6098  if (pfrom->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION)
6099  {
6100  uint64_t nonce = 0;
6101  vRecv >> nonce;
6102  // Echo the message back with the nonce. This allows for two useful features:
6103  //
6104  // 1) A remote node can quickly check if the connection is operational
6105  // 2) Remote nodes can measure the latency of the network thread. If this node
6106  // is overloaded it won't respond to pings quickly and the remote node can
6107  // avoid sending us more work, like chain download requests.
6108  //
6109  // The nonce stops the remote getting confused between different pings: without
6110  // it, if the remote node sends a ping once per second and this node takes 5
6111  // seconds to respond to each, the 5th ping the remote sends would appear to
6112  // return very quickly.
6113  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::PONG, nonce);
6114  }
6115  }
6116 
6117 
6118  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::PONG)
6119  {
6120  int64_t pingUsecEnd = nTimeReceived;
6121  uint64_t nonce = 0;
6122  size_t nAvail = vRecv.in_avail();
6123  bool bPingFinished = false;
6124  std::string sProblem;
6125 
6126  if (nAvail >= sizeof(nonce)) {
6127  vRecv >> nonce;
6128 
6129  // Only process pong message if there is an outstanding ping (old ping without nonce should never pong)
6130  if (pfrom->nPingNonceSent != 0) {
6131  if (nonce == pfrom->nPingNonceSent) {
6132  // Matching pong received, this ping is no longer outstanding
6133  bPingFinished = true;
6134  int64_t pingUsecTime = pingUsecEnd - pfrom->nPingUsecStart;
6135  if (pingUsecTime > 0) {
6136  // Successful ping time measurement, replace previous
6137  pfrom->nPingUsecTime = pingUsecTime;
6138  pfrom->nMinPingUsecTime = std::min(pfrom->nMinPingUsecTime, pingUsecTime);
6139  } else {
6140  // This should never happen
6141  sProblem = "Timing mishap";
6142  }
6143  } else {
6144  // Nonce mismatches are normal when pings are overlapping
6145  sProblem = "Nonce mismatch";
6146  if (nonce == 0) {
6147  // This is most likely a bug in another implementation somewhere; cancel this ping
6148  bPingFinished = true;
6149  sProblem = "Nonce zero";
6150  }
6151  }
6152  } else {
6153  sProblem = "Unsolicited pong without ping";
6154  }
6155  } else {
6156  // This is most likely a bug in another implementation somewhere; cancel this ping
6157  bPingFinished = true;
6158  sProblem = "Short payload";
6159  }
6160 
6161  if (!(sProblem.empty())) {
6162  LogPrint("net", "pong peer=%d: %s, %x expected, %x received, %u bytes\n",
6163  pfrom->id,
6164  sProblem,
6165  pfrom->nPingNonceSent,
6166  nonce,
6167  nAvail);
6168  }
6169  if (bPingFinished) {
6170  pfrom->nPingNonceSent = 0;
6171  }
6172  }
6173 
6174 
6175  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::FILTERLOAD)
6176  {
6177  CBloomFilter filter;
6178  vRecv >> filter;
6179 
6180  if (!filter.IsWithinSizeConstraints())
6181  {
6182  // There is no excuse for sending a too-large filter
6183  LOCK(cs_main);
6184  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
6185  }
6186  else
6187  {
6188  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
6189  delete pfrom->pfilter;
6190  pfrom->pfilter = new CBloomFilter(filter);
6191  pfrom->pfilter->UpdateEmptyFull();
6192  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
6193  }
6194  }
6195 
6196 
6197  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::FILTERADD)
6198  {
6199  vector<unsigned char> vData;
6200  vRecv >> vData;
6201 
6202  // Nodes must NEVER send a data item > 520 bytes (the max size for a script data object,
6203  // and thus, the maximum size any matched object can have) in a filteradd message
6204  bool bad = false;
6205  if (vData.size() > MAX_SCRIPT_ELEMENT_SIZE) {
6206  bad = true;
6207  } else {
6208  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
6209  if (pfrom->pfilter) {
6210  pfrom->pfilter->insert(vData);
6211  } else {
6212  bad = true;
6213  }
6214  }
6215  if (bad) {
6216  LOCK(cs_main);
6217  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
6218  }
6219  }
6220 
6221 
6222  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::FILTERCLEAR)
6223  {
6224  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
6225  delete pfrom->pfilter;
6226  pfrom->pfilter = new CBloomFilter();
6227  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
6228  }
6229 
6230 
6231  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::REJECT)
6232  {
6233  if (fDebug) {
6234  try {
6235  string strMsg; unsigned char ccode; string strReason;
6236  vRecv >> LIMITED_STRING(strMsg, CMessageHeader::COMMAND_SIZE) >> ccode >> LIMITED_STRING(strReason, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH);
6237 
6238  ostringstream ss;
6239  ss << strMsg << " code " << itostr(ccode) << ": " << strReason;
6240 
6241  if (strMsg == NetMsgType::BLOCK || strMsg == NetMsgType::TX)
6242  {
6243  uint256 hash;
6244  vRecv >> hash;
6245  ss << ": hash " << hash.ToString();
6246  }
6247  LogPrint("net", "Reject %s\n", SanitizeString(ss.str()));
6248  } catch (const std::ios_base::failure&) {
6249  // Avoid feedback loops by preventing reject messages from triggering a new reject message.
6250  LogPrint("net", "Unparseable reject message received\n");
6251  }
6252  }
6253  }
6254 
6255  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::FEEFILTER) {
6256  CAmount newFeeFilter = 0;
6257  vRecv >> newFeeFilter;
6258  if (MoneyRange(newFeeFilter)) {
6259  {
6260  LOCK(pfrom->cs_feeFilter);
6261  pfrom->minFeeFilter = newFeeFilter;
6262  }
6263  LogPrint("net", "received: feefilter of %s from peer=%d\n", CFeeRate(newFeeFilter).ToString(), pfrom->id);
6264  }
6265  }
6266 
6267  else if (strCommand == NetMsgType::NOTFOUND) {
6268  // We do not care about the NOTFOUND message, but logging an Unknown Command
6269  // message would be undesirable as we transmit it ourselves.
6270  }
6271 
6272  else {
6273  // Ignore unknown commands for extensibility
6274  LogPrint("net", "Unknown command \"%s\" from peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(strCommand), pfrom->id);
6275  }
6276 
6277 
6278 
6279  return true;
6280 }
6281 
6282 // requires LOCK(cs_vRecvMsg)
6283 bool ProcessMessages(CNode* pfrom, CConnman& connman)
6284 {
6285  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
6286  unsigned int nMaxSendBufferSize = connman.GetSendBufferSize();
6287  //if (fDebug)
6288  // LogPrintf("%s(%u messages)\n", __func__, pfrom->vRecvMsg.size());
6289 
6290  //
6291  // Message format
6292  // (4) message start
6293  // (12) command
6294  // (4) size
6295  // (4) checksum
6296  // (x) data
6297  //
6298  bool fOk = true;
6299 
6300  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty())
6301  ProcessGetData(pfrom, chainparams.GetConsensus(), connman);
6302 
6303  // this maintains the order of responses
6304  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty()) return fOk;
6305 
6306  std::deque<CNetMessage>::iterator it = pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin();
6307  while (!pfrom->fDisconnect && it != pfrom->vRecvMsg.end()) {
6308  // Don't bother if send buffer is too full to respond anyway
6309  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= nMaxSendBufferSize)
6310  break;
6311 
6312  // get next message
6313  CNetMessage& msg = *it;
6314 
6315  //if (fDebug)
6316  // LogPrintf("%s(message %u msgsz, %u bytes, complete:%s)\n", __func__,
6317  // msg.hdr.nMessageSize, msg.vRecv.size(),
6318  // msg.complete() ? "Y" : "N");
6319 
6320  // end, if an incomplete message is found
6321  if (!msg.complete())
6322  break;
6323 
6324  // at this point, any failure means we can delete the current message
6325  it++;
6326 
6327  // Scan for message start
6328  if (memcmp(msg.hdr.pchMessageStart, chainparams.MessageStart(), CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE) != 0) {
6329  LogPrintf("PROCESSMESSAGE: INVALID MESSAGESTART %s peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(msg.hdr.GetCommand()), pfrom->id);
6330  fOk = false;
6331  break;
6332  }
6333 
6334  // Read header
6335  CMessageHeader& hdr = msg.hdr;
6336  if (!hdr.IsValid(chainparams.MessageStart()))
6337  {
6338  LogPrintf("PROCESSMESSAGE: ERRORS IN HEADER %s peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(hdr.GetCommand()), pfrom->id);
6339  continue;
6340  }
6341  string strCommand = hdr.GetCommand();
6342 
6343  // Message size
6344  unsigned int nMessageSize = hdr.nMessageSize;
6345 
6346  // Checksum
6347  CDataStream& vRecv = msg.vRecv;
6348  uint256 hash = Hash(vRecv.begin(), vRecv.begin() + nMessageSize);
6349  if (memcmp(hash.begin(), hdr.pchChecksum, CMessageHeader::CHECKSUM_SIZE) != 0)
6350  {
6351  LogPrintf("%s(%s, %u bytes): CHECKSUM ERROR expected %s was %s\n", __func__,
6352  SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize,
6353  HexStr(hash.begin(), hash.begin()+CMessageHeader::CHECKSUM_SIZE),
6354  HexStr(hdr.pchChecksum, hdr.pchChecksum+CMessageHeader::CHECKSUM_SIZE));
6355  continue;
6356  }
6357 
6358  // Process message
6359  bool fRet = false;
6360  try
6361  {
6362  fRet = ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv, msg.nTime, chainparams, connman);
6363  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
6364  }
6365  catch (const std::ios_base::failure& e)
6366  {
6367  pfrom->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, strCommand, REJECT_MALFORMED, string("error parsing message"));
6368  if (strstr(e.what(), "end of data"))
6369  {
6370  // Allow exceptions from under-length message on vRecv
6371  LogPrintf("%s(%s, %u bytes): Exception '%s' caught, normally caused by a message being shorter than its stated length\n", __func__, SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, e.what());
6372  }
6373  else if (strstr(e.what(), "size too large"))
6374  {
6375  // Allow exceptions from over-long size
6376  LogPrintf("%s(%s, %u bytes): Exception '%s' caught\n", __func__, SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, e.what());
6377  }
6378  else if (strstr(e.what(), "non-canonical ReadCompactSize()"))
6379  {
6380  // Allow exceptions from non-canonical encoding
6381  LogPrintf("%s(%s, %u bytes): Exception '%s' caught\n", __func__, SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, e.what());
6382  }
6383  else
6384  {
6385  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
6386  }
6387  }
6388  catch (const boost::thread_interrupted&) {
6389  throw;
6390  }
6391  catch (const std::exception& e) {
6392  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
6393  } catch (...) {
6394  PrintExceptionContinue(NULL, "ProcessMessages()");
6395  }
6396 
6397  if (!fRet)
6398  LogPrintf("%s(%s, %u bytes) FAILED peer=%d\n", __func__, SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, pfrom->id);
6399 
6400  break;
6401  }
6402 
6403  // In case the connection got shut down, its receive buffer was wiped
6404  if (!pfrom->fDisconnect)
6405  pfrom->vRecvMsg.erase(pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin(), it);
6406 
6407  return fOk;
6408 }
6409 
6410 class CompareInvMempoolOrder
6411 {
6412  CTxMemPool *mp;
6413 public:
6414  CompareInvMempoolOrder(CTxMemPool *_mempool)
6415  {
6416  mp = _mempool;
6417  }
6418 
6419  bool operator()(std::set<uint256>::iterator a, std::set<uint256>::iterator b)
6420  {
6421  /* As std::make_heap produces a max-heap, we want the entries with the
6422  * fewest ancestors/highest fee to sort later. */
6423  return mp->CompareDepthAndScore(*b, *a);
6424  }
6425 };
6426 
6427 bool SendMessages(CNode* pto, CConnman& connman)
6428 {
6429  const Consensus::Params& consensusParams = Params().GetConsensus();
6430  {
6431  // Don't send anything until we get its version message
6432  if (pto->nVersion == 0)
6433  return true;
6434 
6435  //
6436  // Message: ping
6437  //
6438  bool pingSend = false;
6439  if (pto->fPingQueued) {
6440  // RPC ping request by user
6441  pingSend = true;
6442  }
6443  if (pto->nPingNonceSent == 0 && pto->nPingUsecStart + PING_INTERVAL * 1000000 < GetTimeMicros()) {
6444  // Ping automatically sent as a latency probe & keepalive.
6445  pingSend = true;
6446  }
6447  if (pingSend && !pto->fDisconnect) {
6448  uint64_t nonce = 0;
6449  while (nonce == 0) {
6450  GetRandBytes((unsigned char*)&nonce, sizeof(nonce));
6451  }
6452  pto->fPingQueued = false;
6453  pto->nPingUsecStart = GetTimeMicros();
6454  if (pto->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION) {
6455  pto->nPingNonceSent = nonce;
6456  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::PING, nonce);
6457  } else {
6458  // Peer is too old to support ping command with nonce, pong will never arrive.
6459  pto->nPingNonceSent = 0;
6460  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::PING);
6461  }
6462  }
6463 
6464  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain); // Acquire cs_main for IsInitialBlockDownload() and CNodeState()
6465  if (!lockMain)
6466  return true;
6467 
6468  // Address refresh broadcast
6469  int64_t nNow = GetTimeMicros();
6470  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload() && pto->nNextLocalAddrSend < nNow) {
6471  AdvertiseLocal(pto);
6472  pto->nNextLocalAddrSend = PoissonNextSend(nNow, AVG_LOCAL_ADDRESS_BROADCAST_INTERVAL);
6473  }
6474 
6475  //
6476  // Message: addr
6477  //
6478  if (pto->nNextAddrSend < nNow) {
6479  pto->nNextAddrSend = PoissonNextSend(nNow, AVG_ADDRESS_BROADCAST_INTERVAL);
6480  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
6481  vAddr.reserve(pto->vAddrToSend.size());
6482  BOOST_FOREACH(const CAddress& addr, pto->vAddrToSend)
6483  {
6484  if (!pto->addrKnown.contains(addr.GetKey()))
6485  {
6486  pto->addrKnown.insert(addr.GetKey());
6487  vAddr.push_back(addr);
6488  // receiver rejects addr messages larger than 1000
6489  if (vAddr.size() >= 1000)
6490  {
6491  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::ADDR, vAddr);
6492  vAddr.clear();
6493  }
6494  }
6495  }
6496  pto->vAddrToSend.clear();
6497  if (!vAddr.empty())
6498  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::ADDR, vAddr);
6499  // we only send the big addr message once
6500  if (pto->vAddrToSend.capacity() > 40)
6501  pto->vAddrToSend.shrink_to_fit();
6502  }
6503 
6504  CNodeState &state = *State(pto->GetId());
6505  if (state.fShouldBan) {
6506  if (pto->fWhitelisted)
6507  LogPrintf("Warning: not punishing whitelisted peer %s!\n", pto->addr.ToString());
6508  else {
6509  pto->fDisconnect = true;
6510  if (pto->addr.IsLocal())
6511  LogPrintf("Warning: not banning local peer %s!\n", pto->addr.ToString());
6512  else
6513  {
6514  connman.Ban(pto->addr, BanReasonNodeMisbehaving);
6515  }
6516  }
6517  state.fShouldBan = false;
6518  }
6519 
6520  BOOST_FOREACH(const CBlockReject& reject, state.rejects)
6521  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::REJECT, (string)NetMsgType::BLOCK, reject.chRejectCode, reject.strRejectReason, reject.hashBlock);
6522  state.rejects.clear();
6523 
6524  // Start block sync
6525  if (pindexBestHeader == NULL)
6526  pindexBestHeader = chainActive.Tip();
6527  bool fFetch = state.fPreferredDownload || (nPreferredDownload == 0 && !pto->fClient && !pto->fOneShot); // Download if this is a nice peer, or we have no nice peers and this one might do.
6528  if (!state.fSyncStarted && !pto->fClient && !pto->fDisconnect && !fImporting && !fReindex) {
6529  // Only actively request headers from a single peer, unless we're close to today.
6530  if ((nSyncStarted == 0 && fFetch) || pindexBestHeader->GetBlockTime() > GetAdjustedTime() - 24 * 60 * 60) {
6531  state.fSyncStarted = true;
6532  nSyncStarted++;
6533  const CBlockIndex *pindexStart = pindexBestHeader;
6534  /* If possible, start at the block preceding the currently
6535  best known header. This ensures that we always get a
6536  non-empty list of headers back as long as the peer
6537  is up-to-date. With a non-empty response, we can initialise
6538  the peer's known best block. This wouldn't be possible
6539  if we requested starting at pindexBestHeader and
6540  got back an empty response. */
6541  if (pindexStart->pprev)
6542  pindexStart = pindexStart->pprev;
6543  LogPrint("net", "initial getheaders (%d) to peer=%d (startheight:%d)\n", pindexStart->nHeight, pto->id, pto->nStartingHeight);
6544  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETHEADERS, chainActive.GetLocator(pindexStart), uint256());
6545  }
6546  }
6547 
6548  // Resend wallet transactions that haven't gotten in a block yet
6549  // Except during reindex, importing and IBD, when old wallet
6550  // transactions become unconfirmed and spams other nodes.
6551  if (!fReindex && !fImporting && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
6552  {
6553  GetMainSignals().Broadcast(nTimeBestReceived, &connman);
6554  }
6555 
6556  //
6557  // Try sending block announcements via headers
6558  //
6559  {
6560  // If we have less than MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE in our
6561  // list of block hashes we're relaying, and our peer wants
6562  // headers announcements, then find the first header
6563  // not yet known to our peer but would connect, and send.
6564  // If no header would connect, or if we have too many
6565  // blocks, or if the peer doesn't want headers, just
6566  // add all to the inv queue.
6567  LOCK(pto->cs_inventory);
6568  vector<CBlock> vHeaders;
6569  bool fRevertToInv = ((!state.fPreferHeaders &&
6570  (!state.fPreferHeaderAndIDs || pto->vBlockHashesToAnnounce.size() > 1)) ||
6571  pto->vBlockHashesToAnnounce.size() > MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE);
6572  CBlockIndex *pBestIndex = NULL; // last header queued for delivery
6573  ProcessBlockAvailability(pto->id); // ensure pindexBestKnownBlock is up-to-date
6574 
6575  if (!fRevertToInv) {
6576  bool fFoundStartingHeader = false;
6577  // Try to find first header that our peer doesn't have, and
6578  // then send all headers past that one. If we come across any
6579  // headers that aren't on chainActive, give up.
6580  BOOST_FOREACH(const uint256 &hash, pto->vBlockHashesToAnnounce) {
6581  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
6582  assert(mi != mapBlockIndex.end());
6583  CBlockIndex *pindex = mi->second;
6584  if (chainActive[pindex->nHeight] != pindex) {
6585  // Bail out if we reorged away from this block
6586  fRevertToInv = true;
6587  break;
6588  }
6589  if (pBestIndex != NULL && pindex->pprev != pBestIndex) {
6590  // This means that the list of blocks to announce don't
6591  // connect to each other.
6592  // This shouldn't really be possible to hit during
6593  // regular operation (because reorgs should take us to
6594  // a chain that has some block not on the prior chain,
6595  // which should be caught by the prior check), but one
6596  // way this could happen is by using invalidateblock /
6597  // reconsiderblock repeatedly on the tip, causing it to
6598  // be added multiple times to vBlockHashesToAnnounce.
6599  // Robustly deal with this rare situation by reverting
6600  // to an inv.
6601  fRevertToInv = true;
6602  break;
6603  }
6604  pBestIndex = pindex;
6605  if (fFoundStartingHeader) {
6606  // add this to the headers message
6607  vHeaders.push_back(pindex->GetBlockHeader());
6608  } else if (PeerHasHeader(&state, pindex)) {
6609  continue; // keep looking for the first new block
6610  } else if (pindex->pprev == NULL || PeerHasHeader(&state, pindex->pprev)) {
6611  // Peer doesn't have this header but they do have the prior one.
6612  // Start sending headers.
6613  fFoundStartingHeader = true;
6614  vHeaders.push_back(pindex->GetBlockHeader());
6615  } else {
6616  // Peer doesn't have this header or the prior one -- nothing will
6617  // connect, so bail out.
6618  fRevertToInv = true;
6619  break;
6620  }
6621  }
6622  }
6623  if (!fRevertToInv && !vHeaders.empty()) {
6624  if (vHeaders.size() == 1 && state.fPreferHeaderAndIDs) {
6625  // We only send up to 1 block as header-and-ids, as otherwise
6626  // probably means we're doing an initial-ish-sync or they're slow
6627  LogPrint("net", "%s sending header-and-ids %s to peer %d\n", __func__,
6628  vHeaders.front().GetHash().ToString(), pto->id);
6629  //TODO: Shouldn't need to reload block from disk, but requires refactor
6630  CBlock block;
6631  assert(ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pBestIndex, consensusParams));
6632  CBlockHeaderAndShortTxIDs cmpctblock(block, state.fWantsCmpctWitness);
6633  pto->PushMessageWithFlag(state.fWantsCmpctWitness ? 0 : SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::CMPCTBLOCK, cmpctblock);
6634  state.pindexBestHeaderSent = pBestIndex;
6635  } else if (state.fPreferHeaders) {
6636  if (vHeaders.size() > 1) {
6637  LogPrint("net", "%s: %u headers, range (%s, %s), to peer=%d\n", __func__,
6638  vHeaders.size(),
6639  vHeaders.front().GetHash().ToString(),
6640  vHeaders.back().GetHash().ToString(), pto->id);
6641  } else {
6642  LogPrint("net", "%s: sending header %s to peer=%d\n", __func__,
6643  vHeaders.front().GetHash().ToString(), pto->id);
6644  }
6645  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::HEADERS, vHeaders);
6646  state.pindexBestHeaderSent = pBestIndex;
6647  } else
6648  fRevertToInv = true;
6649  }
6650  if (fRevertToInv) {
6651  // If falling back to using an inv, just try to inv the tip.
6652  // The last entry in vBlockHashesToAnnounce was our tip at some point
6653  // in the past.
6654  if (!pto->vBlockHashesToAnnounce.empty()) {
6655  const uint256 &hashToAnnounce = pto->vBlockHashesToAnnounce.back();
6656  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashToAnnounce);
6657  assert(mi != mapBlockIndex.end());
6658  CBlockIndex *pindex = mi->second;
6659 
6660  // Warn if we're announcing a block that is not on the main chain.
6661  // This should be very rare and could be optimized out.
6662  // Just log for now.
6663  if (chainActive[pindex->nHeight] != pindex) {
6664  LogPrint("net", "Announcing block %s not on main chain (tip=%s)\n",
6665  hashToAnnounce.ToString(), chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash().ToString());
6666  }
6667 
6668  // If the peer's chain has this block, don't inv it back.
6669  if (!PeerHasHeader(&state, pindex)) {
6670  pto->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hashToAnnounce));
6671  LogPrint("net", "%s: sending inv peer=%d hash=%s\n", __func__,
6672  pto->id, hashToAnnounce.ToString());
6673  }
6674  }
6675  }
6676  pto->vBlockHashesToAnnounce.clear();
6677  }
6678 
6679  //
6680  // Message: inventory
6681  //
6682  vector<CInv> vInv;
6683  {
6684  LOCK(pto->cs_inventory);
6685  vInv.reserve(std::max<size_t>(pto->vInventoryBlockToSend.size(), INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX));
6686 
6687  // Add blocks
6688  BOOST_FOREACH(const uint256& hash, pto->vInventoryBlockToSend) {
6689  vInv.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hash));
6690  if (vInv.size() == MAX_INV_SZ) {
6691  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::INV, vInv);
6692  vInv.clear();
6693  }
6694  }
6695  pto->vInventoryBlockToSend.clear();
6696 
6697  // Check whether periodic sends should happen
6698  bool fSendTrickle = pto->fWhitelisted;
6699  if (pto->nNextInvSend < nNow) {
6700  fSendTrickle = true;
6701  // Use half the delay for outbound peers, as there is less privacy concern for them.
6702  pto->nNextInvSend = PoissonNextSend(nNow, INVENTORY_BROADCAST_INTERVAL >> !pto->fInbound);
6703  }
6704 
6705  // Time to send but the peer has requested we not relay transactions.
6706  if (fSendTrickle) {
6707  LOCK(pto->cs_filter);
6708  if (!pto->fRelayTxes) pto->setInventoryTxToSend.clear();
6709  }
6710 
6711  // Respond to BIP35 mempool requests
6712  if (fSendTrickle && pto->fSendMempool) {
6713  auto vtxinfo = mempool.infoAll();
6714  pto->fSendMempool = false;
6715  CAmount filterrate = 0;
6716  {
6717  LOCK(pto->cs_feeFilter);
6718  filterrate = pto->minFeeFilter;
6719  }
6720 
6721  LOCK(pto->cs_filter);
6722 
6723  for (const auto& txinfo : vtxinfo) {
6724  const uint256& hash = txinfo.tx->GetHash();
6725  CInv inv(MSG_TX, hash);
6726  pto->setInventoryTxToSend.erase(hash);
6727  if (filterrate) {
6728  if (txinfo.feeRate.GetFeePerK() < filterrate)
6729  continue;
6730  }
6731  if (pto->pfilter) {
6732  if (!pto->pfilter->IsRelevantAndUpdate(*txinfo.tx)) continue;
6733  }
6734  pto->filterInventoryKnown.insert(hash);
6735  vInv.push_back(inv);
6736  if (vInv.size() == MAX_INV_SZ) {
6737  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::INV, vInv);
6738  vInv.clear();
6739  }
6740  }
6741  pto->timeLastMempoolReq = GetTime();
6742  }
6743 
6744  // Determine transactions to relay
6745  if (fSendTrickle) {
6746  // Produce a vector with all candidates for sending
6747  vector<std::set<uint256>::iterator> vInvTx;
6748  vInvTx.reserve(pto->setInventoryTxToSend.size());
6749  for (std::set<uint256>::iterator it = pto->setInventoryTxToSend.begin(); it != pto->setInventoryTxToSend.end(); it++) {
6750  vInvTx.push_back(it);
6751  }
6752  CAmount filterrate = 0;
6753  {
6754  LOCK(pto->cs_feeFilter);
6755  filterrate = pto->minFeeFilter;
6756  }
6757  // Topologically and fee-rate sort the inventory we send for privacy and priority reasons.
6758  // A heap is used so that not all items need sorting if only a few are being sent.
6759  CompareInvMempoolOrder compareInvMempoolOrder(&mempool);
6760  std::make_heap(vInvTx.begin(), vInvTx.end(), compareInvMempoolOrder);
6761  // No reason to drain out at many times the network's capacity,
6762  // especially since we have many peers and some will draw much shorter delays.
6763  unsigned int nRelayedTransactions = 0;
6764  LOCK(pto->cs_filter);
6765  while (!vInvTx.empty() && nRelayedTransactions < INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX) {
6766  // Fetch the top element from the heap
6767  std::pop_heap(vInvTx.begin(), vInvTx.end(), compareInvMempoolOrder);
6768  std::set<uint256>::iterator it = vInvTx.back();
6769  vInvTx.pop_back();
6770  uint256 hash = *it;
6771  // Remove it from the to-be-sent set
6772  pto->setInventoryTxToSend.erase(it);
6773  // Check if not in the filter already
6774  if (pto->filterInventoryKnown.contains(hash)) {
6775  continue;
6776  }
6777  // Not in the mempool anymore? don't bother sending it.
6778  auto txinfo = mempool.info(hash);
6779  if (!txinfo.tx) {
6780  continue;
6781  }
6782  if (filterrate && txinfo.feeRate.GetFeePerK() < filterrate) {
6783  continue;
6784  }
6785  if (pto->pfilter && !pto->pfilter->IsRelevantAndUpdate(*txinfo.tx)) continue;
6786  // Send
6787  vInv.push_back(CInv(MSG_TX, hash));
6788  nRelayedTransactions++;
6789  {
6790  // Expire old relay messages
6791  while (!vRelayExpiration.empty() && vRelayExpiration.front().first < nNow)
6792  {
6793  mapRelay.erase(vRelayExpiration.front().second);
6794  vRelayExpiration.pop_front();
6795  }
6796 
6797  auto ret = mapRelay.insert(std::make_pair(hash, std::move(txinfo.tx)));
6798  if (ret.second) {
6799  vRelayExpiration.push_back(std::make_pair(nNow + 15 * 60 * 1000000, ret.first));
6800  }
6801  }
6802  if (vInv.size() == MAX_INV_SZ) {
6803  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::INV, vInv);
6804  vInv.clear();
6805  }
6806  pto->filterInventoryKnown.insert(hash);
6807  }
6808  }
6809  }
6810  if (!vInv.empty())
6811  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::INV, vInv);
6812 
6813  // Detect whether we're stalling
6814  nNow = GetTimeMicros();
6815  if (!pto->fDisconnect && state.nStallingSince && state.nStallingSince < nNow - 1000000 * BLOCK_STALLING_TIMEOUT) {
6816  // Stalling only triggers when the block download window cannot move. During normal steady state,
6817  // the download window should be much larger than the to-be-downloaded set of blocks, so disconnection
6818  // should only happen during initial block download.
6819  LogPrintf("Peer=%d is stalling block download, disconnecting\n", pto->id);
6820  pto->fDisconnect = true;
6821  }
6822  // In case there is a block that has been in flight from this peer for 2 + 0.5 * N times the block interval
6823  // (with N the number of peers from which we're downloading validated blocks), disconnect due to timeout.
6824  // We compensate for other peers to prevent killing off peers due to our own downstream link
6825  // being saturated. We only count validated in-flight blocks so peers can't advertise non-existing block hashes
6826  // to unreasonably increase our timeout.
6827  if (!pto->fDisconnect && state.vBlocksInFlight.size() > 0) {
6828  QueuedBlock &queuedBlock = state.vBlocksInFlight.front();
6829  int nOtherPeersWithValidatedDownloads = nPeersWithValidatedDownloads - (state.nBlocksInFlightValidHeaders > 0);
6830  if (nNow > state.nDownloadingSince + consensusParams.nPowTargetSpacing * (BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_BASE + BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_PER_PEER * nOtherPeersWithValidatedDownloads)) {
6831  LogPrintf("Timeout downloading block %s from peer=%d, disconnecting\n", queuedBlock.hash.ToString(), pto->id);
6832  pto->fDisconnect = true;
6833  }
6834  }
6835 
6836  //
6837  // Message: getdata (blocks)
6838  //
6839  vector<CInv> vGetData;
6840  if (!pto->fDisconnect && !pto->fClient && (fFetch || !IsInitialBlockDownload()) && state.nBlocksInFlight < MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER) {
6841  vector<CBlockIndex*> vToDownload;
6842  NodeId staller = -1;
6843  FindNextBlocksToDownload(pto->GetId(), MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER - state.nBlocksInFlight, vToDownload, staller, consensusParams);
6844  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex *pindex, vToDownload) {
6845  uint32_t nFetchFlags = GetFetchFlags(pto, pindex->pprev, consensusParams);
6846  vGetData.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK | nFetchFlags, pindex->GetBlockHash()));
6847  MarkBlockAsInFlight(pto->GetId(), pindex->GetBlockHash(), consensusParams, pindex);
6848  LogPrint("net", "Requesting block %s (%d) peer=%d\n", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(),
6849  pindex->nHeight, pto->id);
6850  }
6851  if (state.nBlocksInFlight == 0 && staller != -1) {
6852  if (State(staller)->nStallingSince == 0) {
6853  State(staller)->nStallingSince = nNow;
6854  LogPrint("net", "Stall started peer=%d\n", staller);
6855  }
6856  }
6857  }
6858 
6859  //
6860  // Message: getdata (non-blocks)
6861  //
6862  while (!pto->fDisconnect && !pto->mapAskFor.empty() && (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).first <= nNow)
6863  {
6864  const CInv& inv = (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).second;
6865  if (!AlreadyHave(inv))
6866  {
6867  if (fDebug)
6868  LogPrint("net", "Requesting %s peer=%d\n", inv.ToString(), pto->id);
6869  vGetData.push_back(inv);
6870  if (vGetData.size() >= 1000)
6871  {
6872  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vGetData);
6873  vGetData.clear();
6874  }
6875  } else {
6876  //If we're not going to ask, don't expect a response.
6877  pto->setAskFor.erase(inv.hash);
6878  }
6879  pto->mapAskFor.erase(pto->mapAskFor.begin());
6880  }
6881  if (!vGetData.empty())
6882  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::GETDATA, vGetData);
6883 
6884  //
6885  // Message: feefilter
6886  //
6887  // We don't want white listed peers to filter txs to us if we have -whitelistforcerelay
6888  if (pto->nVersion >= FEEFILTER_VERSION && GetBoolArg("-feefilter", DEFAULT_FEEFILTER) &&
6889  !(pto->fWhitelisted && GetBoolArg("-whitelistforcerelay", DEFAULT_WHITELISTFORCERELAY))) {
6890  CAmount currentFilter = mempool.GetMinFee(GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000).GetFeePerK();
6891  int64_t timeNow = GetTimeMicros();
6892  if (timeNow > pto->nextSendTimeFeeFilter) {
6893  CAmount filterToSend = filterRounder.round(currentFilter);
6894  if (filterToSend != pto->lastSentFeeFilter) {
6895  pto->PushMessage(NetMsgType::FEEFILTER, filterToSend);
6896  pto->lastSentFeeFilter = filterToSend;
6897  }
6898  pto->nextSendTimeFeeFilter = PoissonNextSend(timeNow, AVG_FEEFILTER_BROADCAST_INTERVAL);
6899  }
6900  // If the fee filter has changed substantially and it's still more than MAX_FEEFILTER_CHANGE_DELAY
6901  // until scheduled broadcast, then move the broadcast to within MAX_FEEFILTER_CHANGE_DELAY.
6902  else if (timeNow + MAX_FEEFILTER_CHANGE_DELAY * 1000000 < pto->nextSendTimeFeeFilter &&
6903  (currentFilter < 3 * pto->lastSentFeeFilter / 4 || currentFilter > 4 * pto->lastSentFeeFilter / 3)) {
6904  pto->nextSendTimeFeeFilter = timeNow + GetRandInt(MAX_FEEFILTER_CHANGE_DELAY) * 1000000;
6905  }
6906  }
6907  }
6908  return true;
6909 }
6910 
6911  std::string CBlockFileInfo::ToString() const {
6912  return strprintf("CBlockFileInfo(blocks=%u, size=%u, heights=%u...%u, time=%s...%s)", nBlocks, nSize, nHeightFirst, nHeightLast, DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d", nTimeFirst), DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d", nTimeLast));
6913  }
6914 
6915 ThresholdState VersionBitsTipState(const Consensus::Params& params, Consensus::DeploymentPos pos)
6916 {
6917  LOCK(cs_main);
6918  return VersionBitsState(chainActive.Tip(), params, pos, versionbitscache);
6919 }
6920 
6921 class CMainCleanup
6922 {
6923 public:
6924  CMainCleanup() {}
6925  ~CMainCleanup() {
6926  // block headers
6927  BlockMap::iterator it1 = mapBlockIndex.begin();
6928  for (; it1 != mapBlockIndex.end(); it1++)
6929  delete (*it1).second;
6930  mapBlockIndex.clear();
6931 
6932  // orphan transactions
6933  mapOrphanTransactions.clear();
6934  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.clear();
6935  }
6936 } instance_of_cmaincleanup;
GetDataDir
const boost::filesystem::path & GetDataDir(bool fNetSpecific)
Definition: util.cpp:485
CCoins::ClearUnspendable
void ClearUnspendable()
Definition: coins.h:121
CBlockIndex::nChainWork
arith_uint256 nChainWork
(memory only) Total amount of work (expected number of hashes) in the chain up to and including this ...
Definition: chain.h:181
CMainSignals::SetBestChain
boost::signals2::signal< void(const CBlockLocator &)> SetBestChain
Definition: validationinterface.h:58
CTxOut::nValue
CAmount nValue
Definition: transaction.h:134
GetP2SHSigOpCount
unsigned int GetP2SHSigOpCount(const CTransaction &tx, const CCoinsViewCache &inputs)
Definition: main.cpp:1031
CFeeRate::GetFeePerK
CAmount GetFeePerK() const
Definition: amount.h:55
IsFinalTx
bool IsFinalTx(const CTransaction &tx, int nBlockHeight, int64_t nBlockTime)
Definition: main.cpp:800
ReadStatus
enum ReadStatus_t ReadStatus
NetMsgType::PING
const char * PING
Definition: protocol.cpp:29
EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED
#define EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(...)
Definition: thread_annotations.h:13
SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY
Definition: interpreter.h:88
CNode::PushMessage
void PushMessage(const char *pszCommand)
Definition: net.h:793
CTxMemPool::GetMinFee
CFeeRate GetMinFee(size_t sizelimit) const
Definition: txmempool.cpp:1063
mapOrphanTransactions
std::map< uint256, COrphanTx > mapOrphanTransactions
Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate
int GetTotalBlocksEstimate(const CCheckpointData &data)
Return conservative estimate of total number of blocks, 0 if unknown.
